story:
My name is Anna. I have graduated from the Stockholm School of Economics in Riga as a Bachelor of Economics and Business Administration and have worked in advertising industry for several years. After that I have been engaged in several independent projects and have successfully established my own business. Since that I have also worked as a VJ and electronic music video director.

I have come up with an idea to publish a book of flyers when I was sorting old things, like books, notebooks etc., out  and found a collection of flyers for electronic music events that took place in Latvia. All of them had a very distinct design and reminded of the events they were created for. At that moment I have realised that flyers were playing inalienable part in every electronic music event and now are a great example of graphic design of the 90s - 00s. They also serve as a reference to Latvian electronic music culture of that period.

Flyers are not as widespread as were at those days now. They have been mainly substituted by electronic "flyers". The collections of people who have given their paper flyers for scanning amount to about 1000 pieces. All of them have been scanned by now.

The goal of this fundraising campaign is to collect the remaining 298 euro for the digital preparation of material for design and designing the book. This second step of the project assumes the work with the graphic designer, who will be in charge of the final look of the book.

NB! The indiegogo doesn't allow to run campaings with target below 500 euro. So, the campaign will be stopped when the target (298 euro) is reached. The donations above this sum will be redirected to publishing expenses.

For each contribution of 30 Euro (delivery worldwide, postal expenses included)  or 18 Euro (book is to be picked up in Riga) you will get a great book of flyers.

No strict deadlines — the project can take up to about 1 year. The publication date very much depends on your participation and you can always check the project status at: https://www.facebook.com/FlyerCollectionBook

Sincerely, and hope for your support, Anna!

story:
Hello, my name is Tia-Maria Soroskie. I am an emerging Canadian Artist, seeking funding and Arts Patronage in order to reach my professional goal of taking my art career to the next level.

VIEW LINK TO ARTIST WEBSITE:www.tiamariasoroskie.com

This past year, I have been working very hard to learn as much as possible and make professional contacts. I have attended Artist Residencies in Romania and New York with Dacia Gallery, and I was awarded a Research Drawing Residency in November 2014 at DRAWinternational in Caylus, France.

NYC Group Exhibition & the Toronto Artist Project

Two really great opportunities came out of these residencies!

This February, I have been invited to produce work and exhibit it at the:

Dacia Gallery Romania Artist Residency Exhibition 2015 in New York, NY

http://www.daciagallery.com

AND the

Artist Project Contemporary Art Fair in Toronto, ON

VIEW my Artist Profile on the Artist Project website http://www.theartistproject.com/gp_artists/tia-maria-soroskie/

VIEW Artist Project Website
http://www.theartistproject.com

The Impact
These upcoming exhibitions will allow me to continue on with the momentum I have generated in the past year, and carry me forward.

In NYC I will be able to network, establish my connections with New York Galleries, exhibit my work in a group show @ Dacia Gallery and give a professional Artist Talk to the public - all of which are valuable to my growth as a professional artist.

In Toronto, I will be able to put my work in from of 15,000 visitors at the Art Fair! This type of exposure is HUGE!!!

“The Artist Project is an exhibition on contemporary art. This exhibition is aimed at exploring the new ideas and genres of arts emerging in the modern world. Exhibitors at this event will be able to display their creations right in front of thousands of art connoisseurs and art lovers. This four day event is a perfect platform for upcoming artists to showcase their talent and become revered...”

(excerpt from Artist Project website)

My attendance in the Artist Project – a professional level art fair featuring independent artists – will allow me to connect with the Canadian and American art scene on a much bigger level than I have every done previously. It will allow me the opportunity to put my work in front of the right people – collectors, art gallery directors, curators, and agents, in the hopes of acquiring more exposure for my work and my brand, and also gallery representation and solo shows in the very near future – all critical to the next stage of my artistic development.

Funding 
I need $35,000 CAD to cover the costs associated with the production and presentation of a new body of work and travelling to/from New York and Toronto in February 2015.

All funds raised go towards immediate career development and exhibition needs:

• 8,000  subsistence/overhead expenses

• 1,000  studio space rental

• 1,600  hiring a model

• 4,000  production: art supplies - canvases, paint, presentation materials

• 3,500  crating and shipment of work (+insurance)

• 2,570   Art Fair Artist Booth Registration

• 2,500  Art Fair Booth set-up expenses, electricity, storage, packaging

• 1,000   Hiring a worker to set-up and help man the booth

• 3,000   flights to/from home-base to NYC & Toronto (+insurance)

• 3,000  accommodations NYC

• 1,750  accommodations Toronto

• 500  transportation (+cabs)

• 500  photography

• 1,800   production of marketing materials (website, business cards, postcard, catalogue of works)

Notes: 

Any funds raised over the $35,000 CAD funding goal will go towards funding a two-month Artist Residency that I have been awarded in France @ Camac Centre D’Art Marnay Art Centre in 2015. 

Any funds raised under the funding goal will go towards my ongoing art production and professional development opportunities that I need to engage in on order to take myself to the next level as a full-time artist.

Perks!

The perks range from a genuine and very heartfelt thank you and personalized artist note to acquiring an original Tia-Maria figurative graphite study or acrylic painting to start or add to your art collection today!

Risk & Challenges
I am working with a VERY short time frame. Receiving an invitation to participate in the Toronto Artist Project is a BIG DEAL! it will require me to make more work than I normally would make in a very short time frame. It also requires me to produce the right marketing materials. It also means that I need to find a way to support myself while I work in the studio but I am up for the challenge – and this is where you comes in! Your support allows an emerging artist to develop her talent and share her artwork with thousands of people.

Your Ongoing Support

If you cannot give a financial donation (and even if you can!), I welcome any and all:

·  Advice and feedback

·  Networking– please contribute & pass the campaign links along!

·  Additional Support: Purchase a piece (or two or three!) of my existing artwork to include in your own collection. Artwork on my website or attached to this campaign are for sale. Contact me directly for further information (dimensions, pricing, availability, and/or to schedule a studio visit).

·   Commissions Welcome. New Work to be completed as agreed upon, in consultation with the artist. 

I also will consider sponsorship in exchange for a financial donation. If you own or know of a business, I will advertise my sponsor’s name on website, and future publications, and on artist print materials related to marketing my business as a professional artist.

I would like to thank you in advance for your support! 

Contact Artist:

TIA-MARIA SOROSKIE, BFA (UBC O), MFA (WSU)
CARFAC British Columbia Member Artist

Studio - Kelowna, British Columbia, CANADA

www.tiamariasoroskie.com 

tia_maria_h@hotmail.com

info@tiamariasoroskie.com

1.778.214.3377

story:
Julie here,

I'm a portrait artist, illustrator, and photographer.  For years I have been covering my house with original artwork and now I want to share it with everyone!

Many people cannot afford the cost of a real piece of art, so it is my goal to fill your homes with the unique drawings and paintings that I have been working on for the last twelve plus years and am continuing to produce.  They range from comedy to landscapes to familiar and unique illustrations.

Your help will be the foundation of this campaign.  Alone, I will only be able to produce a few greeting cards at a time, but together we can fill the void in the fine art greeting card and print scene!  

All funding will go to the initial output of original art greeting cards and prints, a scale and label printer for mailing, unique packaging, and advertising.

Anyone who contributes $10 or more will get 50% off the order of their choice when Artist Ave by Julie Kersting on etsy.com opens, which will be by the end of the month of February 2015.

Thank you so much for your help and support!

Julie Kersting

story:
ABOUT

My name is Linda Storm.  I paint with Pablo Perea; we paint together on the same canvases. He is Cuban, I am American. Together we have created more than 200 works of surreal, magical art, We have gallery exhibits scheduled for NY,NY, and Havana, Cuba. We want to trade you art for your donation and use the money for travel, lodging, and insurance expenses to our July 2015 solo exhibit in NY,NY and for art supplies, travel and insurance expenses for our large exhibit in the National Gallery in Havana, Cuba. Any amount is welcome, and for a minimum donation of $75.00 you will have a choice of a work of art.

WHEN WE MET AND BEGAN PAINTING TOGETHER

Five years ago Pablo moved to rural New Mexico, into the house next-door to me and we became friends. Our artistic collaboration began during my grief over the loss of my beloved dog. Pablo invited me to paint with him, he promised it would make me feel better. We titled the painting Fate Up Against Her Will.

WHERE WE PAINT AND HOW

Our Santa Fe, New Mexico. It houses an ever-growing collection of provocative paintings: oil wells rooted to dinosaur bones, blue corn ascending, dancing trees with giant flowers, a child swinging above earthbound spirits. Some of our work is intuitive, some is carefully planned. We always paint together with respect, confidence and humility.

WHY

Our art proves that people of different cultures can communicate creatively and peacefully. It is more important than we are as individuals. We are currently painting for our NY,NY exhibit, where we will reveal 100 surreal, symbolic paintings about the impact of humans on this planet.”  “Linda and I are amazed by the ingeniousness of humans and threatened by the risks.” says Pablo. We are also astounded by the process of nature, how it revives after catastrophes.

AWARDS AND RECOGNITION

Since our first all collaborative art exhibit in March, 2014, we won first place in a New York, New York juried exhibit; and one of our paintings was selected as the cover of a scholarly book dedicated to renowned scientist Lynn Margulis. We have been invited to exhibit in New York, New York, twice; Havana, Cuba, and Chicago, Illinois. Our confirmed dates for our solo New York, New York exhibit at New Century Artists are from June 29th through July 11, 2015 and for Havana, Cuba, in January 2017.

Here is a link to a review of our last exhibit at New Century Artists, during a group show in 2014: “Their art most certainly has opened a new window on the horizon indeed for this century in art”.

You can own one of our original works of art for a value offered to no one else by supporting us in our efforts to create together and share our message. Your donation will go towards supplies and expenses for exhibits.

We wish everyone a collaborative, communicative life full of creativity and love. Please share our message. Thank you!

story:
My name is Yanna Bat Adam  and I have been Arting for the last 30 years of my life.
My art is a reflection of my evolutionary path and I love sharing it with people, inspiring and supporting them on their own path.
7 years ago, I was invited  to come to California, to perform as a musician in an intentional community focused on developing consciousness through art. In the past year and a half I was here on a Special Artist visa (O-1) and now that the visa is expiring I am asking for your support in helping me move back to my county, Israel and continue to share the message of my art from there.

I am known to most of you as The Heartist - An artist committed to share the wisdom of Higher Worlds in times of crisis and a change to a new paradigm of Loving our neighbors as we love our Self. www.TheHeartist.com www.TheSpiritualHeartist.com

After 7 years of growth and creativity I feel called to go back home, where the roots of my Heart and the inspiration of my art are present.  I have 3 grown-up kids whom I love and miss, and an 86 years old mother whom I want to support and care for.

I have deep trust that my art will be more easily celebrated, appreciated and bought in my homeland, and I long to sustain myself and give away my gifts, where they are needed and fully received.

I decided to reach out for support because I don't have the funds to move back to Israel with my art. Although I got a lot of recognition to my art and my diverse talents during the years I live here, I wasn't able to sell enough of it on a regular basis to care for my basic needs.

I need money for the flying ticket to Israel, for shipping my art and my studio, which is very costly and for the first months of settling down in Israel. Since I love win-win situations I'd like to offer you the possibility to enjoy my exclusive original art, my Heartwork, commissions and prints while contributing to me.

I see this campaign as an opportunity to widen the Heartists on our little planet.
As I see it, Heartists are people who prioritize their Heart, are courageous enough to follow it and to act upon it.

                              

I'm asking for $9050 to cover my move and build back up my funds.
Here's a breakdown:

  • Fees from IndieGogo (9% if we don't meet my goal, 4% if we do) Paypal and Credit Cards (3%) 
  • Cost of fulfilling rewards (perks in Indiegogo language)  (prints, shipping, packaging, paint, Swarovsky Crystals etc.)
  • Last month's rent in CA
  • Door to Door moving expenses of my art studio and about 60 paintings: packing, shipping, crating, insurance, papers, etc.
  • Taxes
  • Applying for a B-2 visa that will bridge my status in USA until I'll leave to Israel toward the end of June

If I meet my goal, anything extra will be used to quickly settle in Israel and start immediately to create more of my art that is so needed in times of separation and change

                                     


As time is a factor for this campaign ( I need to leave U.S on June) It will definitely create ease for me if you’ll let me intuitively choose a MiniPrint or MiniHeart for you.

Choosing MiniPrint:  If you still want to choose your own MiniPrint by yourself – Please look at my websites www.Theheartist.com and/or www.ThespiritualHeartist.com and give me 3 options of paintings you wish to receive as your MiniPrint. Leave a message here and send me the links and the name of the paintings.

Choosing Original MiniHeart: as soon as I’ll finish the MiniHearts miniatures, [Which I’ve already started to paint] I will gradually add their images to the campaign page.
I will number them and you can just let me know which one you prefer. First come, first choose.

 

 

                       

5”x7”hand made MiniPrints are mostly framed by people who buy them.

Embellished, signed Giclee print, glued gently on a white card, with an envelope in a clear bag, ready to be given to you or your loved ones.

I'll choose randomly the best match for you.
Want a special one? look at my website www.Theheartist.com and/or www.ThespiritualHeartist.com and let me know which 3 of my paintings you want to be on your MiniPrint. I'll choose one and will send it to you

U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 to your contribution for shipping outside the U.S.
Estimated delivery date : June 2015

              

This fish windsocks are from my Kiting days. It belongs to the category of wind games. It is an easy to make kit that you can paint with pastels, crayons or acrylic after you tape the two parts of the fish together. Tyvek is known to act as a strong light fabric and will decorate your room or outside, whirling in the wind for a long time.

Great for family/children gathering activity.  Instructions included.

U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $10 for outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date : June 2015

       

                      

One of a kind 3"x3", original miniature painting of our One Heart. In the dark, you'll notice a glow of my Heartful message.
I will paint them in Israel and will send it to you Max. on September.

A Surprise  MiniPrint will be added to each MiniHeart.

Please add $10 to your contribution for shipping from Israel

Estimated delivery date : September 2015

 

                    

When a friend mentioned that the 10th of May is Mother's day, I was happy for the opportunity to create this unique one of a kind project and paint 100 original numbered and signed different Hearts on 3"x3" miniature canvases. 

I give myself 10 days of extreme effort to create the most beautiful Hearts to your Dear Mothers.

I will add a Surprise Miniprint to each MiniHeart.
U.S. shipping included in price.  Please add $10 for your contribution for shipping outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date : April - May 2015

MiniHearts 2,3,11,12 are sold.


    

                          

I give you these TOP QUALITY, signed and numbered Arch paper Giclee prints almost at Cost price. They are signed with my previous name - Anicca.

I've sold most of this sequence at $300 in the past

Size: 11"x12"

Contact me  and let me know what's your choice. First come first choose.

U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $15 for your contribution for shipping outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date : May 2015

  

                                                    

Let's schedule a phone/Skype/Hangout 15-20 minutes conversation about your unique Heart in order for me to be inspired and depict the beauty of it.

I'll paint your Heart on a 6"x6" mini canvas and will send it to you WITH a surprise MiniPrint. If you wish me to add something special, tell me and I hope I'll be able to do it.

Please add $15 for shipping from Israel.
Estimated delivery date : September 2015

         

                                      

Let us arrange a 30 minutes phone/Skype/hangout conversation and you'll tell me what kind of Heart you want on a 9"x12" canvas

I will listen to your requests, feel your Heart, and bring out the beauty of it. After all we both are in the same One Heart.

A surprise MiniPrint will be added to each painting.

Please add $15 for shipping from Israel.
Estimated delivery date : October 2015 

        

                                                        

This Semi Original is was and will be a wonderful, delicate impression that people really Love. We are like a tree. Growing in both directions.
I embellish a top quality Giclee print and add a layer of sparkles that bring the final touch of light.
Signed, Limited edition, stretched.

U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $30 for your contribution for shipping outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date : May 2015

            

                             

Semi Original art is an effort to create an impression of an original painting with a top quality Giclee print.
I embellish the print with another layer of paint, add crystals , sign and varnish.
The outcome is unique, one of a kind and the painting becomes affordable.
Size:24"x10"
Signed, Limited edition, stretched.

U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $30 for your contribution for shipping outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date : May 2015

                                                           

Gifts from above is one of the paintings that I most love. It's a Grace painting that just poured out from my hand in the beginning of my painting career (Started at 2000)
This Stretched semi Original brings light to the room it is hanged at with the sparkles and the Swarovsky Crystals that decorate the tree.

I usually sell this Semi Original at $795. I am honored to give it to you at $650 as a nice give away before I leave to Israel.
Size:12"x48"
Signed, Limited edition, stretched.

U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $50 for your contribution for shipping outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date : May 2015

There are no risks for you even if I don't hit my goal. You will get your perks no matter what.

  • I'll will keep you updated every step along the way
  • You might (if you order prints, you most likely will) get your perks well before the estimated delivery date

  • Shipping is included if you are in the U.S.  For those outside of the U.S., please see the specific perk for how much you need to add to your reward.
    Some of the shipping will be from Israel.
  • If you want multiple rewards, you will have to complete the process for each reward you want, as IndieGogo doesn't let you combine them. 
  • I'll follow up with everyone for specifying MiniPrint or MiniHeart you want,  (You can also trust the universe and let me choose for you :) commission info, etc., As soon as I'll come to Israel, after settling down I will contact you for scheduling HeartWork as preparation to your HeartArt commission.

      

If you can't contribute right now, I would really appreciate any and all shares on social media.  Getting the word out about this is half the battle!  I would be so grateful for any help in that regard!  Tell your friends/followers/mom--whoever you feel might be interested in some of the perks, or who would just wanna to support

story_txt:
My name is Yanna Bat Adam  and I have been Arting for the last 30 years of my life.My art is a reflection of my evolutionary path and I love sharing it with people, inspiring and supporting them on their own path.7 years ago, I was invited  to come to California, to perform as a musician in an intentional community focused on developing consciousness through art. In the past year and a half I was here on a Special Artist visa (O-1) and now that the visa is expiring I am asking for your support in helping me move back to my county, Israel and continue to share the message of my art from there.
I am known to most of you as The Heartist - An artist committed to share the wisdom of Higher Worlds in times of crisis and a change to a new paradigm of Loving our neighbors as we love our Self. www.TheHeartist.com www.TheSpiritualHeartist.com




After 7 years of growth and creativity I feel called to go back home, where the roots of my Heart and the inspiration of my art are present.  I have 3 grown-up kids whom I love and miss, and an 86 years old mother whom I want to support and care for.
I have deep trust that my art will be more easily celebrated, appreciated and bought in my homeland, and I long to sustain myself and give away my gifts, where they are needed and fully received.
I decided to reach out for support because I don't have the funds to move back to Israel with my art. Although I got a lot of recognition to my art and my diverse talents during the years I live here, I wasn't able to sell enough of it on a regular basis to care for my basic needs.
I need money for the flying ticket to Israel, for shipping my art and my studio, which is very costly and for the first months of settling down in Israel. Since I love win-win situations I'd like to offer you the possibility to enjoy my exclusive original art, my Heartwork, commissions and prints while contributing to me.


I see this campaign as an opportunity to widen the Heartists on our little planet.As I see it, Heartists are people who prioritize their Heart, are courageous enough to follow it and to act upon it.                                

I'm asking for $9050 to cover my move and build back up my funds. Here's a breakdown:

Fees from IndieGogo (9% if we don't meet my goal, 4% if we do) Paypal and Credit Cards (3%) 
Cost of fulfilling rewards (perks in Indiegogo language)  (prints, shipping, packaging, paint, Swarovsky Crystals etc.) 

Last month's rent in CA

Door to Door moving expenses of my art studio and about 60 paintings: packing, shipping, crating, insurance, papers, etc.

Taxes 

Applying for a B-2 visa that will bridge my status in USA until I'll leave to Israel toward the end of June




If I meet my goal, anything extra will be used to quickly settle in Israel and start immediately to create more of my art that is so needed in times of separation and change                                      





As time is a factor for this campaign ( I need to leave U.S on June) It will definitely create ease for me if you’ll let me intuitively
choose a MiniPrint or MiniHeart for you.



Choosing MiniPrint:  If you still want to choose your own MiniPrint by yourself –
Please look at my websites www.Theheartist.com
and/or www.ThespiritualHeartist.com
and give me 3 options of paintings you wish to receive as your MiniPrint. Leave a message here and send me the links and the name of the paintings.

MiniHeart: as soon as I’ll finish the MiniHearts miniatures, [Which I’ve
already started to paint] I will gradually add their images to the campaign page.I will number them and you can just let me know which one you prefer. First come, first choose.
  
                          

5”x7”hand made MiniPrints are mostly framed by people who buy them.Embellished, signed Giclee print, glued gently on a white card, with an envelope in a clear
bag, ready to be given to you or your loved ones. 
I'll choose randomly the best match for you.Want a special one? look at my website www.Theheartist.com
and/or www.ThespiritualHeartist.com and let me know which 3 of my paintings you want to be on your MiniPrint. I'll choose one and will send it to you
U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 to your
contribution for shipping outside the U.S.Estimated delivery date : June 2015

with pastels, crayons or acrylic after you tape the two parts of the fish together. Tyvek is known to act as a strong light fabric and will decorate
your room or outside, whirling in the wind for a long time.

story:
Kids Art For College LLC

                             "Today’s Art For Tomorrow’s College"

Founders of, Kids Art For College LLC:

Nicole Valle (Member/Mgr)

Karisten Hinsinger (Member/Mgr)

Our Cause:

Kids Art For College LLC will create an online community that invites children from all walks of life to create an online-based artistic community.

In this community, children share their creative expressions, while recognizing the long- term value in their efforts! How you ask? Because they will simultaneously be saving for their future college education!!

Our team will display, promote, and sell children's artwork online to the masses! All child-artists earnings will go into a secure  savings account for their future college expenses!

We wish to inspire and encourage children to see how beneficial their creativity is by making it work for them! 

Every child has an imagination beyond our understanding, making all of their artwork uniquely beautiful. So, what could be  more gratifying than purchasing a  beautiful piece of artwork that supports the future college education of a child?

How it Works:

Our company will be a membership-based website.

First, Parents/ guardians sign-up their child as a member of Kids Art For College LLC.

Once signed-up, parents are ready to mail-in their children’s artwork.(As a courtesy, shipping costs will be compensated on the following membership-renewal*. Memberships are annually renewed.). 

Once artwork is received, it will be scanned using a high-definition art- scanner, and displayed on the website.

Once displayed, the artwork is then available for purchase to a nationwide network of people!

All children's  earnings will go into a secure cumulative savings account to gain interest. The interest earned on this account will be equally dispersed among all children annually. Thus, not only will children be saving for their own future, but they will be also be helping all the children in our community save for their future college education!

The original, as well as, reprints will be available for purchase. But remember, there is only one original, so that will make it more valuable than a reprint :)!

Reprints will be available in various sizes.

But that's not all!...


Sponsorships:

Additionally, we scout sponsors! Kids Art For College LLC will further promote all children’s artwork through sponsorships!!!  Sponsorships will come from businesses at an annual rate and will help promote children’s artwork through events, art shows, and other promotional strategies, such as links that can be placed on any social media site! To further achieve our desire to maximize children’s profits, sponsor funds will also directly contribute to the children’s accounts!!!

Our team will host:

- Art events,

-Art shows,

-Art seminars,

-and more!



Safety, Honesty & Privacy:

Our team will get children using their imaginations and creativity, while providing a safe (parent-approved) place for them to be inspired!

Parents/Guardians can view their child-artists sales anytime!

Parent's want the best for children and so do we! We will be transparent to maintain the best relationship with both members and customers! (As transparent as can be with the children's best interest at heart, of course.)

Our greatest priority is protecting children's privacy and we will do so with the highest of standards.

As a member of our site, children will be given an identification code so that their name remains completely anonymous. Parents can relinquish their child's identification code at their discretion.  

 Our Dream:

Our company was founded on our dream to help children! By inspiring children to use their vast imaginations and creativity, our vision of an artistic community, built by kids for kids, is on the horizon! In this community, kids can share their creative expressions, while recognizing the long term value in their efforts! Please help us reach our goal by contributing to our cause!  

Every little bit helps!  

Help us get children creating and saving!!

Our Goal:

Goal- $67,000

We are seeking funds to cover the cost of the start-up and launch of the business.

This includes:

·  First year of web hosting,

·  Initial licenses& permits,

·  business software,

·  business laptops ,

·  professional art scanner, and

·  three months of projected operating expenses

By accumulating these funds, we can launch our business efficiently and successfully!

In the event that we do not reach our goal of $67,000, funds will be distributed to the business in the order of legal requirements, start-up costs, start-up assets, and operating expenses.

Our efforts will continue! :)


Join the Cause, Donate to Our Campaign:

Together, with your help, along with the work and funds we have already put into this business, we can help all children achieve prosperity; while giving parents the peace of mind that their children will have enough savings for their future. Wherever it may take them...

Please help us make our dream a reality by donating to our campaign. 


Spread The Word:

Tell friends and family about our upcoming community!

Also, spread the word about our cause on social media sites, like, follow and share at:

·  https://Facebook.com/KidsArtForCollege?ref=hl

·  https://twitter@KidsArt4College

·  https://www.Pinterest.com/kidsartforcolle/

Coming Soon! www.kidsartforcollege.com

For any questions, information, or for pre-registration, contact us at:

KidsArtForCollege@outlook.com


WIN REWARDS FOR YOUR EFFORTS!

ANYONE CAN EARN REWARDS!! JUST SPREAD THE WORD  TO GAIN CONTRIBUTION REFERRAL REWARDS!





Last Updated: 4/1/15

Credentials:

A.A. Business Administration,

B.A. Business Administration and

B.A Psychology

Special Thanks:

We would like to give a special thanks for those who have already contributed to our cause and helping us get this far! Thank you, Tim Packard and team for the production of the video. Thank you, Justin P. for the Logo Design.

Thank you, all who have supported us along the way!

Thank you, to our future supporters!

story:
Welcome to the campaign to get SOUL Food into PRINT. This campaign is all about YOU and how YOU MAKE THE DIFFERENCE. Thank you for your contribution and participation as we raise $21,000 to get SOUL Food into Print.   Contribute any amount, as every dollar counts, and SHARE.  Every action you take within the campaign raises our GoGoFactor (the algorithm used to raise our visibility).  The Intention is to have a FULLY FUNDED campaign and Togehter, WE CAN MAKE IT HAPPEN

Hello, I am Nadine, the creator of this body of work called SOUL Food.  After surviving cervical cancer in 2004, I became seriously committed to creating a healthy life.  I learned the effect negative thoughts and emotions, as well as certain foods, had on my body and my being well.   During this process, I dropped 74 pounds from my frame and became an ambassador for health and well-being by becoming a Naturopath and Holistic Nutrition Specialist.   I have continued to grow in the past ten years, including embracing my role as an Intuitive Healer.   I work with a team of Archangels and Ascended Masters and bring them forth in Healing/Clairvoyant Sessions.  Browse the Perks to see if something catches your awareness. Please feel free to contribute any amount, regardless of what perks are offered. Now, let me introduce you to SOUL Food.

   

SOUL Food Deck One is a result of my journey. The deck is comprised of 66 cards of Soulful Nourishment for the Body, Mind, Emotions & Spirit.   Each SOUL Food card is designed to Inspire, Uplift and Motivate you, so that you can stay FOCUSED on your Goal. When you select a card, you have an opportunity to STOP, Realign with your Inner Truth, Regain your Focus, and step Forward with Clarity and Courage.

Each card allows you to create Balance, take Ownership of self, take Responsibility for self, and provide opportunities to LOVE your Self. The reverse side contains a full description or action step supporting the inspirational thought on the front of the card.

Each day upon awakening, or anytime you need guidance or inspiration, shuffle the deck and pull one card on which to focus for that day. With each new card, you may be Challenged to Grow, Inspired to Achieve Excellence or Motivated to reach a New Goal.


The prototypes for the cards have arrived.

The prototypes were created on the actual press, with our ink and paper weight. The printer took the first 5 cards in the deck and made 10 copies of each card. I used those to create the bigger picture so you can see many of them all together (remember there are 66 cards in the deck).

          

The cards measure 3 x 6 to fit nicely in your hand. They will have a layer of laminate on the card front with a UV coating on the back, to ensure they are tear resistant. The deck will retail for $15.95 USD.

     

        

 

         

         

    

  

This campaign is to raise the $21,000 needed to get SOUL Food into PRINT. I created the deck in 2005. At that time, the price quote to print 1,000 units was simply out of reach. So my dream was put on the back burner.

                              

I thought I would never see this body of work out in the world. One day, my webmaster suggested I shift my focus from printing a deck of cards, to making it available as a phone app. The SOUL Food Deck One app launched on iTunes in May 2011, and has been downloaded in 20 countries.  Any funds that come in from over-funding of this campaign will be used toward creating an app for android devices.

                                                     

Your Willingness to Help raise these funds is a MIRACLE.  To see this Dream come to life after all these years brings me PURE JOY.  I would love to see the actual SOUL Food cards in people's hands, used as conversation starters, see them in purses, hung in office work space, etc... all around the world.  It would be kewl to have SOUL Food on the #1 Best Sellers' List!!!! . Thank you for helping me make my Dream come to life.

I NEED $21,000 to make this Dream a REALITY. It is going to take a FULLY FUNDED  campaign. The monies will be used for:

  • Box Design the deck of cards will live within

  • Print set up (digital proof, printing plates)

  • PRINT 2,000 units of Soul Food deck one (decks of cards - laminated, cut, collated, boxed and shrink wrapped)

  • Ocean Freight, Marine Insurance, Customs Clearance

  • Companion Book Design and Layout

  • Companion Book Print Set up (digital Proofs)

  • PRINT 1,000 copies of the Soul Food Companion Book (laminated color cover, BW interior, with coil binding)

  • By printing the Companion Book NOW and shipping them together, we pay ¼ of the price to do them separately

  • Miscellaneous License and Fees 


I mentioned in the very beginning that I am an Intuitive Healer and a Naturopath specializing in Nutrition. So many of my perks will be about spending time with me. Together, we can shift an amazing amount of Energy during a Healing session. For more information about me and what is possible during a session, please visit http://magnificencemine.com/healingreading-sessions/

Below is a listing of many of the items that will be in the mix of PERKS. View the actual PERKS to see how they are combined.

  • Social Media Thank You Note ~ you will receive a thank you on the SOUL Food Facebook page, Google, and LinkedIn. This is HUGE as all of your friends will see this.  We will be touching lives all around the world.

  • Personal Digital Thank You Note ~ you will receive a digital thank you that will include one SOUL Food card chosen specifically for you from within the SOUL Food app.

  • Printed Thank You ~ your name will be listed in the acknowledgments section of the SOUL Food Companion Book. 

  • Download of the SOUL Food app for iphone/ipod/ipad

  • Whatever It Takes Magnet ~ receive a magnet highlighting the Whatever it Takes card

  • I LOVE Myself, I'M FREAKING AWESOME Bumper Sticker

  • Healing Session with Dr Nadine ~ receive either a 10-, 20-, 30- or 60-minute recorded Healing Session with me.

  • SOUL Food Deck One Cards ~ receive your own deck of the cards. For INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING, please add $25 to your gift.

  • SOUL Food Deck One Companion Book~ receive a copy of the Companion Book. For INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING, please add $25 to your gift.

  • SIGNED copy of SOUL Food Deck One Cards ~ receive your own SIGNED deck of the cards. For INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING, please add $25 to your gift.

  • SIGNED copy of the SOUL Food Deck One Companion Book~ receive a SIGNED copy of the Companion Book. For INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING, please add $25 to your gift.

  • Meditations by Dr Nadine ~ choose  an mp3 Meditation about: Creating Abundance, Centering Yourself  or Creating/Manifesting in Your Life

  • Basic Nutrition Plan ~ receive a digital copy of a Basic Nutrition Plan

  • Specific Nutrition Plan ~ receive a digital copy of a Nutrition Plan created specifically for YOU


I believe we are each here to Make A Difference in the world, and that difference begins within each of us. When I like myself, I open the door for the person next to me to like themselves. When I appreciate myself, I provide a mirror so the person next to me can discover their self-appreciation. Likewise, when I LOVE myself, there is an "allowing" that happens for the person next to me, to find LOVE within themselves. Together WE Make The Difference.

My intention is that everyone who sees, touches, handles, prints, delivers or shares SOUL Food, will receive a Healing on some level (physically, mentally, emotionally, spiritually). As we share SOUL Food and this campaign, we will be sharing an Abundance of Happy, an Abundance of JOY, an Abundance of Well-being.  By Giving, someone gets to Receive. By Receiving, someone gets to Give. We all make the difference. Every click, comment, contribution, and share goes into an algorithm to raise our GoGoFactor.  You can help to raise this GoGoFactor.

With each and every contribution you make, with each and every share you do, we co-create our world with an Abundance of HAPPINESS, JOY, and WELL-BEING.


I need this to be a FULLY FUNDED campaign. That is the major hurdle. Once I know we have reached the $21,000 goal, I will give the green light to the print team. The entire process will take three months,

 I anticipate I will be able to ship (within the United States) the cards and companion books to you in September. Additional time will need to be factored in for all International shipping.

I stated above that the SOUL Food Deck One app has been downloaded in 20 countries. That means folks want to Feel GOOD about themselves. I want to reach a larger audience. I want to reach people who do not have a iphone or ipad. I want to reach the folks who love having a tangible deck of cards to shuffle and play with.it is going to take a fully funded campaign, so LET'S GO FOR IT!!!!


If you are unable to contribute to this campaign financially, you can still help in so many ways. Here are a few ideas:

  • Add your Energy. My intention is that this Campaign will be fully funded. Visualize this happening with me, SEE SOUL Food in PRINT. Visualize SOUL Food on the #1 Best Sellers' list.

  • Help me get the word out. Share the campaign link http://igg.me/at/soulfood on your social media platforms, mailing lists, websites. Please add a bit about how you know me, or your experience with the cards. Let's get folks exCiTed about this campaign.

  • Use the share tools provided by Indiegogo.  Every click, comment, contribution, and share goes into an algorithm to raise our GoGoFactor.  When our GoGoFactor is HIGH, IndieGoGo will see this campaign and move us into a more visible position

  • If you are willing to have a banner on your website, please let me know. I will provide you with two banner options and the campaign URL. You can then link the banner directly to this campaign.

  • Provide a Video or Audio Testimonial. As mentioned above, many of you have been using the SOUL Food app on your iphone or ipad. I would LOVE to share your experiences with the world. Send me a video or audio clip on how YOU  use the cards, how they are allowing you to shift and stay focused on your goals. I will combine all of your testimonials into a video and add it to a campaign update.

  • Talk to me about selling the  SOUL Food  cards and companion book in your store or place of business.  Let's discuss retail rates.

  • Invite me on a Radio Show, Podcast, etc ~ we can discuss how LOVE is the Path to Conscious Healing and highlight SOUL Food and this campaign.

  • Tell your local TV stations about SOUL Food and this campaign.

  • Blog about the campaign, invite me to your blog, invite others to blog about SOUL Food

  • Share your favorite SOUL Food card on your social media page 

  • Invite your Newspaper to write an article about SOUL Food and this campaign.

  • Let me know if you have other ideas on how to share SOUL Food with the world and THANK YOU for helping me get folks exCiTed about this campaign


Each color within the artwork on the SOUL Food cards has meaning.  Violet represents the transformation and transmutation of Energy.  For those of you who follow Energy, St Germain holds this Violet Flame.  Pink represents the Sacred Heart where we reconnect to our Higher Self.  In the center of the image you see a Golden Column of Light; this is the Column of Light we each stand within as we become the connection to Heaven and Earth.  I presented my 'conceptual' ideas to Amy Laner of ANJO Designs, and she is the heart of the visual design of these cards.  As a talented and versatile graphic designer, Amy adds the spark to SOUL Food with her flare for color, shape and style.  I LOVE what Amy has created for all of us to share.   Amy can be contacted at amy.n.laner@gmail.com

more to come about WHY there are 66 cards.


Ways the deck of SOUL Food cards can be used:
* Pick a card a day, a week, an hour
* Pick a card to start a conversation
* Pick a card when you are ready for a SHIFT
* Pick a card when you are ready for a CHALLENGE
* Pick a card when you need SUPPORT

The deck was Joyfully created with lots of Permission for you to Explore new options that will open doors and Allow Harmony into your life.

I want to thank EVERYONE who contributed to making this dream come true. Your edits, feedback and LOVE have allowed this project to come to fruition. From the bottom of my heart, a Huge THANK YOU !!!! ~ Nadine
story_txt:
Welcome to the
campaign to get SOUL Food into PRINT.  This campaign is all
about YOU and how YOU MAKE THE DIFFERENCE. Thank you for your contribution and participation as we raise $21,000 to get SOUL Food into Print.   Contribute any amount, as every dollar counts, and SHARE.  Every action you take within the campaign raises our GoGoFactor (the algorithm used to raise our visibility).  The Intention is to have a FULLY FUNDED campaign and Togehter, WE CAN MAKE IT HAPPEN

Hello, I am Nadine, the creator of this
body of work called SOUL Food.   After surviving cervical
cancer in 2004, I became seriously committed to creating a healthy
life.   I learned the effect negative thoughts and emotions,
as well as certain foods, had on my body and my being well.  
During this process, I dropped 74 pounds from my frame and became an
ambassador for health and well-being by becoming a Naturopath
and Holistic Nutrition Specialist.   I have continued to grow in the past
ten years, including embracing my role as an Intuitive
Healer.   I work with a team of Archangels and Ascended Masters
and bring them forth in Healing/Clairvoyant Sessions.  Browse the Perks to see if something catches your
awareness.  Please feel free to contribute any amount, regardless of what perks are offered. Now, let me introduce you to SOUL Food.    

SOUL Food Deck One
is a result of my journey.  The deck is comprised of 66 cards of
Soulful Nourishment for the Body, Mind, Emotions & Spirit.  
Each SOUL Food card is designed to Inspire, Uplift and
Motivate you, so that you can stay FOCUSED on your Goal.  When you
select a card, you have an opportunity to STOP, Realign with your
Inner Truth, Regain your Focus, and step Forward with Clarity and
Courage.

Each card allows you to create Balance, take
Ownership of self, take Responsibility for self,
and provide opportunities to LOVE your Self.  The reverse
side contains a full description or action step
supporting the inspirational thought on the front of the card.
Each day upon awakening, or anytime you need guidance or
inspiration, shuffle the deck and pull one card on which to focus for that
day. With each new card, you may be Challenged to Grow,
Inspired to Achieve Excellence or Motivated to reach a New
Goal.



The prototypes for the
cards have arrived.
The prototypes were created on the actual press,
with our ink and paper weight.  The printer took the first 5 cards in
the deck and made 10 copies of each card.  I used those to create the
bigger picture so you can see many of them all together (remember
there are 66 cards in the deck).            The cards measure 3 x 6 to fit
nicely in your hand.  They will have a layer of laminate on the card
front with a UV coating on the back, to ensure they are tear
resistant.  The deck will retail for $15.95 USD.                                             
This campaign is to raise the $21,000
needed to get SOUL Food into PRINT.  I created the deck in 2005.  At that time, the price quote to
print 1,000 units was simply out of reach.  So my dream was put on the back burner.  

                                
I thought I would never see this body
of work out in the world.  One day, my webmaster suggested I shift my
focus from printing a deck of cards, to making it available as a phone app. The SOUL Food Deck One app
launched on iTunes in May 2011, and has been downloaded in 20
countries.   Any funds that come in from over-funding of this campaign
will be used toward creating an app for android devices.                                                      Your Willingness to Help raise these
funds is a MIRACLE.   To see this Dream come to life after all these
years brings me PURE JOY.   I would love to see the actual SOUL
Food cards in people's hands, used as conversation starters, see
them in purses, hung in office work space, etc...
all around the world.   It would be kewl to have SOUL Food
on the #1 Best Sellers' List!!!! .  Thank
you for helping me make my Dream come to life.I NEED $21,000 to make this Dream a REALITY.  It is going to take a FULLY FUNDED  campaign. The monies will be
used for:


Box Design the deck of cards will live within 

Print set up (digital proof, printing plates)

PRINT 2,000 units of Soul
	Food deck one  (decks of cards - laminated, cut, collated,
	boxed and shrink wrapped)


Ocean Freight, Marine Insurance, Customs Clearance 



	Companion Book Design and Layout 



	Companion Book Print Set up (digital Proofs)


PRINT 1,000 copies of the Soul
	Food Companion Book (laminated
	color cover, BW interior, with coil binding)

By printing the Companion Book NOW and shipping
	them together, we pay ¼ of the price to do them separately

Miscellaneous License and Fees  



I
mentioned in the very beginning that I am an Intuitive
Healer
and a Naturopath
specializing in Nutrition.
 So many of my perks will be about spending time with me. 
Together, we can shift an amazing amount of Energy during a Healing
session. For more information about me and what is
possible during a session, please visit http://magnificencemine.com/healingreading-sessions/ Below is a listing of many of the items that will be in the mix of
PERKS.  View the actual PERKS to see how they are combined.


Social
	Media Thank You Note ~ you will receive a thank you on
	the SOUL Food Facebook page, Google, and LinkedIn. This is HUGE as all of your friends will see this.  We will be touching lives all around the world.


Personal
	Digital Thank You Note ~ you will receive a digital thank you
	that will include one SOUL Food
	card chosen specifically for you from within the SOUL Food
	app. 
	


Printed Thank You
	~ your name will be listed in the acknowledgments section of the
	SOUL Food Companion Book. 


Download of the SOUL
	Food app
	for iphone/ipod/ipad 


Whatever It Takes
	Magnet ~ receive a magnet highlighting the Whatever it Takes
	card


I LOVE Myself, I'M
	FREAKING AWESOME Bumper Sticker 


Healing Session with Dr
	Nadine ~ receive either a 10-, 20-, 30- or
	60-minute recorded Healing Session with me.


SOUL Food Deck One Cards
	~ receive your own deck of the cards.  For INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING, please add $25 to your gift.


SOUL Food Deck One Companion
	Book~ receive a copy of the Companion Book.  For
	INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING, please add $25 to your gift.


SIGNED copy of SOUL Food

Meditations by Dr Nadine ~

Specific Nutrition Plan

story:
The Dream.

It starts with a dream. 

To make them come true it takes a lot of hard work, dedication, perseverance and seizing of opportunities. 

My name is Kat.  I’m a Los Angeles based fine artist and I’ve been pursuing painting for the past five years.  I do the best I can in order to push my creations forward, but I've come to realize that my lack of academic ability is preventing me from successfully translating my ideas onto the canvas. 

I decided to go back to school and found that the Repin Academy in St.Petersburg, Russia was where I wanted to study.  Through a long and arduous process I finally got the approval and invitation to attend and my next step was to finalize my Visa. 

That's when I got robbed. 

All the money I was saving for my education, practically my life savings, jewelry and my legal documents were gone in one sweep.  This changed many things in my life. 

I'm not ready to give up yet.

 I set out to expand my education, and I’m giving it one more shot... but I need your help. 

 This time I’ve decided to stay in Los Angeles.  

If you can donate to help me fund my studies in any amount I will be forever grateful.  In exchange for your kindness I have devised a reward system. Please feel free to check it out and reach out if you have any questions. 

If you can't donate and would like to help in some other way, that will, of course, be very appreciated as well.  

Please spread the word.

  • In San Sebastian, Spain, painting a small copy in a museum.

The Art.

My art is my the ultimate outlet.  My paintings, photographs, and journals are more than simple stills and scribbles of my surroundings.  To me, they convey with fidelity moments of my life story and the people I was with.  They are meticulous compositions narrating my goals, views, observations, philosophy and psychology.

The Goal.

What I intend to gain from my education is broader understanding and ability to execute fundamental basic and advanced artistic concepts allowing me to create with confidence.

Ultimately I would like my fine art to develop its own distinct visual language and to gain the ability to translate personal moments and modern concepts of the intricacies of society into my developing body of work which will hopefully transcend my own time.

My Career.

So far in my professional, fine art career I've been featured in multiple gallery and museum shows, won some awards and have been included for three consecutive years in the highly selective California Art Club Gold Medal Show. In addition, I’ve been interviewed and published in various art books and magazines.  Currently, I'm being represented by Abend Gallery in Denver, Colorado, Preferred Plants in Rochester, NY and work extensively with California Art Club in Los Angeles. 

  • In an interview on RadioTv.


  • 'Portrait in White', oil on canvas, 16"x20" featured and sold at the 103 California Art Club Gold Medal Show. 

The Education.

I've chosen the L.A. studio, Safehouse Atelier founded by Carl Dobsky to continue my education.  He is very prominent within the entertainment and fine art industry, as well as having the reputation of an excellent educator.  My goal is study there for the full suggested enrollment time of two years. 

The funds I am requesting will cover a single year of my education, the materials necessary for the course, specialty artist workshops and transportation. ($8,400 tuition, $2,400 materials,  $2,200 specialty courses, sculpture, anatomy, composition, etc, $2,000 transportation) In the event of a surplus, the excess donations will go to funding my second year at the atelier. 

The Art Materials.

My medium of choice for my sketches is pen and ink.  This work is very time consuming since it's based on precisely placed, tiny lines.  One small project can easily run over the course of a week.  I do take advantage of exploring pencil, charcoal, watercolor and gouache as well. 

Sculpting is my favorite hobby.  So you’ll see me working on something from time to time.  I enjoy working with soft and medium hardness oil based clay. 

My paintings are done on board or on linen which are hand stretched and primed. I use oil paints and work from both life and photographs.  My paintings are also labor intensive as I do sketches, small value studies and small color studies as I prepare for the final piece.  There have been times when a patron has not only kept the final product but requested to purchase the studies as well.  In such cases, I have obliged.  

  • Pen and ink drawing; 'Seated Male', 11"x10"


  • Portrait Sculpture Study; 'Ryder'.


The End.

Happily ever after?  Well, we all aim for that… I should ask the Dalai Lama about it sometime.  Meanwhile, I will seek to make a dream into reality, for the act of creating is the purest form of bliss i can fathom.  

Be a part of the dream, make it happen, make the difference. 

Please feel free to check out my website for my work; http://kathiucia.com/

My blog has the artwork options in my reward system and more general info regarding my artistic journey;

http://kathiuciaart.blogspot.com/

My facebook for random updates; 

https://www.facebook.com/kathiucia.dias

and my instagram for more examples of my work;

https://instagram.com/kathiuciadias/

Safehouse Atelier;

http://www.safehouseatelier.com/

  • Plein Air Painting in Malibu.

story: My first year at burning man, the only mobility device I brought with me was my manual chair. It would often get stuck in the sand. Thus, I had difficulty getting around without the help of my camp mates. Then last year a few of my friends helped me to design a modified golf cart that I could drive myself and be fully independent around burning man. This year, I wish to take the Dream Car back to burning man and I need your help to raise $1000  in order to transport the Dream car to and from burning man. Additionally, the Dream Car needs a little bit of work so we can add more 'bling /artistic' design to the golf cart to make it a really nice looking art car. My goal is to raise $2000 in total. This includes: $1000 for transport and $1000 for artistic design improvement. Thank you for your support of The Dream Car Project.

story:
Who are we...

We are Changing Face Collective; a visual arts and theatre collective of like-minded individuals who find art a valuable and resourceful way of expressing political perspectives. We create art to reflect the changes happening within the communities we live and work in. 

Our Collective is ever-growing; we are always interested in collaborating with other Lambeth-based artists. Specialising in theatre, film, illustration and photography, we are interested in showcasing them in unusual spaces. 

Our next project...

We have embarked on our next Project, ’Changing Face’, which responds to Brixton's and, indeed, Lambeth's changing face as a community, specifically reacting to the mass evictions of social housing tenants and shop-owners. Across Lambeth, six housing estates are threatened with demolition and thousands of people face eviction along with hundreds of independent businesses that define Brixton’s multiculturalism.

A documentation and celebration of Brixton’s past, present and future, this project combines photography with film and verbatim theatre. We want to create an immersive experience taking the audience on a journey, virtually and theatrically, to meet the people directly affected by these changes. 

The Collective is conducting in-depth interviews with over 100 people and organisations and a resulting verbatim script will be an authentic account of the interviewees’ experience of eviction through ‘neighbourhood improvement’, delivered in a simple yet theatrically-compelling way.  

Where will it be...

This piece will be delivered in a mixture of locations, from unusual spaces to theatres, to attract a new public. A few of our venues include:

  1. An evicted shop on Brixton Station Road -once an independent store, is now an empty shell waiting to be turned into a chain store earning high rents for its evicting landlord, Network Rail. 
  2. A social housing flat on Cressingham Gardens which hasn’t been lived in for years despite a housing shortage.
  3. A car-park in Peckham
  4. Bussey Buildings
  5. PRSC, a multi-purpose art venue in Stokes Croft, Bristol

Our project will be taken on tour to areas such as Hackney, Peckham, Camden and Stokes Croft, Bristol. 

We need your help to make this project a success and for it to be taken on tour around London and other cities. This is so that Lambeth's voice is heard along with areas where similar changes can be seen and to highlight to these communities that they are not alone. 

We need your help...

Your contribution, small or large, will go towards:

- Rehearsal Spaces

- Venue Hire

- Leaflets

- Programmes

- Photography film

- Lighting and filming equipment

- Script-publishing and more 

We want our work to be available online and in libraries - as a form of documentation so those in the future can learn from - and we want the information we have gathered to be easily accessible. 

Please give what you can as we really appreciate your support.

Meet the team...

Lucy Curtis – Director: 

Lucy trained as an actress and has worked predominately in theatre, most notably, at the Bristol Old Vic, The Tobacco Factory, the North Wall, and the Arcola. Lucy enjoys writing, and developed her playwright skills through the Royal Court's Young Writers Programme. Her first full-length play, 'From the Lane', responded to the 2011 Tottenham Riots, and focused on the lives of four young people living on Broadwater Farm Estate on the day leading up to the evening of the riot. It was performed in 2014 after completing a summer residency at the North Wall under the direction of Artistic Director, Lucy Maycock and Artistic Director of the Awake Project, Christopher Sivertson. Lucy is currently training as director at the Islington Community Theatre. She is a Roundhouse Emerging Artist. 

 Ivana Mazza - Co-founder & theatre-maker: 

After graduating with a BA in Drama: Theatre, Film and Television at University of Bristol, Ivana is part of an associate theatre company called SCRAM which specialises in Physical Theatre and Black Comedy. Ivana leads the company’s choreography and works collaboratively on their own scripts. They have a residency at the PRSC (People's Republic of Stokes Croft), an arts space in Bristol’s cultural quarter. Ivana has experience working with Verbatim Theatre whilst adapting and performing in Steve Gilroy's Verbatim piece 'Motherland' and Mike Daisey's 'The Agony and Ecstasy of Steve Jobs'. Ivana was selected to dance for Ballet Rambert and received training for two years.

Elisabeth Winkler – Playwright: 

Elisabeth Winkler is a freelance journalist published in all the UK broadsheets and was a video interviewer for genocide survivors. Magazine editor for the Soil Association for eight years, she is also a food campaigner. An award-winning writer and blogger, she was a press officer for the No Tesco in Stokes Croft campaign in Bristol, where the first 2011 UK riot took place.

Rohina Cameron-Perera - Producer: 

Rohina is the co-founder and an artistic director of the non- profit organisation ‘The Wave’ which host regular events addressing ecological issues through the visual arts including a collection of photography from The National Geographic. Rohina also currently works in events and marketing for The Galapagos Conservation Trust.  

Dashti Jahfar - Photographer:
Dashti Jahfar is a Brixton based photographer and graphic designer who recently graduated from Camberwell College of Arts with a BA in Graphic Design. He works extensively within local communities in London producing images based on the human existence within public space. Primarily a street photographer, his work is a documentation of the characters and feeling of community life.
 

Gaurab Thakali - Illustator & Associate Artist:

Gaurab Thakali is a South London based illustrator and printmaker who recently graduated from Camberwell College of Arts with a BA in Illustration.Upon graduating in September 2014 Gaurab received the People of Print Graduate Print Award and was one of Its Nice That’s 2014 Graduates of the year.

Alex Kurunis - Photographer

Flora Duley - Film-maker

Tom Brennan - Associate Artist

Deepraj Singh - Movement Director & Associate Artist

Simon Elmer - Poet and Film-maker

Photography credits: All by Dashti Jahfar

story:
Short Summary

*The Girls is a group of young Greek artists consisting of:

Persefoni Nikolakopoulou

Giota Georgopoulou

Thalia Zachariadou

Eleni Oikonomou

Fotini Kalle

They first met on June 2013 during a performance workshop taking place in Athens with La Pocha Nostra. They met again in April 2014 and performed together in public and private spaces in Athens with the support of the international group Non Grata . The Girls usually work independently but occasionaly their inspirations meet leading their actions to risky public interventions and other challenging site specific performances. (Picture above: Performing  in front of the Greek parliament as a response to the political situation in Greece).

The interaction between their energies create a unique opportunity for actions that demand decisiveness, alertness and will to serve any good idea within sort notice.

Responding immediately to the environment, the people and the unfolding everyday stories, they can create large scale, experimental and humorous performances  using found materials or old transitory props and objects.

This spring the group is invited in Estonia to participate in Diverse Universe festival 2015 (The invitation follows below), and The Girls need to fund their trip since it’ s not included in the budget. And as you all know Greece is experiencing a huge financial crisis wich exclude any support to artists or artistic events, specially when they don’ t take place in the country itself!


Formal Invitation from Diverse Universe festival 2015 in Tallinn, Estonia:

Dear THE GIRLS!   

We hereby invite you to participate in Diverse Universe festival 2015.

Your invitation includes live performances in every destination, holding workshops, lectures and demonstrations. Festival Starts in Estonia: Tallinn Art Hall April 15th, Tartu Art Hall April 16th and Pärnu Museum April 18.

Diverse Universe is meeting point of performance art and world wide network. Diverse Universe is annual nomadic performance festival since 2005. It travels through the- East-South-West and North Europe with artists of every continent. The aim is to bring experiments, non-conformism and creativity back to the contemporary art. Diverse Universe is an exemplary example of a trans-European project that pools the resources of national organizers around Europe to create one of the largest Performance Art and Live Art festivals in Europe and deliver extraordinary value for money for the arts across Europe. Beyond just being a festival, Diverse Universe forms a large-scale trans- European artist-run network equipped with the expertise to respond to the needs of European performance makers and to activate cultural exchange at a European level. Diverse Universe works in partnership with performance art organizations across Europe to develop networks. As well as presenting their own high quality work, during the festival participating artists also take part together in workshops, collaborative performances, seminars, and discussions. All these activities promote cultural fluidity through exchange of ideas, concerns and cultural perspectives. The scale and duration of Diverse Universe allows for a deep and meaningful interdisciplinary cross-fertilization between artists from different nationalities that pushes the boundaries of contemporary performance art practice, and in turn excites audiences with new work that is affective, thought-provoking and responsive to our current times.

We hope all the relevant institutions of your country would support your participation to help us to make this event possible.

Sincerely yours,

Al Paldrok

Curator of the event

GSM +3725015672

paldrok@gmail.com

http://nongrata.ee/

http://diverseuniverse2014.free.fr

What We Need & What You Get

The possibility for the group to accept this invitation is ambiguous since the flights are expensive plus multiplied by 5, the number reaches the amount of 1500 euros!

If you feel generous today contribute to make our plans come true and donate. Even one euro is crucial for The Girls! And when we come back, a souvenir will be send to you if you wish to receive one. We can send you an artefact, a signed picture or a video of one of our site intervention in the Estonian cities. We are also open and we invite you to take part in our future performances!

The Impact

Your support on this Project enables its existence to continue. You will help us to overcome our cultural isolation and express our ideas and thoughs to other countries by getting more people involved in our performances.

During our two performances  in front of the Greek parliament  we realised the power of our medium to transform the everyday, the passing by, the ignorant from passive to active, from spiritual lethargy to creative thinking and acting. 

We believe in performance as a way to communicate without hiding who we are, to absorb without leaving anything out and to create without immitating others. 

Risks & Challenges

The risk for us is to loose this unique opportunity to participate for the first time ever in an international venue!

 The risk for you is to end up spending your euros in less procuctive ways! 

Other Ways You Can Help

 Just because you can't contribute financially doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Click on Share!

story:
What is Dark Labyrinth Entertainment?

Greetings, friend! We are Dark Labyrinth Entertainment: a company established in the Buffalo, NY region that brings together artists, creators, students and passionate entertainers to create personal, theatrical, awe-inspiring experiences for our patrons. We forge these experiences on the unique, spirited energy of the Halloween season. With Halloween as our foundation, it gives us unparalleled creative license; the possibilities are endless!

Who are we?

With over 14 years of experience in the haunt industry, celebrating Halloween is just the beginning. It’s the people that really make the vision of Dark Labyrinth come to life. Dark Labyrinth Entertainment was founded by owner, lead organizer and Halloween aficionado Mike Raisch. At 13, Mike began to successfully organize annual charity haunts in his backyard. He took this passion on to college at the State University of New York at Fredonia by creating a self-designed Bachelors Degree in Halloween Entertainment Business. Since then, Dark Labyrinth Entertainment has been put on the map during the past two Halloween seasons by creating a revolutionary, immersive 4D-theatre-style audio experience. These past projects have all been diverse in their subject matter and appearance, yet they all have one thing in common: bringing people together!

And that’s what Dark Labyrinth is all about: community, creativity, education and entertainment. We are here to offer something different. As our culture shifts, we understand that experience-based entertainment is the next generation of fun. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $10,000 with IndieGogo, although the entire haunted house project will take about $88,000 to make happen. $10,000 will get us started and give us the capital needed to take out a loan for the grand total. Even in the event that the goal is not reached, the project will still move forward! The greater the contribution, however, the greater the final product will be. No matter what the end result, every single dollar and dime will go toward making our haunt the most detailed, high quality, immersive experience for everyone! 

The funds will be broken down as follows:

$13,000 for Marketing: used to spread the word about our haunt in unique, intriguing and professional ways.

$20,000 for Leasing and building expenses: used to land the perfect space for our construction needs to give you, our patrons, the safest and best possible experience. 

$30,000 for Materials: used to obtain raw materials for set building, props, costumes, technical effects and even proper equipment to ensure everyone’s safety.

$25,000 for Employees: used to properly compensate our talented builders, actors, designers and hardworking helpers.

$88,000 Total


There are so many ways you can help!

Pledging now will get you admission tickets at a discounted rate ($20 value for single admission).

You can receive a t-shirt with the face of our most admired character, Jasper Von Lure:

Or a Dark Labyrinth Novelty Keyring Bottle Opener:

You could choose one of these beautiful Dark Labyrinth-inspired quality canvas prints:

We have some IndieGogo exclusive deals including a photoshoot on set with professional make-up at a great price. 

(Photo by RJ Raisch)

You can also become part of the story by becoming one of our serial killer’s victims! People are just dying to play a role!

The Impact

We have been running successful haunts since 2001 when we raised money for 9/11 relief efforts through the Haunted Backyard project. Until now, these projects have been on a relatively small scale. We’ve contributed to charities like Make-A-Wish and other smaller local charities. But even while small, we’ve been able to achieve over $13,000 for charity within 5 years! This means that with your help, we can make an even bigger impact on the local demographic that will drive support for even greater charity efforts in the future.

Education and creativity are fundamental to our company. That’s why, in an effort to spread the power of creativity, this coming Halloween season’s event will be the result of a Master’s Project in conjunction with the Creative Studies program at Buffalo State College. That being said, we also believe education and creativity are fundamental to the community and the world. We want to continue to support the ideals of education and creativity as much as possible! One of the ways we plan to do this as a company is to establish scholarships that we can award to students  who are using their education to follow their dreams. 

Our vision is about something more than just a Haunted House. Dark Labyrinth Entertainment is setting out to be a beacon for creativity, education and self-expression. Sometimes the best place to find the light of self-expression is in the creative, haunted darkness! And we’re here to prove that this creative journey is a fun one. It’s all about helping individuals find their light in a world that can sometimes overshadow them.

Risks & Challenges

There is always risk in creative endeavors because inherently we are trying something totally new. The biggest challenge will be changing the way Buffalo perceives Halloween Entertainment. In our area, people have been accustomed to going to a haunted attraction that has the most haunted houses because you feel you get the best bang for your buck. It has been this way for as long as haunted houses have been in the area. Our job is to show Buffalo that more does not mean better. You generally wouldn’t go to the movie theatre to watch as many short films as possible. A single epic movie is more effective and gives you more to think and talk about. It’s the overall quality of the experience that matters! Additionally, our experience will take the same amount of time that it would take to go through four or five shorter ones. It will take some adjustment for the Buffalo patrons to buy into this concept, but we are confident that once people start to experience our novel haunt, the word will spread like wildfire.

(Photo by Brian Machelski)

Up to this point, all of our haunts have been on real estate that did not require a lease because it was in our backyard or on a school campus. This time we will be in a building all on our own and there will be many learning experiences along the way (i.e. building permits and safety requirements, etc.). We are working closely with the Small Business Development Center on the Buffalo State campus to ensure we cross our t’s and dot our i’s. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are SO grateful for every possible way you can contribute to our project, even if it isn’t financially. Word of mouth is the most powerful marketing tool! Recommendations to your friends are like gold. We want to build a community around this and the only way to do that is to gather more people! Use the tools provided on this page to share with your social networks if you believe in our cause. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Tell your artistic friends that we are looking for artists to showcase their work, or give us a shout if you have a creative contribution for us to consider! Tell small business owners that there may be an opportunity to have a small, seasonal venue at our location. Tell students that we are looking for help in return for experience in the professional world of entertainment. Most importantly be creative, love all that you do and share positive energy wherever you go! From all at Dark Labyrinth Entertainment: THANK YOU!
