Short Summary

Hi! Thanks for taking a look at our campaign. My name is Anlezia Moné Venter. I created this story, developed and wrote the script, am currently busy in pre-production as Executive Producer, and later on, I will star as the protagonist in my first original screenplay: MATA HARI. I am currently in my last semester as a BFA Acting student at NYFA with full talent-based scholarship. 
In order to graduate, for part of my Thesis, I am to write, develop, produce and star in a short film. I was inspired by the story of Mata Hari. She was an undercover spy and exotic dancer in WW1, mainly in Paris. She was executed by firing squad in 1917, and her case was ordered to be sealed shut by the French Government for a 100 years. Next year, thus only, will the alluring mystery surrounding the infamous Mata Hari, be cleared up. Life is hard and unfair, and people like Mata Hari take the fall for government mistakes everyday. This is a tribute to her life. 

​

My film is a fictional interpretation of Mata Hari, a jazz singer and undercover spy, who was betrayed and turned into the government by the only man she wasn't with just to get information. She fell in love, and paid the ultimate price for it. 

It is important to me to tell this story to honor the memory of Mata Hari and what a celebratory, unapologetically beautiful woman she was. Up until her last moment, she chose dignity. She chose to express herself freely, instead of bowing her head and accepting defeat - despite the unjust things that happened to her.
On her last day, facing a firing squad of 12 soldiers, she refused to be tied to a pole. She wanted to look the soldiers who were about to shoot her, in their eyes. She removed her blindfold, blew a kiss to the soldiers and was shot dead. This is what my film will revolve around - her last moments and what lead up to that. 
With your generous support and donations, this tribute could be made a reality. With the funds raised, not only will I be able to finish this project I've been working on for months, and graduate with a BFA degree, I will also be able to have a film of high quality that I will be able to submit to numerous film festivals and share this beautiful tragedy, as well as gain exposure from the storytelling veterans in this industry - actors, directors, producers we all look up to. 
The exposure of this film will ultimately help me in the application for my O-1 Artists Visa, a visa that will allow me to work as an actress in the United States, which is a lifelong dream. 
When successful as a short film in the festival circuit, I also dream to develop this story into a feature film; Mata Hari's story is so rich and beautiful, I am extremely passionate about giving her life more than 5 minutes of tribute, (when we get there). 

But for now...

What We Need & What You Get
Films are really expensive to make, no matter the size. This is technically a no-budget film, however, below follows a breakdown of the funds we need to make this vision a reality. 



Meals & Craft Services: The very hardworking crew and cast need to refuel their energy!

Props: Our story is set in WW1, thus to make it look beautiful, we need a lot of 'period' props. 

Costumes: To truthfully convey the 'world' the story is set in, accurate costuming is essential. 

Set-Dressing: The set-dressing incorporates and completes the world wherein the story is set. In a period piece, it is essential for all the detail of the set time period to be represented as accurately as possible. 

Transportation & Travel: Firstly, We need to transport all the equipment and props from Cape Town to the town the locations are in. Furthermore, Principal Photography is scheduled for South Africa, because we found an absolutely amazing crew there, and production costs are lowered significantly, but first we need to get there. 

Equipment: To make the film look great, we need camera and lighting equipment. 

Hair & Make-Up: A lot of detail goes into making the cast look like they're from the 1910's. 

Film Festivals: Believe it or not, film festivals average about $40 - $50 per festival. Screening this film at festivals around the world to industry professionals, will make the months of hard work and all the funds worth it. 

Insurance: For the safety of everyone involved on set as well as the wonderful equipment, production insurance is required to make sure we don't have any unwanted surprises. 


Contingency: Despite months of meticulous planning, unforeseen things always come up. 

If we don't reach the minimum funds goal, we will put the raised funds firstly towards absolutely essential set-dressing and props. All raised funds will go toward covering costs of making this film. 

Fee - Indiegogo fee for raising the money. 


Risks & Challenges
There are numerous amounts of daily challenges involved in creating and producing a film, but everyone involved by making and funding it can be sure it will get made before this year is over. #'nboermaak'nplan.

Other Ways You Can Help
Thank you so much for donating to this campaign, we will be ever grateful to you. If it is not within your means, we absolutely completely understand. Please hep us gain support by sharing this project on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, or calling up an old friend! Any and all help is much appreciated.

The Vintage Whimsy Tour 

While I HAVE saved for months and I will be staying with family, dear friends and friends of friends along the way, there will no doubt be unforeseen expenses which come up during any expedition and that's why I've spent the past few weeks and MANY hours putting the video pitch together.

story:
Film Synopsis: 

While standing at the altar, a couple's past troubled relationship is reflected during the ceremony, before the final, "I Do".

The year is 1925, and the Harlem Renaissance, which kicked off in 1917, is in full swing. There are timeless works of art – music, literature, everything – released constantly, and the people in Harlem know it, know that they are a part of something important, something historical. At the same time, they continue to live their lives, caught up in the moments just as we are all caught up in the moments of our own lives. Harlem Love is the story of two lovers during this period.

Humble Beginnings

Hey what’s up family? My name is Richard Joseph and I’m a writer and director from Brooklyn, New York. I teach physical education at a private school helping to shape the physical wellness of the young generation. Also, I’m a personal trainer dedicated to teaching on how to build and sustain your best health. However, I not only like to shape the body but also contour the mind.  Hence, which sparked my love, passion for black history, and stories stretching my brain beyond any training I implemented. So, I became an independent filmmaker and screenwriter who started out acting in small roles in student films at NYU and Brooklyn College.  Whilst acting in those films, my passion for filmmaking was ignited and fueled with the purpose to educate and raise the consciousness through relevant cultural stories. So the journey as a filmmaker began by writing scripts and taking filmmaking courses and workshops.

As a Harlem Renaissance historian and expert, I'm super excited to tell you about my film Harlem Love.

In Harlem Love, I offer my perspective on what it takes to be married.  Set in the 1920's a young couple meet and their relationship is instantly tested. They struggle to find the strength to stay together, ultimately deciding their fate at the altar. I have timed the release of this film for February 2017, the 100-year anniversary of the Harlem Renaissance. In order to celebrate our collective history and culture, I will be screening Harlem Love at an all-inclusive event, showcasing the art bequeathed by this important period in American history.

How You Can Help 

So, I shot Harlem Love out of pocket from my hard earned money from teaching and personal training. I had a very supportive cast and crew who worked for free and shared their resources. However, at this point we are at post-production and that is very costly. Here is where I need a mass village support to assist in raising $10,000 to finish this film and cover the cost for editing, color correction, sound, marketing, distribution, and festivals expenses.

In return for your contribution, we're offering perks that include onscreen movie credits, Facebook shout outs, exclusive digital downloads, DVD of film, storyboard (PDF), personal training, tee-shirts and many more. 

We know times are hard economically. If you can’t contribute, please know the power in spreading the word.  By sharing this campaign with 10 people it will sprout the information to those who may be interested in supporting and surpassing our goals to make this film.  Please don’t hesitate to use social media and use the share buttons built into this indiegogo site.  We thank you in advance for making this a success.

See you at the screening,

Richard Joseph & Harlem Love Team

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our Amazing Fundraising & Production Team:

Yvette Joseph - Producer/Costume Designer/Actress for Harlem Love

YVETTE "PHEONIX" JOSEPH is a costume designer/writer/producer/actor extraordinaire. A few of her credits include Wardrobe Assistant for Sponge Bob Squarepants Live photo-shoot for Broadway Asia Entertainment, wardrobe supervisor for “Wapato” a play at The Julia Miles Theater for The Women's Project, wardrobe assistant and performer for the theater production of  Cirque Arabesque “A Thousand and One Nights” at Manhattan Movement & Arts Center. In 2009 she produced and performed in her very own dinner theater show called Mistresses of Spice, which incorporated 3 live bands and 3 dance acts. Her current projects are producer/costume designer/actress in Harlem Love (currently in post-production), where she has received tremendous accolades for capturing the style of the Harlem Renaissance period.   Additionally, Phoenix is directing her highly anticipated science fiction screenplay Don’t Forget to Breathe, which is in pre-production and she is writing her first animated feature film The Great Bone Caper. 

Nadhege Ptah - Producer/ Actress for Harlem Love

NADHEGE PTAH is an actor/writer/producer/director of film, stage, and theater. She has starred in several leading and supporting roles and has worn many hats for various productions. Backstage, Harlem Times and Off-Off Broadway Review have acknowledged Ptah’s riveting performances and writing skills. Ptah is founder and CEO of Harlem-based production company MAAT Films. Her work attempts to shed light on social injustices while igniting change in many American communities. Her current projects include: the award winning film as a producer, writer, actress in DoDo TiTi continues the festival circuits, producer/actress in Harlem Love in post-production, directing She Loves music video in pre-production, co-writing a pilot for a South African TV drama, and writing the short film Paris Blues in Harlem. Ptah is a member of SAG-AFTRA, AEA, Black Documentary Collective, Frank Silvera Writers Workshop, and NYWIFT.

Lisa Bacon - Co-Producer/Line Producer for Harlem Love 

LISA BACON is a director/writer/editor/actress/producer of film. She is originally from Los Angeles and has been involved in the entertainment industry for over 10 years. She has performed various roles on numerous film sets, including as a production assistant on the independent short film Treasury Men in Action and later for the Universal Studios feature, Public Enemies. Lisa co-directed and edited the feature film Delville, in which she also acted as director of photography and was eventually featured in the UW Film Festival in Wisconsin. She has received an honorary mention from the World Nomads Travel Film Documentary Series for her documentary work on human trafficking and at-risk youth in Senegal. Her current projects include directing and editing two upcoming music videos as well as a lead acting role in a 10-episode crime-drama pilot series entitled Sham. She is also a co-producer for Harlem Love now in post-production.

story:
PHOTOS OF THE PERKS

To order a perk, click on the corresponding box to the right

(THE STORY is below the perks) 

                                                             

                                                      

         

                                                 

  

 

  

                                               

     

                                  

                                                  

                                              

                    

                                                 

THE STORY

Thanks for visiting my Indiegogo campaign to raise funds to film a short documentary on the art of Giving Beauty and to bring income to the tribes in a famine zone in Omo Valley, Ethiopia as well as other artisans throughout Ethiopia who need the income.

About me I’m Lori Precious, one of the few Americans to have ever lived in Mogadishu, Somalia when my dad was with USAID. This singular experience created my lifelong love of East Africa. I grew up to be a fine artist, filmmaker and now, entrepreneur. I have travelled to Kenya, Tanzania, Lamu, the Seychelles and Ethiopia.

                                          

I now have a family of my own living in Topanga, California. After the birth of our son, we adopted a 2 year old Ethiopian daughter who is now 12. Since the adoption, I’ve gone on many journeys to Ethiopia, my 5th trip is next month.

About Ethio Sky Last year, I did a successful Indiegogo campaign to raise funds to launch my company, Ethio Sky,  helping artisans in Ethiopia earn income by selling through Ethio Sky.

While on that trip, I became captivated by a vanishing tradition practiced by tribeswomen in ancient Omo Valley who paint decorative patterns on their huts in a tradition known as Giving Beauty, which is passed from mother to daughter.

                                                

The tribes live in one of the most desperately poor parts of the world and have been gravely affected by the current and historic famine. They desire to give the same things to their children that we do—enough food, good health and an education with a bright future.

                                               

Ethio Sky partnered with some of the Giving Beauty artists. We pay them for paintings we commission them to paint on muslin, we pay a license fee to print their patterns on textiles which we then sell on our website. We send them money from sales even before Ethio Sky is profitable.  In this part of the world, people earn an average of $1.75 USD per week. For just a few days of work last year, the Giving Beauty tribeswomen have each earned approximately $500. USD. As you can imagine, this new income from Ethio Sky has transformed life for them and their families. The positive effects of this infusion of money ripples into the larger community.

Ethio Sky also helps an Omo Valley orphanage and we have just granted our first college scholarship to a Suri tribesman who lives in the most remote part of Omo Valley.

What now? I return to Ethiopia in July 2017, to film a short documentary on Giving Beauty, to preserve their art. I will also bring more tribeswomen into the collective so more and more can thrive and survive the famine. I am also pre-selling other beautiful Omo Valley tribal crafts as well as the work of other Ethiopian artisans.

Please find something you love in our incentives and buy yourself or someone else, the meaningful gift of Giving Beauty.  It's never too early to buy for the holidays!

Thank you for your generosity and kindness to those less fortunate but no less deserving. Together, we can help end or alleviate suffering by the simple act of a purchase from Ethio Sky.  

“Women and girls have a unique power to reshape societies. When you invest in a woman’s health and empowerment, it has a ripple effect, helping families, communities, and countries achieve long-lasting benefits...The path out of poverty begins when the next generation can access quality healthcare and education.”

--The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation research

The Budget, The Ask

Short Documentary

1000. Camera equipment purchase, rental and luggage fees

  500. Assistant/DP

1500.  Editor/Mix

  500. Music score

  500.  Misc

4000. TOTAL 

Travel to Omo Valley (it is an 11 hour drive to Omo Valley from the capital of Addis Ababa)

1500. Driver. guide. hotel, food, gratuity and misc expenses 2 weeks.

Product purchase in Ethiopia

2000.  Pay the Giving Beauty women to make more paintings. Pay for beaded necklaces, belts,                 journals, leather goods and more. Contribution to Omo Child orphanage.

7500.   TOTAL

You can also make a tax deductible donation through Creative Visions a 501c3 non profit. Please email me at loriprecious@ethiosky.com for information.

Thanks for reading and considering helping the less fortunate but no less deserving by making a purchase from this campaign.

Follow my adventures on IG: ethiosky or Facebook: Ethio Sky Scarves

With gratitude,

Lori

story:
Short Summary

Erinn Kathryn and Jen LaMastra, two accomplished Portland based artists, have teamed up to create the Little Free Gallery Project. 

Little Free Gallery Project converts twenty "little free libraries" throughout Portland into miniature galleries exhibiting art installations for the duration of one month in summer 2016.

Twenty amazingly talented local artists have been assigned a library box somewhere in Portland's east side. Working with the library box owner, each artist will create a new site-specific piece. The project culminates with a bike/walking map tour designed by Jen and Erinn that allows the community to explore and find the Little Free Galleries around the city. 

Help keep Portland Weird!

With the ever changing landscape of Portland and the growing population, it is important to foster that which made this city great; keep art flooding the city and available to all.  It is Erinn and Jen's wish to offer a unique creative opportunity for artists to show their work, and to engage the community in a fun free-- quirky experience.  

Your financial contribution will give each artist a small stipend to create their work. It will help defray the printing costs of our free walk/bike map, and help sponsor a full-color exhibition catalog including artist bios, photos, artist statements.  Your funds will also support our launch/exibition party on June 17 at the Lightbox Kulturhaus.


What We Need & What You Get

Simply put, we want to pay the artists for talents, time and commitment.  We want to provide those free printed maps , and we want to host a launch party to generate hype and participation.

Here is a more detailed break down of the numbers:

20 artists X $50 = $1000.

Printing 1000, full-color double-sided tri-fold maps: $379

Printing 50 full-color catalogs @7.57 each: $378

Renting launch party space: $250

Food and beverages: $200

Graphic Design/Photography/Curatorial/Admin : $300


As a Thank you for your fiscal support we're offering some very exciting perks.

• An autographed map of the Little Free Galleries by all participating artists.  (Who knows your funding could make those signatures worth oodles! )

• A 2-3 hour guided bike tour.  Adventure around the neighborhoods with one of us and learn behind the scenes info about the different art installations.

• VIP Launch Party invitation: get a chance to eat and drink to your hearts content, while rubbing elbows with the library owners and artists, see behind the scenes process footage of the artwork and the galleries, and receive a complimentary commemorative full-color exhibition catalog.

If we raise above and beyond our goal, we'd love to pay the artists more for their hard work and dedication. ;)

The Impact

Little Free Gallery Project strives to provide exhibition opportunities for emerging Portland artists, with a focus on generating opportunities to show temporal, site-specific, non-commodifiable work; work for which we believe Portland has an ongoing deficit.  The artists we have selected stem from a range of media and disciplines- from painting to metal work, video to wearable sculpture- for a breadth of style, theme and concept.  For many of them, installation will be a new and exciting challenge.  

Since this project exists in residential neighborhoods, it is possible or one to "stumble across" a Little Free Gallery. We anticipate viewers who are not specifically seeking an art experience- those who are not generally "gallery-goers". We embrace the opportunity to provide greater exposure for local artists that do not have [traditional] gallery representation. We wish to foster community connections the would not otherwise have existed.


Other Ways You Can Help

It's important for us to reach our goal.  If you think this project is as rad as we do, please share this with your friends and help support this project.

story:
Check out my work at http://illustrationmeg.com

Our Story

Hi there, my name is Megan Jones and I am a member of the Kestrel Clay dynamic duo, along with my fiance, Chad Collins. I just completed the MFA in Illustration Practice at MICA, while Chad has an MAT from the University of Central Missouri. We are both teachers and ceramic artists based in Baltimore, MD looking to develop our business and teaching practice.  We are both dedicated artists who have recently begun expanding from private sales and limited gallery representation to small markets and festivals. 

 The Kestrel Clay Throw-Down is our way of having fun and reaching out to the wider online community. I was especially excited at how well my home town teams did this year, and Chad came up with a brilliant idea: Our own competition! We will each run an independent campaign to see who can raise the most funds toward getting us to the NCECA conference this year in Kansas City, MO. In the end, we will pool our funds together, but the winner gets bragging rights and the loser gets a bucket of muddy clay dumped on their head (with a video of course so that you can enjoy it as much as we do! Hopefully i'll be the one dumping clay on Chad's head, since again it was his ever so brilliant idea). 

What We Need & What You Get From Us!

We need $1300 bare minimum to travel to Kansas City March 16-23 to participate in NCECA's annual conference. NCECA (The National Council on Education for the Ceramic Arts) is a massive gathering of the minds, with a city full of galleries and venues filled with amazing ceramic work.  This venue will give us access to international artists, organizations, residency opportunities, and vendors that will help guide us along the path of successful art entrepreneurs. It is THE conference for those in the ceramic arts to learn, share, and make new contacts.

To get there, we will need: 

$600- Round Trip Flights for two

$700- 4 day Conference Passes for two

We are fortunate enough to have family in the area, who are graciously letting us crash in our (Megan's) old bedroom. So housing for the event is free! Lucky us! 

Any additional monies raised beyond these needs will go toward the development of Kestrel Clay as a solvent business. This would include but not be limited to advertising, and building toward studio materials such as a raku kiln and decal printer for examples.  

  • What do you get out of this? - Based on the level of your support to either of our campaigns you will receive a unique one of a kind reward made by the artist you choose to support.  
  • For Supporting Team Megan you will receive: 
$1- A thank you email from both Chad and I!
$10- A hand-drawn doodle postcard that will be sent to you in the mail!
$25- A small painted tile approximately 3"x4"(I choose the animal! You tell me Anthropomorphic or Not! Then sit back and let the magic happen. Will it be a Victorian Chameleon? Or a chubby Koalo chomping on some leaves??)
$35- A Black Deer Planter (Limited to 5!)


$40- Illustrated Hanging Planter (You choose the image: Daisy, cactus, or lily pads!)


$50 - A small illustrated bottle (Your choice of animal!) Approximately 5-6" tall


$80 - A Large illustrated bottle (Your choice of animal!) Approximately 8-9" tall


$100- A low-relief illustrated tile, hand sculpted and painted by me! You can request a character or animal, or leave it up to my creative devices! Approximate size will be around 5"x7" to 6"x8" by 1/2"-1" thick. 


$250- Custom Pet Sculpture. Sized for Table top, roughly around 8" tall.


$250- [Baltimore Area Only] Come work in the Potters Guild with me! I'll teach you how to hand-build animals and figures in clay. This will be 6 sessions, with a finished piece at the end! Wowza!  

To See what Chad is offering (hiss) go here!
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/kestrel-clay...

The Impact

Your contribution will make is possible for us gain access to a larger world of artists and craftsmen. Many who have already made their mark on the world and are willing to show us the way.  This research trip will make us better artists and better teachers.

Risks & Challenges

We are both incredibly devoted artists, whose passion for making drives us in the studio all hours of the day and night. reaching our goal as well as sharing our gifts is a joy and a privilege. Any support you can spare will help us reach our goal. With ceramics, there is always risk, such as a piece cracking or glaze failures, but rest assured, we will work through the night if it means giving you a great product. Even if the campaign isn't funded, we will still create all of the artwork owed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, (and we totally understand) but that doesn't mean that you can't help:

  • Make some noise, spread the word about The Kestrel Clay Throw-Down share with your friends and decide who will get the bucket of mud.
  • Don't forget to share us on Facebook, twitter and the rest of the internets.

Thank you so much for your time!

With ceramics, there is always risk, such as a piece cracking or glaze failures, but rest assured, we will work through the night if it means giving you a great product. Even if the campaign isn't funded, we will still create all of the artwork owed.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, (and we totally understand) but that doesn't mean that you can't help:

Make some noise, spread the word about The Kestrel Clay Throw-Down share with your friends and decide who will get the bucket of mud.
Don't forget to share us on Facebook, twitter and the rest of the internets.


Thank you so much for your time!

story:
HELLO! 

Chances are that if you're reading this, you know us. Maybe not well, but at least a little bit. For anyone who is completely unfamiliar with who we are and what we're up to, let us try and fill you in below with a snippet about ourselves AND this fundraising campaign:

One of us (Owen) is a born and raised Maritimer, the other (Carly) has Prairie roots, yet strong family ties to Grand Manan, New Brunswick - a small island situated in the ever magnificent and mysterious Bay of Fundy. 

This island is where we live together. 

We keep busy with various tasks and pursuits of interest - the main one being organizing and presenting a small, seaside music festival every August. In conjunction with the Festival, there is one thing we have been working towards that we just cannot do alone: Finish construction on what will become the Summer's End Folk Festival (SEFF) Artist-in-Residence Shed.

In short, this campaign is brought to you by a young couple with a vision for enhancing the arts on an already amazing island. We are offering different incentives to those interested in exchange for the funds necessary to complete construction on the space by the beginning of June, 2016.

THE SCORE

As with any building / renovation project, determining an exact amount is tricky. Often, additional costs arise as the project moves forward. However, we have received estimates from several professionals .. The ballpark breakdown is below:

New Tin Roof ($1000) / Flooring ($500) / Small Loft ($250) / Insulation 

($700) / Siding ($1000) / New Door + Frame ($400) / Chimney + Installation 

($200)  = $ 4,050 + X amount of hired professional help @ $30 / hr 

$1,000 has already been sunk into windows and labour. We are trying to raise an additional $3,500 to help pay for remaining material costs and hire professional help!

This is where YOU come in. We are not asking for money in return for nothing - Quite the opposite. We have put together various, unique packages that you can purchase, of which all money raised goes towards the shed! 

It's super simple: If something on our perk list tickles your fancy, make the suggested donation online and we'll mail it OR arrange a delivery in person. You may even choose to come stay in the shed yourself this summer - we'll pay for the ferry! 

The full list of perks is on the side ---> 

THE IMPACT

By contributing to this campaign, you are helping to ensure that we get the job done right, and are able to open up the space sooner than later. By welcoming practicing artists of all mediums into our village, we feel the exchange will be beneficial not only to them, but the entire community.

Ultimately, our understanding of exactly how this will make a positive impact is something which will reveal itself once it begins. In essence, we'll find out as we go along. 

That said, we have no doubt that this ongoing project will yield positive results. We hope to entice more young, creative people to the island who will draw inspiration from it, giving back to the community and themselves in turn. 

NO MONEY? NO WORRIES.

If you have viewed our campaign and are unable to make a financial contribution, no worries. The fact that you took the time to read through this is appreciated. If you know other folks who may be interested in helping, by all means, spread the word. We all know that in this day and age it's easy for information to spread far and fast - and we're not opposed to that! Feel free to share this campaign online, telephone an old friend, write a letter to your pen pal, or whatever else you are willing and able to do that may help. THANK. YOU.

By contributing to this campaign, you are helping to ensure that we get the job done right, and are able to open up the space sooner than later. By welcoming practicing artists of all mediums into our village, we feel the exchange will be beneficial not only to them, but the entire community.


Ultimately, our understanding of exactly how this will make a positive impact is something which will reveal itself once it begins. In essence, we'll find out as we go along. 

That said, we have no doubt that this ongoing project will yield positive results. We hope to entice more young, creative people to the island who will draw inspiration from it, giving back to the community and themselves in turn. 



    NO MONEY? NO WORRIES. If you have viewed our campaign and are unable to make a financial contribution, no worries. The fact that you took the time to read through this is appreciated. If you know other folks who may be interested in helping, by all means, spread the word. We all know that in this day and age it's easy for information to spread far and fast - and we're not opposed to that! Feel free to share this campaign online, telephone an old friend, write a letter to your pen pal, or whatever else you are willing and able to do that may help. THANK. YOU.

story:
A new creative studio

Multicoco is the first physical project of the Gato Naranja Creative Studio. It started as an art piece shown in galleries and after a positive reaction from the public, we decided the idea could reach a lot more of people. Made meticulously by hand Multicoco is almost a magical object.  Our goal is to have enough orders which will allow the two current members of the studio to devote full time to develop new physical or virtual projects. Your support will help us bring this and other magical objects to reality.

(multicoco at the regional hall of arts 'Corrosivo' on cartagena, Colombia)

Multicoco

Inside of the handmade coconut shell, there is an android TV device which has all the functionalities that a regular Android TV would have. You can simply plug Multicoco to your TV and watch movies, play games, surf the web and much more

It has one hdmi port for video/audio output. Two usb ports, wifi and bluetooth connection, it is powered through a five volts power adapter, the board runs on a Qualcomm® Snapdragon™ 400 with 1gb of ram and 8gb of storage (expandable with a sd card).  

Every multicoco package includes: 

Multicoco is a hand made tech/art piece for those who look for interesting objects, why would you settle with the conventional when you can have the magical?

 

The Process

An actual coconut is handpicked from a palm tree on Maria La Baja and then brought to our shop in Juan de Acosta where we take it apart, cutting the coconut shell carefully on two parts. Then, the shell spends the next day drying and being curated.

Once dry and curated, the shell is drilled and the interiors are sanded to accommodate all of the electronics. Every coconut is hand assembled and individually tested so we keep quality standards high, as we don't consider Multicoco a consumer product but an art piece.

  

Rewards

By pledging $ 10 you help us make our creative studio a reality plus your name will be displayed on a Thank You page on the studio`s website so your support will be remembered forever. ​

You can get a Muticoco by pledging $249 USD to the campaign. The first batch of up to 50 units will be shipped in February 2017 (Specific day to be determined). A second batch of up to another 50 units will be shipped on May 2017 (Specific day to be determined). Any other Multicoco orders will be shipped on the second half of 2017.

The reason for the cost and time frame is related to every Multicoco being handmade in our shop and the materials and tools required to make them, from the coconuts sourced locally to the importation of the android boards to colombia and the carefull factory of the multicocos, it is a work of passion and love for the handmade crafts.

Shipping costs:

shipping costs are a flat fee of $39 to anywhere on the world. 

 

The studio:

Gato Naranja is a new creative studio currently conformed by two people. The focus of the studio is to create hardware and software projects that people can play with. We are filled with incredible ideas and want to make them a reality, Multicoco is our first step towards that goal. 

We have been working on several electronic and software commercial projects under the wing of Emerge Tecnologías but now we want to do what we are really passionate about, that is how El Gato Naranja Studio came into the picture, and with your help we can make that happen.

story:
Short Summary

In July 2016 artists and (entry)level explorers Simon Pruciak and Alexandra Reddaway are departing for a year long journey around the world on motorbikes.

The objective for the trip is to generate art work which explores the concept of creative geographies (the relationship between Geography and the contemporary Visual Arts)  and through participation of different social groups globally to explore this concept through arts education.

Several galleries worldwide already committed to exhibit the work.

The whole journey will be documented through professional photography and video and the progress will be published on regular basis through vlog, blog and social media throughout the journey.

Upon return, alongside the exhibitions of the art work, Simon and Alex will also publish a book (a Hamburg based publisher has already been secured) and produce a film.

Contributors like you will help to make this project a reality.


What We Need & What You Get

We will sleep in a tent or on people's couches (couch surfing), and we saved money for food and we have motorbikes, we do not have the money for the fuel though and this campaign is going to help us to generate funding needed. For two of us travelling for 50 000 km we need £5k. If we do not reach the entire goal we are still going ahead and will need to get seriously creative en route with funding. Through supporting us you support art and education.

Have a look at some of our perks, there is a wide selection of ideas for you to pick from to be a part of the project in a big way, you choose!

The Impact

The concept of Creative Geographies is a very unexplored territory and by researching it, we are contributing to the wealth of Human Knowledge. The educational side of our journey allows those, who live in environments which make it impossible, to have contact with art education. 

Risks & Challenges

Many things can go wrong, we can be robbed, get an 'exotic' disease, or crash somewhere. We're of course doing anything we can to pre-empt these by planning, consulting, getting insurances, but of course there is always a moment, when one has to give up... be sure though this will only happen if the worst happens to one or both of us...

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help financially maybe you can share the campaign with others who can, please use the Indiegogo share tools...or have us at your sofa when we pass by your place...maybe we can share a meal together too?

story:
Who is Gallager Goose

Gallager Goose is my newest creation. He is a high energy, fun, boisterous character for our new line of children's books. The purpose of Gallager is to entertain children with humor and rhyme while teaching wonderful lessons about faith and God's love. This first book "Leaving Mopertoperville" creatively teaches a lesson on the power of forgiveness. He is perfect for grade school aged children 4 to 9 years of age. He's being brought to life through not only books and EBooks, but music cd's and downloads and of course the talking stuffed animal (plush) "Word Power Gallager" who speaks 20 different  life and faith affirming phrases when you press his tummy, which kids will love.

What We Are Asking

We are asking to raise $25,000 to help us build the Gallager Goose brand. We are looking to make him commercially appealing while teaching positive morals and values to young people. This campaign is to help us finalize our launch. We are using the money to create product inventory, administrative support, and provide legal fees for trademarking and copyrighting, as well as continue the series with the next titles. 

How This Is Beneficial

The purpose of this campaign to provide children with a character they can admire with the morals shared by the likes of Veggie Tales and the high level of creativity and wit of Dr. Seuss. Children will be able to relate to Gallager Goose on both the entertainment and faith based levels for which he is intended.

Risks & Challenges

We understand the competition in the world of children's entertainment and the reality that parents are looking  for contemporary entertainment for their children not only entertainment with a faith  undertone. That is where Gallager Goose shines. Through my years of writing both greeting cards and children's material, I have seen that there is a void in the world of children's entertainment that forgets to incorporate the faith based with the highly entertaining and creative (like seen in  Veggie Tales). I am looking to fill that void and allow children to benefit from the messages of Gallager Goose both spiritually with faith values and emotionally with wit and creative bling.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute to our campaign. However, if you cannot contribute, please share our campaign with those who will benefit or would be interested in learning more.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! my name is Luis Vasquez La Roche and I'm a  Visual artist born in Venezuela and I live and work in Trinidad and Tobago. I recently got invited by Beta Local* to be part of their Itinerant Seminar in August. The Itinerant Seminar is a seminar-on-foot for artists who are interested in aesthetics, art, images and language in relation to land, geography, built structures, industrial and military devastation, freedom of movement and migration. This year the route is along the western coast of Puerto Rico from the southwestern tip, Cabo Rojo, to the northwest, ending in Aguadilla.

Being part of this seminar will help my research and interest on migration, landscape, geography, borders and the relations between the English speaking and Spanish speaking Caribbean. I am looking forward to attending this seminar as it is an opportunity to develop my practice and research outside of my immediate anglophone context. The interests of seminar organizers align with current concerns in my practice and I am excited for this opportunity.

You can see samples of my work here (click on the word "here" =P).

*Beta-Local is a non-profit organisation dedicated to supporting and promoting aesthetic thought and practices through various programs.

Photo Credit: BETA LOCAL - Beatriz Santiago Muñoz

What I Need & What You Get

My total budget for international travel, seminar fee, meals, camping gear, American visa and expenses is around US$2200. I would love your help in raising US$800. I would be able to handle the rest of the budget on my own.

I have some attractive incentives for supporting. I have created a few Perks specifically for this campaign. A series of  4.13" x 5.82" postcards from my 2013 "Found in Time / Re-interpreting  Space". 


I have also made available a few (limited) drawings from my 2015 series "365"

     

Note: All perks will be delivered in September 2016*

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to my cause financially that's ok! You can support in other ways - please spread the word about the campaign to your friends. The Indiegogo sharing tools make it easy to spread the news over social media.

Thank you for your support.

Lots of love,

Luis Vasquez

story:
My name is James Mapes and this book is the result of more than three decades of working as an  international speaker &  consultant, personal and executive coach, researcher, hypnotherapist and author of bestseller Quantum Leap Thinking: An Owner's Guide to the Mind.  

     My dream and passion is to help everyone live a productive and passionate life and, therefore, make their own positive impact on the world.  Now, here is I vehicle to expand the reach and impact the world.

     After more than 13 years of research, working with top editors and partnering with Greenleaf Publishing, IMAGINE THAT! Igniting Your Brain for Creativity and Peak Performance is a reality - with a publishing date of October 4, 2016. 

Advance praise by 19 major bestselling authors and celebrities is outstanding.

Here are two examples: 

"James Mapes is the rare coach who can both impart knowledge and turn that knowledge into insight and action. "IMAGINE THAT!  Igniting Your Brain for Creativity and Peak Performance" is a wise and powerful book that can help anyone use the world's oldest values to unlock life's newest opportunities."

-Daniel H. Pink, Author of, Drive: The Surprising Truth About What Motivates Us, A Whole New Mind,  and To Sell is Human

"After reading James Mapes' "IMAGINE THAT! Igniting Your Brain for Creativity and Peak Performance", I have taken his advice on practicing Love-Centered Communication and it works!  What a gift this book was to myself.  It is a must-have for everyone!"

-Ann Rhoades, President & Founder of People Ink, Author of Built on Values.

     Interest from Barnes & Noble, Ingram and Baker & Taylor is solid and the marketing/distribution is in place. 

     Now, I need your help to publicize this unique book because, in today’s world, passion alone is not enough to ensure success.  I need a team to make this a reality.

         My goal is to raise $75,000.00 for a major nine-month promotion of the book.  I need your help to make this happen.

     I have listed 12 dynamite, experiential perks ranging from $10.00 upwards.

    There is zero risk.  My intention is to give you more than I'm asking.  This will be self-evident when you review the perks.

     Thank you for your support and welcome to the journey in to the imagination!

     I hope you can contribute AND I ask you to spread the word!

Warmest,
James

story:
We are a collective of 50 emerging make-up artists with a range of skill sets, varying from fashion, prosthetics, theatre and wig-making.

We have all been working incredibly hard during our final year at the Arts University Bournemouth and would love to share our work with you. We are all extremely passionate about our craft and we want to create a graduate show that will help launch us into industry, providing a positive end to our studies while setting us up for a new beginning. The aim of this crowd funding campaign is to support us, 50 students, in showcasing our work. 


Why we need your help

The funds raised will cover costs such as our brochure. This will not only be a personal memento for each student but will more crucially be used to promote students work. This will contain examples of each students work along with contact information which will be sent to potential employers. This will be an excellent promotional resource which will aid us in finding work as graduates.


The Grad Show

This year we are exhibiting in the Gallery at the Arts university Bournemouth. we are incredibly lucky to have this prestigious space to show off our work, and we really need some funding for high quality printing, vinyl lettering and any additional costs which come with installing a high quality, professional exhibition.


Lastly a group of us are demo-ing at the biggest makeup trade show in the country. Any extra funds raised will go towards promotional materials at this event.



Please give as little or as much as you'd like, we'd really appreciate it. Every single penny counts!!


Thank you so much!

story:
[ENGLISH VERSION BELOW]



L’association Krasis Orchestra organise un chantier bénévole du 17 au 28 août à Gorodka, lieu d’art insolite construit par Pierre Shasmoukine. Un lieu où écologie et art se lient étroitement depuis près de 40 ans.

Les objectifs de ce chantier sont le réaménagement des espaces, la permaculture et des ateliers de réflexion pour développer à nouveau des activités artistiques à Gorodka.

Depuis six mois déjà, des bénévoles de l'association Krasis Orchestra interviennent à Gorodka un week-end par mois, afin de rénover et de préserver le lieu. Ces interventions ont permis à plusieurs sculptures d'extérieur de trouver une seconde jeunesse, au nettoyage de structures, et à la protection de nombreux éléments en bois. Ces actions, en plus de redonner une fraîcheur à Gorodka, s'inscrivent dans la préservation du patrimoine culturel périgourdin. Car en effet, existant depuis plus de quarante ans, Gorodka est désormais un élément essentiel de l'Histoire sarladaise, de sa culture.

Vous pouvez vous aussi devenir bénévole en envoyant un mail à benevoles@krasisorchestra.fr


>>> PERMACULTURE


La permaculture c’est quoi ?! Littéralement ; la culture permanente : Nous pouvons cultiver la terre de telle sorte qu’elle ne s’appauvrit jamais. A l’inverse de l’agriculture productiviste, adepte de monoculture, la permaculture cherche à varier les fruits et légumes et use de multiples astuces comme la complémentarité des cultures afin de créer un cycle vertueux sans utilisation de pesticides ni d’engrais chimiques.

Pourquoi à Gorodka ?

Il y a plus de quarante ans, quand Gorodka n’était alors qu’une colline boisée, Pierre a commencé une activité d’éleveur et d’agriculteur afin d’être autonome. Son audace et son imagination lui ont permis de construire par la suite la fameuse serre à chaleur animale et d’être à la tête de l’Institut Rural de l’Information qui comptait près de quinze salariés dont les recherches étaient axées sur l’autogestion. Suite à la décentralisation, il ne fut plus subventionné par l’État et ne put plus continuer dans cette voie.

Gorodka écrira alors une autre page de son histoire.

Lorsque nous sommes arrivés fin décembre, il nous est apparu naturel de reprendre cette activité qui est, à l’heure de Monsanto et cie, un véritable engagement politique et citoyen.



Dans quel but ?


L’objectif premier est pour nous d’apprendre ce qu’est la terre et sa culture, de voir pousser ce que nous mangeons ailleurs que dans des surgelés empaquetés ou autres productions intensives. Les récoltes permettront de nous nourrir, mais surtout de produire des conserves en tout genre que nous pourrons alors vendre sur le marché, afin d’intégrer un peu plus Gorodka à la vie sarladaise.

Un tiers de la production sera nôtre, le deuxième tiers pour les marchés et le dernier pour les associations locales luttant contre la faim.

Comment nous allons nous y prendre ?

Nous allons notamment faire appel aux Incroyables Comestibles, mouvement citoyen qui s’engage pour la promotion de l’écologie. Ils nous expliqueront comment faire et nous préparerons ainsi le terrain. Par ailleurs, certains bénévoles apporteront leur expérience dans ce domaine-là. Cela demande du temps et de l’investissement humain pour construire un véritable projet de permaculture ; pour façonner le cercle vertueux d’une culture durable de la terre.


>>> RÉNOVATION DES ŒUVRES ET RÉAMÉNAGEMENT DES ESPACES



La serre et les ateliers

La serre à chaleur animale a été construite en 1978 dans le but d’accueillir les animaux au sol et de récupérer la chaleur qu’ils génèrent afin de chauffer une serre au premier étage. Elle permettait ainsi une importante économie d’énergies.

Au début des années 1980 avec la décentralisation, les subventions de l’Etat disparaissent et l’I.R.I (voir Histoire) avec. La serre devient alors un atelier, mais également une sorte de grenier spacieux où sont entreposés un nombre incalculable d’objets en tout genre depuis une trentaine d’années (outils et matériaux divers, aile d’avion, etc) . Nous réorganiserons et ferons l’inventaire du matériel afin de faire de la serre un lieu de fabrication, d’expression pour les bénévoles, l’association et les futurs artistes en résidence.


 La dépendance de la galerie Za

Près de la forêt, c’est un appartement abandonné où se situe une cave qui servira très certainement de lieu de répétitions pour les futurs groupes en résidence. Il y a dans cette cave beaucoup d’archives de Gorodka. Malheureusement, avec le temps et l’humidité, la majorité d’entre elles sont inexploitables. Cependant, nous trouvons parfois des objets intacts tels que cette reproduction – appartenant au lieu, elle y restera une fois le lieu rénové. Nous récupérerons les archives récupérables et les numériserons.

Un bénévole dans la cave aux archives

Durant dix jours, nous allons donc faire le tri entre ce que nous gardons et nous débarrasser du reste : Nous ferons appel aux Récup’acteurs de Viallard, une association locale qui, comme son nom l’indique récupère les objets afin de leur donner une nouvelle vie !


>>>ALIMENTATION


L’alimentation occupe l’essentiel de notre budget pour le chantier bénévole de ce mois d’août. En effet, nourrir trente personnes pendant dix jours a un coût : 2000€ selon nos plus hautes estimations.

Pour estimer le budget, nous avons choisi de regarder les prix du circuit de la grande distribution et des circuits-courts, locaux et d’en faire la comparaison. Nous nous fixons sur les prix du Leclerc, plus chers mais aussi plus stables.

Cependant, nous n’y achèterons rien :

Comme nous entamerons une activité de permaculture, il est évident que nous ferons appel à des producteurs locaux qui n’ont pas nécessairement le label « bio », mais dont les pratiques respectent l’environnement. Ils nous sont recommandés par les Incroyables Comestibles, association promouvant l’écologie.

Vous pouvez nous demander le menu auquel plusieurs têtes et ventres ont réfléchi ensemble par mail à benevoles@krasisorchestra.fr

Il y aura, pour chaque repas, une alternative végétarienne.

En cas d’excédent, ce qui ne pourra pas être conservé sera – soit donné aux associations de solidarité – soit sera trié pour produire du compost de qualité !


>>> L’ACTION CULTURELLE


Des Ateliers de Réflexion

Au cours du chantier des bénévoles du 17 au 28 août 2016, nous avons prévu d’aménager des temps de réflexion entre les bénévoles et membres de l’association ; ceci dans l’optique d’un projet culturel qui soit issu des idées, compétences et possibilités de chacun : en propre, ces ateliers auront réellement un fonctionnement démocratique. Ceci nous permettra de choisir ce qui est faisable en fonction des effectifs disponibles, et, par la richesse du collectif, de préciser les différentes idées soumises à la réflexion collective.

L’important ici, c’est – d’une part, de permettre à chacun des bénévoles une réflexion et un engagement citoyen dans le projet global de Krasis Orchestra à Gorodka, chacun pouvant apporter ses idées, ses projets, et son regard singulier – et d’autre part, de confronter les points de vue sur des sujets différents (thématiques philosophiques, esthétiques, politiques, mais aussi sur la permaculture, l’utilisation des espaces…) en vue de rendre plus efficace notre action à Gorodka.

L’Archivage des ressources

Gorodka est un lieu où fourmille une quantité étonnante de ressources en tous genres : des textes sur les cultures durables, des ouvrages sur l’art et la peinture, des archives sur l’histoire du lieu, et un grand nombre de disques vinyles et CD quasiment introuvables actuellement.

Le chantier de cet été sera donc l’occasion de recenser, d’archiver et de rendre disponibles tous ces documents, afin qu’ils puissent être utiles au public du lieu.

Les bénévoles se relaieront donc pour dresser des listes des documents disponibles, les ordonner et les numériser pour créer une grande banque de données textuelles et musicales accessibles au public.

La Création

Gorodka, c’est aussi un lieu de création, au même titre qu’un lieu de permaculture. Si Pierre Shasmoukine y a conçu un nombre impressionnant d’oeuvres au cours des quarante dernières années, beaucoup d’artistes s’y sont succédé : lors de résidences, d’expositions temporaires, de concerts et autres événements. Nous souhaitons que cela perdure pour plusieurs raisons : l’expression artistique libre est un marqueur essentiel d’une société démocratique, et elle permet à la fois la mise en relation des différents regards subjectifs, ainsi qu’un entrainement des sens et perceptions de chacun.

« […] L’art dans son ensemble n’est pas une vaine création d’objets qui se perdent dans le vide, mais une puissance qui a un but et doit servir à l’évolution et à l’affinement de l’âme humaine ». Kandinsky



>>> BILAN


- L'alimentation : 2000€

- La logistique (énergies, déplacements chez les producteurs, à la déchetterie) : 500€

- L'archivage numérique des ressources : 200€

- Communications (nouveau site web interactif, promotion, vernissage) : 500€

- Matériels (outils, infirmerie, etc) : 500€

Cela fait un total de 3500€. Si par chance, nous dépassons les objectifs, l'argent permettra d'entrevoir des perspectives plus audacieuses afin de proposer des événements singuliers et authentiques à Gorodka ou ailleurs.

Nous rappelons que cette campagne de financement est également un appel aux bénévoles. Pour ce, écrivez-nous un mail à :

benevoles@krasisorchestra.fr

Nous vous remercions de votre attention et vous souhaitons la belle journée!

Krasis Orchestra


Krasis Orchestra is organizing a volunteer workcamp from the 17th to the 28th of August at Gorodka, a remarkable artistic terrain imagined and built by Pierre Shasmoukine. Where ecology and art have been closely entwined on site over the last forty years.

This project aims for the reorganization of the terrain, permaculture and thought workshops on the revival of artistic life at Gorodka. After a number of previous maintenance projects, it is our wish to open this space to the public, proposing and cultivating as a result innovative cultural and ecological alternatives.

Over this past half year, one weekend per month, volunteers from Krasis Orchestra come to maintain the space, aiming to strengthen and revitalize the area. This involvement has given new lease of life to the sculptures inhabiting the grounds, as well as the preservation of weakened wooden structures. The restoration of the site also entails a consideration for the unique cultural heritage of the Perigord region. For over forty years, Gorodka has become an essential element in Sarlat’s history, its culture.

>>> PERMACULTURE

What is permaculture?! In a literal sense, it is indeed ‘a permanent culture’ – a way of cultivating the earth that is truly sustainable, without draining it of its own resources. In contrast to production-oriented agriculture, and its espousal of monoculture, permaculture strives to vary fruits and vegetables through diverse strategies, focusing for instance on the compatibility of cultures to promote a virtuous cycle without the use of pesticides and artificial fertilizers.

Why Gorodka?


Over forty years ago, when Gorodka was but a forested hill, Pierre began livestock farming and harvesting in the aim of becoming entirely self-sufficient. His audacity and imagination gave him the possibility to build the famed animal-heated greenhouse and direct the Rural Institute of Information, a workforce of fifteen salaried researchers dedicated to the question of self-governance. Following an intense period of decentralization, government subsidies were pulled and marked the end of this particular prospect.

Gorodka thus wrote another page of its life story.

Upon our arrival at the end of December, it seemed natural for us to recover this project, which, amidst the reign of Monsanto, is a welcome opportunity for true political and civic engagement.

To what end?

The primary objective was for us to learn about cultivation, to witness with our own eyes the growth of what we ingest outside the confines of deep-freezer packaged dinners and other intensive productions. The harvest will serve our immediate nutrition, but is also suitable for a variety of canned foods, which we can sell at the market, further integrating Gorodka into the Sarlat community.

A third of the harvest will stay with us, a third will be destined for market sale, and the remaining third will be donated to local food banks.

How will we achieve this?

Our first stop will be Incroyables Comestibles, a grass-roots movement that promotes ecology. They will assist us with the know-how, and we will thus allow us to prepare the terrain. In addition, several volunteers have developed skills and experience in the field to share. There is a sizeable amount of time and human investment required to construct a project of sustainable permaculture, to mould a virtuous cycle of durable cultivation.

>>> Redevelopment of the Gorodkian space

The greenhouse and its workshops

The animal-heated greenhouse was built in 1978 with the purpose of housing animals on the ground floor, and using the heat they generate to create a greenhouse for the floor above, thus allowing for a substantial conservation of energy.

The start of the eighties signaled a wave of decentralization and the disappearance of government subsidies. The Rural Institute of Information, created at Gorodka, was but one casualty. The greenhouse thus became a workshop, as well as a kind of spacious warehouse for a cornucopia of miscellaneous objects over the last three decades. Tools, various materials, and airplane wings can be found. Our aim is to reorganize this space and draft an inventory of the materials found. We hope to subsquently transform this warehouse into a space for artistic production, be it for our volunteers, the association, or future artists in residence.

Gallery Za Outbuilding

Bordered by the forest, Gallery Za is an abandoned apartment with a cellar that will most likely become a rehearsal space for future bands in residency. Once inside, an extensive archive of Gorodka can be found. Weakened by years of neglect and humidity, the majority of the works are beyond repair. Nonetheless, one can still discover objects intact, such as a reproduction of a piece by Jarki – belonging to the space, it will remain once it has been renovated. We will recuperate the archives that are in good shape and will make a digitized count of the works.

During ten days, we will thus select which will be kept and which will be discarded; Récup’acteurs de Viallard, a local organization dedicated to this exact task, will then retrieve these articles and rework them into use.

>>> Cultural Action

Thought Workshops

During our volunteer week from the 17th to the 28th of August 2016, we opt to foster reflections between the volunteers and members of the association; this is in the perspective of a cultural project, birthed from the ideas, abilities, and possibilities of each participant. Formally put, these workshops hope to embody a truly democratic process. This will allow us to determine what is possible with the present group, and by nature of the collective, to further precise the different ideas presented for communal reflection.

What is important is this – on one hand, allowing for each volunteer to reflect and freely engage themselves within Krasis Orchestra’s global project at Gorodka, each offering their ideas, projects, and unique perspectives. On the other hand, to confront the various points of view on a variety of topics (philosophy, aesthetics, politics, permaculture, opinions on the potential usage of the space…) in order to render our action at Gorodka that much more effective.

An archive of resources

Gorodka is teeming with a surprising amount of resources of varying genres: texts on durable culture, literature on art and painting, historical archives of the space itself, and a haul of rare vinyl records and cd’s, almost out of grasp nowadays.

This summer’s workshop will therefore aim to identify, archive, and render all these valuable documents available to the public.

Volunteers will therefore work on generating a digital record of these items to create a large textual and musical database for the public at large.

Creation

Notwithstanding its commitment to permaculture, Gorodka is a space dedicated to fostering the creative spirit. While Pierre Shasmoukine has produced an impressionable number of his works on site, many other artists have followed suit, during residencies, temporary exhibits, concerts and other events. Our wish is for this to continue for a number of reasons: free artistic expression is an essential marker for a democratic society, and allows for the convergence of different subjectivities, as well as a sensorial and perceptual exercise for participants.

‘(…) Art as a whole is not a vain creation of object that are lost in emptiness, but a force that has an end and must serve the development and refinement of the human soul’.

Kandinsky

In this perspective, the workshops are an opportunity for volunteers and members of the association to propose different creative projects; be it through performance, art, musical residencies.

>>> Food Provisions

Providing meals will take the largest bite out of our budget for the upcoming volunteer week in August. Indeed, providing for thirty people during ten days quickly adds up – we are estimating a maximum of 2000 euros.

This estimation is based on research done on both large-scale and smaller food distributors. We have chosen to base our estimate on Leclerc’s prices, which are steeper but more stable.

However, we won’t be buying anything there:

As our project is axed on permaculture, it is clear that we will be supporting local farmers, whose produce may not be certified organic, but grown in an environmentally respectful way. Their contacts were sent our way by Incroyables Comestibles, an association dedicated to ecology.

Should you have any questions on the menu our minds and bellies have long ruminated upon, with the aim of providing a variety of flavors for each participant, you can send us an email at benevoles@krasisorchestra.fr

A vegetarian option will be offered for every meal.

If left-overs occur, that which we cannot conserve will be either donated to food banks, or destined to producing top-notch compost!

The Krasis Orchestra team and collective

[ENGLISH VERSION BELOW]


L’association Krasis Orchestra organise un chantier bénévole du 17 au 28 août à Gorodka, lieu d’art insolite construit par Pierre Shasmoukine. Un lieu où écologie et art se lient étroitement depuis près de 40 ans.
Les objectifs de ce 
chantier sont le réaménagement des espaces, la permaculture et des 
ateliers de réflexion pour développer à nouveau des activités 
artistiques à Gorodka. 




Depuis six mois déjà, des bénévoles de l'association Krasis Orchestra interviennent à Gorodka un week-end par mois, afin de rénover et de préserver le lieu. Ces interventions ont permis à plusieurs sculptures d'extérieur de trouver une seconde jeunesse, au nettoyage de structures, et à la protection de nombreux éléments en bois. Ces actions, en plus de redonner une fraîcheur à Gorodka, s'inscrivent dans la préservation du patrimoine culturel périgourdin. Car en effet, existant depuis plus de quarante ans, Gorodka est désormais un élément essentiel de l'Histoire sarladaise, de sa culture.Vous pouvez vous aussi devenir bénévole en envoyant un mail à benevoles@krasisorchestra.fr









>>> PERMACULTURE

La permaculture c’est quoi ?! Littéralement ; la culture permanente :
 Nous pouvons cultiver la terre de telle sorte qu’elle ne s’appauvrit 
jamais. A l’inverse de l’agriculture productiviste, adepte de 
monoculture, la permaculture cherche à varier les fruits et légumes et 
use de multiples astuces comme la complémentarité des cultures afin de 
créer un cycle vertueux sans utilisation de pesticides ni d’engrais 
chimiques.
Pourquoi à Gorodka ?
Il
 y a plus de quarante ans, quand Gorodka n’était alors qu’une colline 
boisée, Pierre a commencé une activité d’éleveur et d’agriculteur afin 
d’être autonome. Son audace et son imagination lui ont permis de 
construire par la suite la fameuse serre à chaleur animale et d’être à 
la tête de l’Institut Rural de l’Information
 qui comptait près de quinze salariés dont les recherches étaient axées 
sur l’autogestion. Suite à la décentralisation, il ne fut plus 
subventionné par l’État et ne put plus continuer dans cette voie.
Gorodka écrira alors une autre page de son histoire.
Lorsque
 nous sommes arrivés fin décembre, il nous est apparu naturel de 
reprendre cette activité qui est, à l’heure de Monsanto et cie, un 
véritable engagement politique et citoyen.


Dans quel but ?

L’objectif
 premier est pour nous d’apprendre ce qu’est la terre et sa culture, de 
voir pousser ce que nous mangeons ailleurs que dans des surgelés 
empaquetés ou autres productions intensives. Les récoltes permettront de
 nous nourrir, mais surtout de produire des conserves en tout genre que 
nous pourrons alors vendre sur le marché, afin d’intégrer un peu plus 
Gorodka à la vie sarladaise.
Un
 tiers de la production sera nôtre, le deuxième tiers pour les marchés 
et le dernier pour les associations locales luttant contre la faim.
Comment nous allons nous y prendre ?
Nous
 allons notamment faire appel aux Incroyables Comestibles, mouvement 
citoyen qui s’engage pour la promotion de l’écologie. Ils nous 
expliqueront comment faire et nous préparerons ainsi le terrain. Par 
ailleurs, certains bénévoles apporteront leur expérience dans ce

kind of spacious warehouse for a cornucopia of miscellaneous objects 
over the last three decades. Tools, various materials, and airplane 
wings can be found. Our aim is to reorganize this space and draft an 
inventory of the materials found. We hope to subsquently transform this 
warehouse into a space for artistic production, be it for our 
volunteers, the association, or future artists in residence.
Gallery Za Outbuilding
Bordered by the forest, 
Gallery Za is an abandoned apartment with a cellar that will most likely
 become a rehearsal space for future bands in residency. Once inside, an
 extensive archive of Gorodka can be found. Weakened by years of neglect
 and humidity, the majority of the works are beyond repair. Nonetheless,
 one can still discover objects intact, such as a reproduction of a 
piece by Jarki – belonging to the space, it will remain once it has been
 renovated. We will recuperate the archives that are in good shape and 
will make a digitized count of the works.

During ten days, we will 
thus select which will be kept and which will be discarded; 
Récup’acteurs de Viallard, a local organization dedicated to this exact 
task, will then retrieve these articles and rework them into use.
>>> Cultural Action
Thought Workshops
During our volunteer week from the 17th to the 28th
 of August 2016, we opt to foster reflections between the volunteers and
 members of the association; this is in the perspective of a cultural 
project, birthed from the ideas, abilities, and possibilities of each 
participant. Formally put, these workshops hope to embody a truly 
democratic process. This will allow us to determine what is possible 
with the present group, and by nature of the collective, to further 
precise the different ideas presented for communal reflection.
What is important is this –
 on one hand, allowing for each volunteer to reflect and freely engage 
themselves within Krasis Orchestra’s global project at Gorodka, each 
offering their ideas, projects, and unique perspectives. On the other 
hand, to confront the various points of view on a variety of topics 
(philosophy, aesthetics, politics, permaculture, opinions on the 
potential usage of the space…) in order to render our action at Gorodka 
that much more effective.
An archive of resources

Gorodka is teeming with a 
surprising amount of resources of varying genres: texts on durable 
culture, literature on art and painting, historical archives of the 
space itself, and a haul of rare vinyl records and cd’s, almost out of 
grasp nowadays.
This summer’s workshop will therefore aim to identify, archive, and render all these valuable documents available to the public.
Volunteers will therefore 
work on generating a digital record of these items to create a large 
textual and musical database for the public at large.
Creation
Notwithstanding its 
commitment to permaculture, Gorodka is a space dedicated to fostering 
the creative spirit. While Pierre Shasmoukine has produced an 
impressionable number of his works on site, many other artists have 
followed suit, during residencies, temporary exhibits, concerts and 
other events. Our wish is for this to continue for a number of reasons: 
free artistic expression is an essential marker for a democratic 
society, and allows for the convergence of different subjectivities, as 
well as a sensorial and perceptual exercise for participants.
‘(…) Art as a whole is 
not a vain creation of object that are lost in emptiness, but a force 
that has an end and must serve the development and refinement of the 
human soul’. 
Kandinsky
In this perspective, the 
workshops are an opportunity for volunteers and members of the 
association to propose different creative projects; be it through 
performance, art, musical residencies.
>>> Food Provisions
Providing meals will take 
the largest bite out of our budget for the upcoming volunteer week in 
August. Indeed, providing for thirty people during ten days quickly adds
 up – we are estimating a maximum of 2000 euros.
This estimation is based on
 research done on both large-scale and smaller food distributors. We 
have chosen to base our estimate on Leclerc’s prices, which are steeper 
but more stable.
However, we won’t be buying anything there:
As our project is 
axed on permaculture, it is clear that we will be supporting local 
farmers, whose produce may not be certified organic, but grown in an 
environmentally respectful way. Their contacts were sent our way by Incroyables Comestibles, an association dedicated to ecology.
Should you have any 
questions on the menu our minds and bellies have long ruminated upon, 
with the aim of providing a variety of flavors for each participant, you
 can send us an email at benevoles@krasisorchestra.fr
A vegetarian option will be offered for every meal.
If left-overs occur, that 
which we cannot conserve will be either donated to food banks, or 
destined to producing top-notch compost!
The Krasis Orchestra team and collective

story:
Our Common Ground

Who we are

Our Common Ground was conceived and created by Meg Saligman Studios. We are a hodgepodge of painters, scientists, social practitioners, and installation artists. We are known for activating public space through large, multi-faceted public projects. These include three of our nation’s largest murals and a public installation for Pope Francis’ visit to Philadelphia, which engaged over 150,000 participants.

Why we're doing this

Over 2,000 years ago, Aristotle defined the result of politics as the Good Life. Watching this political election cycle unfold toward hostility, polarization, and even violence, we feel a sense of artistic urgency. We believe public art can raise civic engagement and transform energy by reserving a space for momentary pause and respectful discourse inside our most prominent civic gatherings. Our Common Ground serves as this space, allowing us to explore together what the Good Life means to us and how we might achieve it.

We want to see art as the eye of the political storm — a space of calm amidst the turmoil of this election.

So what does it look like?

Our Common Ground is a non-partisan, participatory art installation using vivid color, sculpture, and light to reserve a peaceful and resplendent space for dialogue and reflection.

The artwork features:

Oversized ear horns — for “listening loudly”.

Ten exquisitely ornamented Voter Poles — each representing a distinct element of the Good Life, referencing Aristotle's definition of politics where participants write down their ideas about the Good Life, enclose it in a ball, and launch their vote high in the air to be collected with others.

The Dialogue Den — a cozy space where strangers are invited to discuss their conception of the Good Life.  Artists and filmmakers will document these conversations as they happen.

The artist team will gather participants’ hand-written ideas from the Voter Poles at both conventions, as well as artists’ text and sketches, and showcase them alongside the original installation in a touring exhibit. The exhibit will debut at Moore College of Art in Philadelphia and proceed across the country leading up to and beyond national Election Day.

Why do we need the money?

We’ve built a fantastic installation for engaging citizens in thoughtful dialogue and revelry, but we need your help to support community involvement, artist team programming, and installation travel.

1.Community Involvement

To determine our common ground, we must search far and wide to bring together people who hold vastly different views and backgrounds. Help us ensure that community organizations and citizens of all stripes are able to participate.

2.Artist Team Programming

Our large-scale public art installation requires a team of artists and organizational wizards to maintain the space and to ensure that all participants can engage fully with the work. Help us make the installation a welcoming space where participants and artists can co-create an experience of wonder and pause.

3.Installation Travel

Cleveland and Philadelphia are 432 miles apart! We brought Our Common Ground to the Republican and Democratic National conventions but we would love to continue its to spread out message through election day. Help us continue our artistic intervention within the political realm through election day by creating art and respectful dialogue from the results.

Our ten Voter Poles are close to 12 feet tall, 3 feet wide, and over 50 pounds each.  Touring art of this magnitude requires a lot of care, coordination, and brute force. Even then, things can go awry. Help us ensure that the art looks just as beautiful at the completion of the tour as it did when it opened.

Initial Support

We have gained initial traction for funding these elements with the support Joy of Voting, a project of Citizen University; The Independence Foundation; Moore College of Art and Design; and Liquitex.  But we need your support to make our full vision a reality.

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING PUBLIC ART!

Beyond money— we need your support spreading the word!

At its heart, Our Common Ground is an artistic movement driven by artists and citizens who seek to reframe political discourse by going back to basics. Civic engagement should be focused on dialogue about what matters and how we can move toward making change. Whether you can donate to our campaign or not, you can still make Our Common Ground a reality by spreading the word.

Ways to Help

Share our story through this video.

Add your story to our collection by submittng at www.voteforthegoodlife.com

Spread the word about Our Common Ground with the hashtag #voteforthegoodlife

Recruit a local group — civic club, church group, homeless organization, labor union, etc. — to speak in our Dialogue Den. Or sign yourself or your organization up by contacting ann@annvanino.com.

Stay connected. Follow Meg Saligman Studios on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or Linkedin  to stay up to date on our Installation. You can watch exclusive stories and participate in conversations through Soulfetti , a new digital network that showcases stories that matter.
