story:
Help Us Complete This Journey!

 

The Studio

We’re excited to take La Sierra Artist Residency to the next level. We are seeking your support and generous contributions to fund the building of our new live/work studio building dedicated to housing visiting artists while providing them with a working art studio as well as a space for community outreach.

 

Your donations will allow us to purchase building materials and pay for construction and engineering labor. This new studio building will also provide the following:

  • creative programming
  • exchanges with other international residencies and like-minded organizations
  • workshops by visiting artist in residence
  • lectures, talks, performances and screenings 
  • a launching point to explore the jungle and learn about the indigenous cultures. 

Participants will include multidisciplinary creative professionals, including visual artists, musicians, writers, and architects. With your support, we can develop this residency into a destination where together we can question and experiment. Join us in building this community.

 

 Our Story

Four years ago, Nina Arias, independent art curator from Miami and her husband Ryan Gorman discovered and fell in love with this sacred land while in search for a special place to create their dream beach resort.  Gitana del Mar Boutique Beach Resort was born with the concept of fusing an eco-lodge and wellness retreat.  This intimate experience includes garden bungalows, a gourmet restaurant, beach spa, daily yoga, and jungle adventures.

Since then, this creative duo has worked tirelessly on bringing this vision to fruition and making this a unique destination for travelers from around the world.  Now that this infrastructure is in place and fully operating, given Nina's background and passions, there has been a natural progression to develop this artist residency.  Artists in residence will be given the opportunity to enjoy many of the hotel amenities for a nominal fee. 

 

Your Collaboration 

The construction of this studio depends solely on YOUR generous donations and contributions. Your participation will directly support the opportunity for international artists to recharge their creative energies and create new and continued works that will leave a lasting imprint in the lives of the visiting artists and of the locals in this special Caribbean community. 

 

Thank you for your interest in this project and for your genuine support.

TOGETHER we will make The Studio at La Sierra Artist Residency come to life!

 

PERKS AVAILABLE FOR YOUR GENEROUS DONATIONS*

 

 


 

*Tax-deductible donations are only available via our Fiscal Sponsor, not on Indiegogo.

If you are interested in Tax-Deductible donations, please contact us directly at info@lasierraartistresidency.org to donate via our Fiscal Sponsor by clicking the link below.

https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/fiscal/prof...

La Sierra Artist Residency is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of La Sierra Artist Residency must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
In 2000 I released a CD called "Colors Mixed in Love Shines Blackness" YoungBlood Productions.

The album was a compilation of different artists whom I had recorded and worked with in the 1990's. The songs on the CD were a mixture of Pop, R&B, Rock and Gospel. Now I have the opportunity to record in Argentina in various studios to complete my 2nd CD of artists. I have record with in the 2000's. The CD is "Cee a World of Music" CD2 YoungBlood Productions. Your help will cover the flight to Argentina and the studio time, mixing and mastering the cd, plus the digital distribution world wide with CD Baby. 

Click On the link to listen to the first YBP album form 2000 

 http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/youngblood

Inspiration​

This album is about a love story of many years. It's inspired from all my travels in life. I wrote many new songs with all different type's of artists. The styles of music are coming from the a variety cultures that I have encountered on my trips in Europe, Asia, Latin American, The Caribbean and all over the USA.
I was inspired by the great musicians whom I worked with in Argentina, and I'm looking forward to going back there to finish this CD. Each track will be unique sound with a different setup and instruments!

I work with Logic to compose and arrange the music with a world of moods, feelings, and unique sentiment from rock to rap and soul to jazz.

It's an enthusiastic project for me and it is why I want you to be part of this journey!
Along with moving narrative lyrics and the soulful funk rock inspired sound, the recordings of all these songs will greatly expand their reach & I believe inspire those who encounter them.

The album, following the money

To record, mix and master $1000

To distributed the album digitally by CD Baby and also available as a Flash Drive, and by emailed down loads, with pictures and videos along with the songs, $1000

The video production of the recording's in Argentina, $500

The Travel expenses and flight will be $1000

The musicians and technician payment will be $1000

The planned release date would be for March 2017 and until then we will let you know every step of the process. The only thing missing is the financial part... You can support the international music experience and make this dream come true!

You can contribute by pre ordering the album flash drive for $25 or more! With a contribution of $50 or more, you will Pre order the album flash drive and, be able to meet on Skype or, in person to speak about the music and why Argentina! With a contributions of $100 or more, you will Pre order the album flash drive and my other 3 CD's will be sent to you and by email downloads! With contributions of $500 or more, you will Pre order the album and my other 3 CD's will be sent to you and by email downloads! Be able to meet on Skype or, in person to speak about the music and why Argentina! Your name will be mention as one of the a main sponsor that made this album possible in all of our social media pages. Plus the flash drive for you to enjoy!

This album will open your ears to a world of music and your eyes to Love!!

So join me on this exiting project by pre ordering the album!

SHARE THE WORD ​

Sharing this campaign will make a big difference for us to reach our goal!

So please spread the word wildly around! On social media to your friends and family! It too make a difference!

I've been putting my heart and soul into this project that I have worked on for the last year and a half! And I can't wait for you to listen to it!

With absolute gratitude
Many many many thank you's
Lots of Peace and Love

If you want to have update of our projects you can follow us on Facebook!

story:
Everything I Say Is True

My name is Suzanne Kite and I am an Indigenous artist who practices under the name Kite. I am a composer and performer.

  • I am raising money to perform my current project in Los Angeles, CA: Everything I Say Is True (2017) commissioned by Walter Phillips Gallery, Banff Centre.
  • This piece will be shown in in Banff, Canada, and in various stages in Los Angeles, CA, Portland, OR, Melbourne & Sydney, Australia, and New York. 
  • This piece is an exploration of "truth" and "belief" in Western thinking versus Lakota thinking, which is increasingly relevant today.

What Is Needed

I need around $3000 to finish this project

  • This will primarily go to building a new computer that can comfortably run Processing, Ableton, and output to 5 projectors at once (which I have done for every performance, but to the detriment of the piece).
  • New sound card (that doesn't output random noise)
  • Help fund paying amazing musicians for a live performance of the score in LA
  • Contributing musicians: Doug Carter, Jessika Kenney, Eyvind Kang, Crystal Torres, Jackie Urlick, Matthew Allen, Matthew Hunter, Oscar Santos, Mint Park, Devin Ronneberg

Thank you!

  • I put everything I have into my work: time, money, energy, because I believe artwork by Indigenous people, exploring concepts of time and truth, critically analyzing Western concepts, are all essential to the preservation of my people and all peoples.
  • My previous projects, People You Must Look at Me, Lecture on Two Locations, and Sources have been successfully performed and exhibited in Canada and Los Angeles over the past two years and I am very excited to share this next piece.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share and spread the word about my project!

Project Details


I see a long running connection between the concept of 'manifest destiny' and the piece I am creating. It is a long chain of events, a story, that can be traced through family documents, historical documents, maps, data, misinformation, lies, conspiracy, imagination, and dreams. The culture of conspiracy in the United States continually touches on Indians. Conspiracy requires an enemy with a preconceived plot, destiny, however, is the fulfillment of a natural order. Most importantly, destiny requires a beginning point and an end point: linear time. In this performance and installation, I would like to propose that the "responsible truth" is the disbelief in linear time. I see these many timelines has existing constantly in the present, with my personal timeline as a result of other timelines, especially COINTELPRO, which targeted the Black Power and American Indian Movements. I see my own birth as part of a web of events alongside COINTELPRO's involvement in the violence on Pine Ridge, decisions made by generations of Oglala, Lakota cosmologies, and time itself. Describing the paranoia of the American 1990s, media critic Jesse Walker states, "the mythologies of one group flowed freely into another’s, even as radically different styles of conspiracism contended". I see these mythologies, American, Indian, personal, as a springboard for exploring truth and belief in this piece, Everything I Say Is True.


The performance stitches together a timeline which explores the complex histories of Oglala Lakota history through four sections: teaching, evidence, power, and accusation. The performance will exhibit my extreme control of the technology required to control sound and visuals. All movements are improvised within the structure. I will "draw" portals onto the walls, move light, strike with electricity, creating a magical sense of control over the space. The performance is entirely scored, sound designed, composed, mixed, mastered by myself with assistance from Devin Ronneberg. Instrumentation will include Ableton Live, drums, vibes, harp, flute, drum, piano, vocals, bells, bass guitar, and violin.


The carbon fiber objects used in performance are self-made electronic instruments, controlling sound and video. These instruments, or midi controller sculptures, are carbon fiber and fiberglass, black and sleek, with a design between a turtle shell and a geologic sculpture. Live streaming video, animations, pre-shot video are controlled by the midi controllers. The centerpiece of this performance is a dress with 30 encircling timelines stitched and beaded into the dress skirt.

And much more!

 

Installation Photographs by Iris Ray

Project DetailsI see a long running connection between the concept of 'manifest destiny' and the piece I am creating. It is a long chain of events, a story, that can be traced through family documents, historical documents, maps, data, misinformation, lies, conspiracy, imagination, and dreams. The culture of conspiracy in the United States continually touches on Indians. Conspiracy requires an enemy with a preconceived plot, destiny, however, is the fulfillment of a natural order. Most importantly, destiny requires a beginning point and an end point: linear time. In this performance and installation, I would like to propose that the "responsible truth" is the disbelief in linear time. I see these many timelines has existing constantly in the present, with my personal timeline as a result of other timelines, especially COINTELPRO, which targeted the Black Power and American Indian Movements. I see my own birth as part of a web of events alongside COINTELPRO's involvement in the violence on Pine Ridge, decisions made by generations of Oglala, Lakota cosmologies, and time itself. Describing the paranoia of the American 1990s, media critic Jesse Walker states, "the mythologies of one group flowed freely into another’s, even as radically different styles of conspiracism contended". I see these mythologies, American, Indian, personal, as a springboard for exploring truth and belief in this piece, Everything I Say Is True.The performance stitches together a timeline which explores the complex histories of Oglala Lakota history through four sections: teaching, evidence, power, and accusation. The performance will exhibit my extreme control of the technology required to control sound and visuals. All movements are improvised within the structure. I will "draw" portals onto the walls, move light, strike with electricity, creating a magical sense of control over the space. The performance is entirely scored, sound designed, composed, mixed, mastered by myself with assistance from Devin Ronneberg. Instrumentation will include Ableton Live, drums, vibes, harp, flute, drum, piano, vocals, bells, bass guitar, and violin.The carbon fiber objects used in performance are self-made electronic instruments, controlling sound and video. These instruments, or midi controller sculptures, are carbon fiber and fiberglass, black and sleek, with a design between a turtle shell and a geologic sculpture. Live streaming video, animations, pre-shot video are controlled by the midi controllers. The centerpiece of this performance is a dress with 30 encircling timelines stitched and beaded into the dress skirt.And much more! Installation Photographs by Iris Ray

story:
Our Mission

We are a small group of artists who desire to inject art into everyday life and introduce and encourage everyone to express their own personal creativity! We make each game by hand in our studio. 

Your support will allow us to sustainably make and distribute Canvas Craze, and you’ll receive great deals exclusive to our backers. Contribute today to join the craze!

 

What You Will Receive

The game will include a Canvas Craze drawstring pack, transparent canvas, marker, erasing cloth, custom made die, and a large deck of cards for hours of entertainment!

Our first 200 games sold will receive additional digital decks for countless drawing possibilities.

If you’re a business owner, Canvas craze is a great addition to your coffee shop, casual eatery, or office waiting area. Remember, the Holidays are just around the corner as well but Canvas Craze also makes for a thoughtful and unique gift for any occasion!

Canvas Craze is 100+ games in one! Why only play by the rules? Draw to your hearts content! Play tic tac toe, hangman or let your imagination run wild. 

Even if we do not reach our full goal, we will provide games to our donors! 

Our Ask

We ask for $35 per game to cover our costs for all of our materials and labor costs for our carpenter. We ask that you allow for some time for us to create your game. Due to the handmade nature, the process takes time and care. We guarantee it will be worth the wait!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in the value of art culture as much as we do, please SHARE using the Indiegogo share tools! Even spreading by word of mouth will help us!

story:
Short Summary

Parastoo is an Iranian girl who comes to the US to study for her master's degree. She has a single entry visa so she can't go back to visit her family until she is done with school. Join her in her adventures in an entirely new world!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Our goal is to reach $10,000 in order to make the first season and get the series going on a regular basis. We need this money to pay our amazing artists and for our equipment 
  • We want to engage as many people as possible and introduce emerging musicians. Each episode will have an original song by a new musician.
  • YOU CAN BE FEATURED IN OUR ANIMATION!!! ( Check out the perks!)
  • If we don't reach our goal, we'll still keep making the episodes but each episode will take longer and we won't be able to pay our artists; so we might lose them :(

The Impact

We believe in the power of stories in raising awareness;

 Awareness of the issues of immigrants,

Awareness of the importance of dialogue between cultures and passing the borders and differences by loving and hearing each other,

Awareness of the impact that political decisions have on the lives of individuals. 

Risks & Challenges

Animations are not easy to make! We started this project because we thought ,especially at this time, it is urgent and much needed. However, we need to be able to support our team financially in order to keep the project going. Hiring artists, buying and renting softwares, hardwares and online platforms to transfer huge files to/from Iran that would still work despite the internet filtering issues. ( Yes! Even Google drive is filtered)

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't contribute, but you can still help! Press the share button! Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! We really appreciate your support. And always feel free to share your story with us! diasporan18@gmail.com

story:
*** Campaing to finance the MUSICIANS to go to PLAYA***

BURNING MAN, WHAT IS IT?

Once a year, 70,000 people gather in the Black Rock Desert in Nevada to create the city of Black Rock City, a temporary metropolis dedicated to community, art, self-expression and self-confidence. In this infinite of creativity, and everyone is welcome

The Burning Man was born on a becker beach in San Francisco in 1986 by Larry Harvey, Jerry James and some friends.

But what is it anyway?

It is a vibrant and collaborative city created by its citizens.

There are no spectators - everyone is invited to participate

If you believe that just by purchasing the ticket will guarantee your participation in the event, you can forget. This is not a festival. The temporary city only works with the participation of all the people as volunteers: be it constructing an art installation, setting up a camp, working in 2 or 3 days taking on tasks like: cooking, serving in the bar of your camp, recycling the garbage and helping people actively, every day, all the time.

CARNIVAL WHY?

WHEN WE GO TO THE PLAYA, we want to offer our best, and the best experiences to people who choose to go to the desert. And what could be better than offering the experience of a carnaval bloco from the streets of Rio de Janeiro through the streets of Black Rock City ????

The idea here is to have a carnival band that will be passing through the streets of the PLAYA inviting who is along the way to feel our vibe of Rio de Janeiro carnival.

We have musicians from Rio, SP, Curitiba, who want to go and offer what they have the best there, but as we all know the reality of musicians does not match the costs to get there, so we ask for your SUPPORT to make our dream come true .

We can pay part of the costs, but we need even more help with this currency devaluation.

SUPPORT OUR DREAM  ) * (

Musicians:
Anderson, trompete 
 Cayo, sax 
Lucas, sax 
Ale, percussão
Danilo, surdo 
Leo, Percussão
Cebukin, sax  
Taty Meyer, percussão 
Marcelo Mira, percussao

vera luz percussao

Deborah Gracie, violao e percussao

Yael Schonzeit violao e percussao

Evelyn

story:
I am Enea Guzja a self taught young artist currently based in Athens. Recently I sent an application from at the XII Florence Biennale, and I was happily informed that I am one of the selected participating artists. Therefore being a part of XII FB is a huge thing because I have lots of influence from Italy and especially from the Florentine Renaissance. For my place in the XII FB a participation fee is required, one that due to lack of funds I cannot afford. I always chase my dreams and now I am very close to bring to life one of the biggest. 

The cost of the whole thing is approximately 4400€. From wich 2600€ (VAT included) are for the participation fee, wich includes: wall space 2.5x2m, art insurance etc. +/- 600€ for transport of the artworks to and from Italy. +/- 300€ for artworks documentation about exporting. and the remaining are for transportation (flights, trains), accommodation etc.

For your kind help, I will provide you special perks such as digital prints of selected works, others of your choice and more.

In case that the campaign is unsuccessful, I will put all my effort to find the remaining money by myself, so that I won't lose this once in a lifetime chance. 

On the other hand, if the campaign succeeds not only I will make a big step to my artistic career, but I will also be able to show the world, that art is for everyone and only for those who can afford it. Also, another challenge awaits, on that needs the best of my ability and my passion for Art: winning the XII Florence Biennale award, "Lorenzo il Magnifico: The Lifetime Achievement" wich will be dedicated to all those who helped me.

 

Any kind of help is important, even just to spread the word (You can use the Indiegogo share tools).

 

Thank you all, 

Enea Guzja - Artist.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I am David Voorhees, an artist from Western North Carolina. I've been making pottery since 1975 and built my wood-fired car kiln in 2009.  After 22 firings it became apparent that some structural problems required the rebuilding of the firebox section.  I am now fundraising to help pay for the four-month reconstruction project which has recently been completed. 

My unusual kiln draws design components from historical kilns and industrial applications and is one of a small handful of wood-fired car kilns in the world. I use waste wood from local sawmills to fuel the kiln. Each firing lasts 24 to 30 hours, using 1 1/2 cords of wood and requires several helpers to prepare and fire.  I have hosted about 40 regional potters and sculptors as firing participants over the years. An added feature of my kiln is the built-in pizza oven which insures plenty of helpers from the community.

With a well-studied firebox redesign, I have used all new high-heat duty bricks in hot face areas and reused any old bricks where appropriate.  Funding will help pay for these new bricks and steel and welding costs.  I have applied for a local arts grant to fund new kiln shelves to make the project complete.  The original kiln was entirely self-funded at around $10,000.

With my wood-fired kiln back in operation I can get back to doing what I love and that is making pottery!  This kiln gives excellent results that only wood firing and soda glazing can do, imparting the marks and path of the flame and fly ash.  I am excited to see what new creations will be coming from each firing in the future and know that more regional artists will benefit as well from the community aspect of my kiln. A "shakedown" firing has been completed recently with good results, so I'm ready to get firing again!

The original kiln construction is documented on my website and is available to the public. I plan to make the reconstruction images available as well, hopefully being of use to other potters considering a trolley version for their wood-fired kiln plans.

I hope you can help with funding; please check out the perks I am offering, many of the pots coming out of the first few firings of the improved and rebuilt kiln. Thanks for helping Light My Fire!

What We Need & What You Get

I am hoping to raise at least $3900.  

Refractories (bricks, fire clay, castable, and coating):  $3000

Steel and welding: $300

Misc. (blades, cables and hardware):  $200

Fulfillment costs:  $400

I have some Light My Fire! items from my electric kilns that are ready to send out on short notice.

Many of my wood-fired pottery perks will be in the first full firing in  early November or the following firing.

Other perks feature pizza party, jewelry made by my wife, firing space and "pick of the kiln".

Your funding help will go toward offsetting the cost of the project in the event that my goal is not fully reached. And, if we go over my funding goal, they will be dedicated to purchasing wood from the sawmill for future firings.

Thanks for your interest in my fundraising project, please feel free to share with any interested friends.

The Impact

With my newly improved wood-fired kiln up and running, my focus now turns to making art pottery again. What new creations will come from this fire breathing beast? I can hardly wait to find out!  And that is the real adventure of my journey as an artist; the exploration of what has yet to come from my hands, head and heart.
I love to share what I'm learning and am available for workshops and consulting. My interest and research into wood fired kilns has led the creation of two resources accessible to other potters:
https://www.pinterest.com/davideeee/wood-fired-pottery-kilns-around-the-world/
https://instagram.com/woodfiredpotterykilns/  

Risks & Challenges

With any site-built kiln there is the unknown as to how well it will perform and endure such demanding temperatures.  I have learned much from the first two incarnations of this kiln. I actually built a small test kiln and fired it only twice to ensure that I wanted to proceed with the Bourry firebox design, then proceeded with the larger car kiln.  I feel confident that the changes I have designed into this one are all improvements but realize that it will take a few firings to "dial it in".  I love problem solving and welcome the new learning curve.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks for your interest in my fundraising campaign and my kiln rebuilding project. Even if you can't help but would like to keep up with my wood-firing adventures, go to my website and sign up for newsletters and upcoming events.  Please feel free to pass this on to anyone who might be interested either by sending emails with the link or using some of Indiegogo share tools.

story:
The Central New York Playhouse turns 3 Years Old

3 years ago we came to you with a vision.  A vision of a place dedicated to local Artists, Actors, and Audiences.  We had a vision of a theater....in a mall.  A place where we could put on monthly stage shows and also improv, cabarets, music, magic, stand up comedy, and really any art form that local entertainers needed a space to perform.

And you made that dream a reality!

Because of your generosity we were able to open in November of 2012.  We were not prepared for the amount of artists in desperate need for a performance space.  Though our main focus has been the stage, with 35 productions in the span of our fist 36 months, we added improve with Don't Feed the Actors, a cabaret series featuring local artists telling their stories through song, stand up comedy with the Cuse Comedy Showcases giving desperately needed stage time for budding stand-up comics, and magic shows with the Salt City Magic Club.  Over 17k patrons have walked through our door!

But now we need your help again

For the first three years we have resisted a call for donations as we worked to obtain our 501(c)3 standing with the IRS, which we received last December.  We also wanted to prove ourselves by delivering quality entertainment to Central New York.  Our stage shows have received over 40 SALT Award nominations, as well as leading the community theater category with 5 wins at the 2014 SALT Awards. 

We feel the time is right to once again ask our patrons for help to get us to the next level.  We have a single part time employee and would like to expand her hours, in order to better serve our community.  We want to add better patron seating so they can enjoy our performances in a more comfortable way.  We want to continue to upgrade our audio and tech capabilities to overcome some of the limitations of doing theater in an unconventional space.  We also are looking to add to our entertainment roster by giving spaces to local musicians to perform original songs as well as housing viewing parties for local filmmakers.  

Theatre depends on the generosity of its Patrons

Theatre, especially local community theatre, is not without its fair share of obstacles.  We are constantly taking risks to produce quality shows as their royalties and production costs continue to climb  We believe in doing so at the lowest ticket price possible so that all those who want to experience the thrill of live performance can do so.  We use a variety of free media resources like reviews and community calendars to pierce the media veil and make sure people know about the great performances you have helped make possible.  We believe we are well positioned to continue to serve the Central New York Community and your tax deductible donation is an investment in our mission to give opportunities to local artists to perfect their craft and for local audiences to enjoy them.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that money is tight for many.  This is why we have chosen a crowdfunding platform to help achieve our goals.  Any small donation will help us but so will spreading the word.  Share our Indiegogo project with your friends and family and if you have enjoyed entertainment at our facility let them know why you think this is a worthy project.

story:
I know there are more earth-shattering problems than this going on... And there are definitely many, many people out there in situations far more deserving of support. I would not have thought that enough people would care about my situation to want to help. And I still can't quite believe I am trying this... But then I posted something on Facebook and many people were so lovely and offered to donate that... well... THIS! And this really is a last resort...

At the risk of sounding like a complete loser (which I am not!). My outstanding fees on my PhD are too large to carry on. They won't let me back this year until I pay them. A friend suggested putting the amount to raise as £1000. I feel terrible putting more than this! While £1000 will make a great difference. If I can raise £2500 then I could suddenly really move forwards with a sense of a new beginning. My outstanding fees are £2500. And my fees for the upcoming year are £2000. I have chosen flexible funding for this crowdfunding so I do not need to reach the target to access any money. And, of course, any money will go towards my fees.

I work nearly full-time (30hours) as a support worker with people with learning disabilities but do not earn enough to pay the fees on top of simply living. Even if I actually work full-time it wouldn't be enough... and then there also wouldn't actually be time to do the PhD or teach or do my other art work. I also run art workshops when I can get the work!

I have no way of raising any money to offer any substantial lump sum. This is because I have previous debts from previous education in order to get "this far" and my level of debt means I cannot get any more (except payday loans which won't be an option). I have also exhausted the hardship funds at my university having used it for living costs and paying for a trip to Australia to see my mum and dad, who is not well, and who I have only seen a few times in the last 12 years or so... (I'm not making this up for the sake of pathos!). 

I could interrupt and therefore not pay fees for a year. But if I do that I will lose the kind of prestigious teaching post that I have been offered in the Curating department. And if I did interrupt there is no way I can earn enough money to pay the outstanding fees in a year (other than through crowdfunding). Which would mean not being able to reenrol next year either.

If you don't have a PhD then it is difficult to get a permanent teaching contract at a university. (Not, of course, that it is a guarantee of getting a post!) Also if I interrupt and let the curating department down I will not be offered any teaching posts at Goldsmiths next year. Therefore I would like to raise enough to pay back the £2500 I owe Goldsmiths. I will then pay the fees for this year from my salary for the Curating teaching (my salary is about £200 a month). If I raise less than this I will maybe have to interrupt and raise the rest of the money during the year that I take off. Which is fine. But carrying on right now would be better.

I have worked really hard on my PhD project. And even though it has always been a struggle to pay for it, and sometimes I have doubted whether it was worth it, I think I have to conclude it is worth it, and that it has changed my life and opened up new opportunities and possibilities. And that if I can bring this project to a conclusion at Goldsmiths, and sooner rather than leter, it will be a really important for my future success (I'm 42 now). If I manage to raise the money for these fees I will enter the fourth year (part-time study) of my PhD. Last year I took my upgrade exam... which basically means I passed the halfway mark. And it went really really well. As well I will still be continually working to make my situation better. I will continue to work. And apply for teaching posts and jobs that pay more. And apply for funding. As I have already been doing all along... Well... Thanks for even taking the time to read this... and I won't mind if you can't afford to give anything or want to give your money to a more worthy cause...

story:
It was many-a-moon of paint and foam dust on the hands of Marti and Trev that kicked it all off. It was hours of cultivating the ideas, approaches and making sure the core ethics were strong and steadfast. A partnership soon formed with Blake Combrinck, owner of the exciting Knext Gallery in Cape Town CBD where we then hosted a Drink&Draw.  This saw some of Cape Town's strongest visually creative talent in the same room, making things. Since then we have already commissioned 8 artists (in our first month) and  have come to the moment to put out a call to action and contribution in exchange for beautiful artworks and merchandise This involves YOU, lovely worldly beings. We believe in this idea and believe you will too. The potential is infinite and the intent is wholesome. Please take a few minutes to read below. 

The dude's name above is Marti Lund. He is a street artist, oil painter, community muralist coordinator and more recently, surfboard artist.From that passion he founded MAAKboards,  a surfboard label aimed at making a strong move in unifying the Cape Town creative community, to create artwork commissions for artists towards beautiful functional artboards. He saw it as potential to run future outreach programs, a mode of unifying an incredibly diverse and exciting creative community together through a unique collective creative event, now named the Drink&Draw.

 

  • The perks start with 6 custom made artboards, shaped by our top-notch shaper Trev Minny and painted by our first 5 artists painting under the MAAKboards label.
  • A range of 30 original small artworks, contributed works from artists and a limited edition print series of the works made by a group of artists at our first Drink&Draw event.
  • Custom board bags made by our main collaborator Alice.D.  
  • Custom designed and printed t-shirts made by a selection of our artists. A range of smaller merchandise such badges, pendants and stickers. 

Thi campaign is aimed at raiding funds to kick off our business, get our boards into the right places, build a website and get artists painting boards in order to solidify the family. When this ball is in full-roll, we're going to be affecting and helping grow the careers of a range of artists. With this in mind, we've focussed on the art, on getting artist's designs and artwork out there. The campaign itself simply functions as an art auction, with the flare and added intricacy of surfboards

We need R200 000 or $16000

In essence, you'll be contributing to a drastic shift in the lives of many creatives.MAAkboards will affect many people, from the people making the boards to the people who get to ride them globally. The concept allows for the expansion of a unique community, to bring in artists, create exposure, a solid revenue stream and surfboards that only dreams could create. The community, which includes artists and buyers of the boards, will benefit from ongoing social media updates of the travels of the boards, building a creative, open platform for contributions of writing, poetry, photography and artworks. It is all about creativity and is able to be expanded to a point of real, effective inclusivity. 

Marti Lund is an artist based in Cape Town who is known for naturalistic street art, oil paintings, surfboard art and community mural projects. He has been working full time as an artist for 4 years and has conducted and facilitated many inclusive community based projects with NGO's and schools from Zambia to South Africa. He will soon be doing the same in Bali, Indonesia as an artist in residency. 

Trevor Minny is a surfboard shaper from Kommetjie, Cape Town. He has been shaping boards for 9 years, having worked alongside and under Dave Van Ginkel and Anton Butler from DVG and Ferral Surfboards. With a team of riders riding for him and a steady output of boards, he has become a well known name in Cape Town's surf scene. 

Blake Combrinck is the founder of Knext Gallery in Harrington Street,Cape Town. A gallery that aims to empower artists, he is focused on finding the hidden creative talents of the city and allowing them a space to showcase their work. Knext Gallery is the home of non-pretentiousness in Cape Towns oft pretentious artworld, where value is given where it is due and strong work is considered with humility and compassion.  This is his creation. 

We would love you to contribute financially but if you cannot, the most powerful thing to do would be to spread the word. Get this out there, share it with friends, help us expand the readership, the people interested and the good people who may help to make this happen.

Please look at the Indiegogo Share Tools to make this a little easier.

We would love you to contribute financially but if you cannot, the most powerful thing to do would be to spread the word. Get this out there, share it with friends, help us expand the readership, the people interested and the good people who may help to make this happen.
Please look at the Indiegogo Share Tools to make this a little easier.

story:
Short Summary (scroll down for French)

 

I first met Gerard in 2016  when I went to visit "Sobo Bade" for the first time. This a place in Senegal that Gerard founded, planned and built. When I first came to this place, I was so impressed not only by the unique architecture and atmosphere, but also, of course, with the inspiring person that Gerard Chenet is.  He is a dreamer who makes his dreams a reality.  I began shooting photos of the buildings, structures, sculptures and also of Gerard.  When you come upon a treasure like this place and this person, it's clear that the world needs to know about it.  Bringing art, music, nature, poetry, and architecture together is incredibly inspiring and this is what Sobo Bade holds.  

 

I am so honored to tell you that I will be collaborating on a book project with Gerard.  The book (in English and French) will be called "Mon denier mot- je time ma vie” and will contain my photos of Sobo Bade and of Gerard, and be filled with his poetry, philosophy, and stories.  I'm thrilled to be able to get this out into the world as I truly believe it will be an inspiration to many to follow their passion.  

Here´s a video about the project in Sobo Bade:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=479&v=BNneGPMdPkg

 

The architectural appearance seemed to me like an experimental collaboration of Gaudi, Hundertwasser and Disneyland. But there´s nothing artificial about it. Gerard Chenet consructed this place as an architect and built a lot of it by bricks made out of the soil that he found there.  The natural Beauty of the place is quite impressing. And a lot of various activities like Yoga retreats, art exhibitions, theatre pieces and concerts are taking place. 

I am so honored to tell you that I will be collaborating on a book project with Gerard.  The book (in English and French) will be called "Mon denier mot- je time ma vie” and will contain my photos of Sobo Bade and of Gerard, and be filled with his poetry, philosophy, and stories.  I'm thrilled to be able to get this out into the world as I truly believe it will be an inspiration to many to follow their passion.  We already started the Book project that will contain Gerards architecture and poems in October 2017  with the budget coming from our own pockets.

Most of the photo works that we need is already done. The poems are already there.

We met Gerards publishing company (L´Harmattan, Senegal) and they  are exited about the project since we showed them the first pictures. They agreed to take care of the design, translation, PR and distribution process. BUT we will be responsible for the printing costs.

The book is supposed to be be a high- quality product and I will personally follow the printing process in Berlin. In March i will travel to Senegal again and then Gerard and i will put our heads together and finish the book. It will be published latest in June/ July 2018. And then you will get your copy delivered. 

The Impact

After all this years a lot of people learned about Gerards project -but to make the space survive, it is necessary, to have even more people to come there and learn about it. 

Also as a person Gerard is really inspiring and especially for people who want to grow old and be active but also for younger generations he can be a role model to go after what you really want and then to reach it. Also it´s just a nice place to hear about, to go there and relax- the more people know about it, the better...

Risks & Challenges

Milestones:

Thanks to all the support we ha so far we reached almost 700 €- that was the first milestone: i will go back to Senegal and finish the book, also the perks except for the book will be produced and delivered. now we will start the second stage: we continue the campaign.

In order to make this a reality, however, we need your support.  We have started a crowdfunding campaign to raise 5800 Euros to realize this project. We got 684€ by now alltogether. The first steps can be now taken, due to the support of many founders. We won´t give up, but we will change the strategy to realise the project:

1st aim will be: 

to reach additional 600 €, then we will be able to print 100 books "on demand" right after the campaign ends

2nd aim will be:

To reach an amount that will allow to print a bigger amount of books: 1000 copies- wich is the ultimate goal- to reach this goal we need to reach a minimum amount of 3500 € 

3rd aim will be (optional):

The absolute dream will be to print at the printing company o our choice wich will be possible, if we reach an amount of 5000 €.

There are many "perks" or items that are available now for you to pre-order to help us reach our goal.  Not only is the book available for pre-order, but also items from postcards to signed fine art prints.   So we will really go for it and with your trust and participation we can reach this goal together. And of course there are also various perks available, besides the book. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please remember: there´s always a way to help the project even if it just 1 € it helps a lot if there are many. Also if you want to share it on Facebook or through your mail with friends or just distribute our cards this will help us a lot. Maybe you know some friends of yours that could really benefit from it or be interested.  It´s also just a magnificent place to spend your holidays!

Thank you for joining us to help share the legacy of Gerard, and to inspire others through the process of sharing his story.  

 

Court résumé 

 Nous sommes Gérard Chenet et Philip Kojo Metz

  Gérard Chenet est un artiste, un architecte, un poète et, surtout, le fondateur d'un petit paradis au sud de Dakar, au Sénégal, appelé Sobo Badé.

 Il a maintenant 90 ans et a commencé le projet il y a 25 ans. Sobo Bade est un hôtel avec un restaurant, juste au bord de la mer et ce qui est très spécial à propos de cet endroit, la pièce maîtresse! C'est l'amphithéâtre, où se déroulent des spectacles internationaux de danse / musique/ théâtre. C'est un véritable centre culturel qui relie les artistes locaux aux artistes internationaux et attire les touristes ainsi que les habitants. Gérard Chenet a fondé, planifié et construit ce lieu. Quand j'ai vu ce bel endroit au début, j'ai été fasciné par le concept et comment tout va si bien ensemble. J'aime l'idée que les arts dans ce cas influencent la vie au jour le jour, de beaucoup de gens, des habitants du village de Toubab Dialaw - des gens qui passent ou y restent pendant quelques jours, en ayant la chance d'assister directement à une résidence artistique, tout en nouant souvent des contacts personnels avec les artistes locaux. De même, des artistes internationaux apportent un sens et un goût du monde au village.  Voici une vidéo sur le projet à Sobo Bade:

L'aspect architectural m'a paru comme une collaboration expérimentale entre Gaudi, Hundertwasser et Disneyland.

 Mais il n'y a rien d'artificiel ici. Gérard Chenet a construit ce lieu en architecte autodidacte, utilisant le principe de la récupération et d'une utilisation esthétique des briques en terre cuite. La beauté naturelle de l'endroit est assez impressionnante. Et beaucoup d'activités diverses comme des retraites de yoga, des expositions d'art, des pièces de théâtre et des concerts ont lieu. Le souhait est apparu en moi, de montrer ce projet, cette personne étonnante, ma fascination pour le lieu et la personne qui l'a créé.

 Ce serait mon souhait que les gens en apprennent davantage sur lui et cet endroit qu'il a créé, afin que l'idée puisse continuer, grandir, inspirer et amener les autres à avoir le courage de commencer à faire eux aussi, ce qu'ils veulent profondément et ainsi réaliser les choses auxquelles ils croient très fort. Je pense que nous avons besoin de connaître des hommes exemplaires afin d'apprendre de ces Pionniers.

  Nous avons déjà commencé le projet du livre qui contiendra des photos d'architecture prises par moi, Philip et les poèmes de Gérard. Ce livre sortira en octobre de cette année 2018 avec le budget venant de nos propres poches.

La plupart des travaux de photos dont nous avons besoin sont déjà terminés. Les poèmes sont déjà là.

 

 Nous avons rencontré la maison d'édition de Gérard (L'Harmattan, Sénégal) et ils sont entrés dans le projet dès que nous leur avons montré les premières images et les mots du poète.  Ils ont accepté de prendre en charge la conception, la traduction, les relations publiques et le processus de distribution.  Mais nous serons responsables des coûts d'impression ...   le livre devra être un produit de haute qualité et je suivrai personnellement le processus d'impression à Berlin. En mars, je me rendrai de nouveau au Sénégal, puis Gérard et moi terminerons le livre. Il sera publié au plus tard en juin / juillet 2018. Et vous recevrez votre exemplaire.

 

L'impact

 Après toutes ces années, beaucoup de gens ont appris à connaître le lieu de Gérard - mais pour l'aider à faire en sorte que Sobo Badé s'épanouisse et continue à jouer son rôle de pépinière artistique, il est nécessaire d'avoir encore plus de gens prêts à y venir. J'insiste, en tant que personne, Gérard est vraiment inspirant, surtout pour les personnes qui veulent vieillir et demeurer actives, et pour les jeunes générations, il peut être un modèle.

 Sobo Badé est un endroit agréable pour se retrouver, se ressourcer et se détendre - plus les gens le savent, mieux c'est ... C'est juste un endroit magnifique pour passer vos vacances! 

 

 Risques et défis

 Bien sûr, pour atteindre les 5.800 €, nous devons vendre BEAUCOUP de livres en ligne, sans même pouvoir vous le montrer en personne. Mais nous avons déjà publié plusieurs livres et réalisé différents projets. Nous avons confiance et avec votre confiance et votre participation, nous pouvons atteindre cet objectif ensemble. Et bien sûr, il y a aussi divers avantages disponibles, en plus du livre. Rappelez-vous: il y a toujours un moyen d'aider le projet ne serait-ce qu'en versant 1 €, ça peut aider, s'il y en a beaucoup! Si vous voulez le partager sur Facebook ou via votre courrier avec des amis ou simplement distribuer nos cartes, cela nous aidera beaucoup. Peut-être connaissez-vous des amis qui pourraient vraiment en tirer profit ou être intéressés?

 MERCI d'avoir pris le temps de passer par là, merci pour tout votre soutien, merci de faire du bruit.

 Nous vous tiendrons au courant de l'avancement de la campagne.

Restez à l'écoute!

Also it´s just a nice place to hear about, to go there and relax- the more people know about it, the better...Risks & ChallengesMilestones:Thanks to all the support we ha so far we reached almost 700 €- that was the first milestone: i will go back to Senegal and finish the book, also the perks except for the book will be produced and delivered. now we will start the second stage: we continue the campaign.In order to make this a reality, however, we need your support.  We have started a crowdfunding campaign to raise 5800 Euros to realize this project. We got 684€ by now alltogether. The first steps can be now taken, due to the support of many founders. We won´t give up, but we will change the strategy to realise the project:1st aim will be: to reach additional 600 €, then we will be able to print 100 books "on demand" right after the campaign ends2nd aim will be:To reach an amount that will allow to print a bigger amount of books: 1000 copies- wich is the ultimate goal- to reach this goal we need to reach a minimum amount of 3500 € 3rd aim will be (optional):The absolute dream will be to print at the printing company o our choice wich will be possible, if we reach an amount of 5000 €.There are many "perks" or items that are available now for you to pre-order to help us reach our goal.  Not only is the book available for pre-order, but also items from postcards to signed fine art prints.   So we will really go for it and with your trust and participation we can reach this goal together. And of course there are also various perks available, besides the book. Other Ways You Can HelpPlease remember: there´s always a way to help the project even if it just 1 € it helps a lot if there are many. Also if you want to share it on Facebook or through your mail with friends or just distribute our cards this will help us a lot. Maybe you know some friends of yours that could really benefit from it or be interested.  It´s also just a magnificent place to spend your holidays!Thank you for joining us to help share the legacy of Gerard, and to inspire others through the process of sharing his story.   Court résumé  Nous sommes Gérard Chenet et Philip Kojo Metz  Gérard Chenet est un artiste, un architecte, un poète et, surtout, le fondateur d'un petit paradis au sud de Dakar, au Sénégal, appelé Sobo Badé. Il a maintenant 90 ans et a commencé le projet il y a 25 ans. Sobo Bade est un hôtel avec un restaurant, juste au bord de la mer et ce qui est très spécial à propos de cet endroit, la pièce maîtresse! C'est l'amphithéâtre, où se déroulent des spectacles internationaux de danse / musique/ théâtre. C'est un véritable centre culturel qui relie les artistes locaux aux artistes internationaux et attire les touristes ainsi que les habitants. Gérard Chenet a fondé, planifié et construit ce lieu. Quand j'ai vu ce bel endroit au début, j'ai été fasciné par le concept et comment tout va si bien ensemble. J'aime l'idée que les arts dans ce cas influencent la vie au jour le jour, de beaucoup de gens, des habitants du village de Toubab Dialaw - des gens qui passent ou y restent pendant quelques jours, en ayant la chance d'assister directement à une résidence artistique, tout en nouant souvent des contacts personnels avec les artistes locaux. De même, des artistes internationaux apportent un sens et un goût du monde au village.  Voici une vidéo sur le projet à Sobo Bade:L'aspect architectural m'a paru comme une collaboration expérimentale entre Gaudi, Hundertwasser et Disneyland. Mais il n'y a rien d'artificiel ici. Gérard Chenet a construit ce lieu en architecte autodidacte, utilisant le principe de la récupération et d'une utilisation esthétique des briques en terre cuite. La beauté naturelle de l'endroit est assez impressionnante. Et beaucoup d'activités diverses comme des retraites de yoga, des expositions d'art, des pièces de théâtre et des concerts ont lieu. Le souhait est apparu en moi, de montrer ce projet, cette personne étonnante, ma fascination pour le lieu et la personne qui l'a créé. Ce serait mon souhait que les gens en apprennent davantage sur lui et cet endroit qu'il a créé, afin que l'idée puisse continuer, grandir, inspirer et amener les autres à avoir le courage de commencer à faire eux aussi, ce qu'ils veulent profondément et ainsi réaliser les choses auxquelles ils croient très fort. Je pense que nous avons besoin de connaître des hommes exemplaires afin d'apprendre de ces Pionniers.  Nous avons déjà commencé le projet du livre qui contiendra des photos d'architecture prises par moi, Philip et les poèmes de Gérard. Ce livre sortira en octobre de cette année 2018 avec le budget venant de nos propres poches.La plupart des travaux de photos dont nous avons besoin sont déjà terminés. Les poèmes sont déjà là.  Nous avons rencontré la maison d'édition de Gérard (L'Harmattan, Sénégal) et ils sont entrés dans le projet dès que nous leur avons montré les premières images et les mots du poète.  Ils ont accepté de prendre en charge la conception, la traduction, les relations publiques et le processus de distribution.  Mais nous serons responsables des coûts d'impression ...   le livre devra être un produit de haute qualité et je suivrai personnellement le processus d'impression à Berlin. En mars, je me rendrai de nouveau au Sénégal, puis Gérard et moi terminerons le livre. Il sera publié au plus tard en juin / juillet 2018. Et vous recevrez votre exemplaire. L'impact Après toutes ces années, beaucoup de gens ont appris à connaître le lieu de Gérard - mais pour l'aider à faire en sorte que Sobo Badé s'épanouisse et continue à jouer son rôle de pépinière artistique, il est nécessaire d'avoir encore plus de gens prêts à y venir. J'insiste, en tant que personne, Gérard est vraiment inspirant, surtout pour les personnes qui veulent vieillir et demeurer actives, et pour les jeunes générations, il peut être un modèle. Sobo Badé est un endroit agréable pour se retrouver, se ressourcer et se détendre - plus les gens le savent, mieux c'est ... C'est juste un endroit magnifique pour passer vos vacances!   Risques et défis Bien sûr, pour atteindre les 5.800 €, nous devons vendre BEAUCOUP de livres en ligne, sans même pouvoir vous le montrer en personne. Mais nous avons déjà publié plusieurs livres et réalisé différents projets. Nous avons confiance et avec votre confiance et votre participation, nous pouvons atteindre cet objectif ensemble. Et bien sûr, il y a aussi divers avantages disponibles, en plus du livre. Rappelez-vous: il y a toujours un moyen d'aider le projet ne serait-ce qu'en versant 1 €, ça peut aider, s'il y en a beaucoup! Si vous voulez le partager sur Facebook ou via votre courrier avec des amis ou simplement distribuer nos cartes, cela nous aidera beaucoup. Peut-être connaissez-vous des amis qui pourraient vraiment en tirer profit ou être intéressés? MERCI d'avoir pris le temps de passer par là, merci pour tout votre soutien, merci de faire du bruit. Nous vous tiendrons au courant de l'avancement de la campagne.Restez à l'écoute!

story:
WHO AM I?

Hi,
My name is Kim Ye. As a Chinese-born American, I was raised in Illinois, and have been living and working in Los Angeles for the past 10 years. As an interdisciplinary artist, I’ve exhibited my work nationally and internationally, and I use all the tools I have at hand to draw attention to the circulation of power. I trace the path of power in order to propose alternate flows that disrupt current hierarchies held in place by social, economic, and sexual norms.

I draw attention to these norms—which are really just collective ruts—so that together, we can dig ourselves out by changing the structure of our interactions. From running a Femme Gaze Fotobooth at the Hammer Museum in which participants become another prop to be arranged and photographed, to trading artists a piece of their work for a fantasy fulfillment experience, my work creates cracks in the social facade whereby new relational possibilities can emerge. Since power lives between bodies and entities, my work is located in this in-between space, augmenting everyday situations using play, negotiation, and consent.

My visiting artist "lecture" at Pomona College, Claremont, CA (2015)

 

WHO IS LADYSCUMBAG?

As many folks are already aware, femmes circulating in the world face a slew of frustrating inequities simply because of the position we occupy.  Harassment, objectification, insolence—this is the shit with which we consistently tango, so it's no surprise that we are exhausted by these seemingly relentless daily confrontations.

But what if we can produce our own privilege? Is it possible to transform the very qualities that are used by the hegemonic, misogynistic patriarchy to hold us down--our feminine presentation, our sexuality, our perceived demureness and incompetence—into weapons of mass destruction? Is it possible to break the glass ceiling one stiletto heel at a time?

These is what the LADYSCUMBAG archetype is all about. By simultaneously harnessing the codes of femininity while disregarding others’ judgments of Her character, LADYSCUMBAG (LSB) can operate as a secret agent, a Trojan horse that works towards the destruction of the powers that be. As a counterfeit basic bitch: LSB is crass, self-interested, and grimy on the inside. She puts Herself first, using her well-honed—if undisguised—feminine wiles to suck the resources out of unsuspecting bros and other human accessories that lay in her path. Adapting her tone to fit the situation at hand, LSB is a lady first but definitely not foremost. Amoral, not immoral, She’ll drink your beer and then piss in your lawn. Her motives are not fueled by vindictiveness or cruelty—rather her superpower stems from a blatant disregard of others’ perceptions and judgments of Her character. Utilizing desire as the path of least resistance, She is Her Own protagonist.

Always committed to finding the morsel of (self)interest in any situation, LADYSCUMBAG is a boat that produces Her Own rising tide. But for this rising tide to wash away the bullshit on the shore, LSBs need to work in tandem, scheming with one another in plain sight...
 
 

 

WHAT WE NEED

As an archetype, LADYSCUMBAG is much, much bigger than me, which is why I’m asking for your help. I'm raising funds for this project, which has a both exists online and IRL as:

  1. www.LADYSCUMBAG.com 
  2. LADYSCUMBAG art show (LA)


Paying contributors

First, of course, there is the LADYSCUMBAG.com site, which I am soliciting content for starting in my own community. Having sent out nearly 200 individual emails to a diverse group of artists, writers, childhood friends, past coworkers, and recreational sports teammates, the enthusiasm of responses I’ve received has been overwhelmingly enthusiastic and inspiring.  With over 40 people (and counting!) already committed to contributing to LADYSCUMBAG’s (LSB’s) online presence, I am asking for your help to raise funds to pay our contributors. While I’m not here to wax poetic on the gender pay gap or the (emotional) labor that women and femmes already do for free, I am here to lead by example.  In offering an honorarium to those who take the initiative to share their lived experiences for our collective benefit, this LSB is inviting you to help model the ethic we hope to see in the world.

Screenshot of in-progress LadyScumbag.com site

Paying for materials 

Secondly, there is the physical art exhibit that will take place over a 5-week period at Visitor Welcome Center (VWC)—an artist-run space in Los Angeles with a history of championing the work of queer, POC, and women artists. For the duration of the LSB show, the space will be turned into an immersive and interactive installation, where visitors can participate in the production and propagation of the LSB archetype. Schooling gallery-goers in the feminine arts, I will be offering visitors the opportunity to embroider their own LSB utility bags (every femme needs an emergency kit), sew their own panties, and do their own makeup for superior selfie potential. While I will be holding office hours during gallery hours to help, instruct, and dialogue with visitors, the materials, merchandise, and makeup all cost money. In addition, there are the installation costs of turning a white cube gallery into a femme-oriented start up space complete with original sculptures, workstations, and weekly programming in the form of panels and workshops.

Interior shot from entrance of Visitor Welcome Center 

Covering gallery costs

Finally, like most galleries, VWC depends on sales from the show to sustain its operating costs. This exhibit however, unlike more traditional art exhibitions, will not have fine art objects for sale—thus denying the space of the ability to make money in the traditional, and problematic, manner. As an alternative form of sustainability, I am asking for the community’s support to share the burden of the gallery's costs for the duration of the LADYSCUMBAG exhibit. If you believe that the art world’s business model needs to be updated to reflect less elitist and more grassroots interests, this is your chance to help test drive a different model. By supporting this artist-run space that has taken many risks over the past 2+ years on the work and visions of emerging artists who are underrepresented in under the current market-driven art ecosystem, you are leveling the playing field and making space for more diverse points of view to come forth.

Breakdown of how funds will be used 

$5000 for contributor honorariums

$2000 for website + gallery costs

(web hosting + admin, gallery rent, utilities, demo of old wall, building new wall in different part of gallery, vinyl lettering, paint, drywall, 2x4s and other materials for installation, and labor and paint to restore space upon deinstallation)

$2000 merchandise materials

(200 utility bags, 100 yards custom LSB elastic, silkscreens, silkscreen ink, fabric, 3 embroidery pens, 100 yards assorted fabric, sewing machine needles and thread) 

$1000 events + programming

(refreshments, snacks, parking, photographer and videographer for documentation, special guest fees, closing party for LSB's birth into the world)
 

THE IMPACT

The LADYSCUMBAG project is, at its core, a seedling with the potential of creating social change through personal and collective empowerment. At this stage, it is still a baby—one that needs the help of the entire village to raise it. This campaign is a question: Is there a need for LADYSCUMBAG in the world? Are there people out there who resonate with her ideals and aspirations? Is there a LSB in all of us?

If so, if you see the (latent) LADYSCUMBAG within yourself or in the eyes of the femmes you love, please help coax her out of her shell by donating to this cause. With every dollar, you are watering and fertilizing the seedling, showing her that there is a hunger for her self-possession, prowess, and unapologetically powerful femme-ness in this world.

And if you are not in a place to donate money right now (I feel you!), you can still help by spreading the word and sharing this campaign with those in your community who might resonate with the LSB vibe.

Thank you for giving your attention to this important cause.

Love,
Kim 

P.S. If you would like to participate in the project as a contributor, I would love to hear from you!

story:
WHO WE ARE

SUN DSCNDNTS is a collective comprised of eight Oakland-based artists of color.

CONTAGIOUS SPIRIT showcases the work of four of these eight artists: Maddy "MADlines" Clifford, Allie "XOA" Howard, Esther "ASTU" Kibreab, and Zachary "Pablo Circa" Westbrook. 

 

WHAT WE'RE DOING

CONTAGIOUS SPIRIT  uses music, photography and film to reimagine widely held stereotypes about Black women and girls' perceived lack of innocence. The ultimate goal is to shift the focus from vilifying the ways Black women heal and towards honoring their courageous and contagious spirit of resistance. 

 

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

WE NEED HELP COVERING THE COST of ...

Video production, marketing and event production, which includes but is not limited to:

  • Video Materials, Refreshments for Volunteer Participants, Permits
  • Photography Canvases for Up to Ten Pieces, Easels 
  • Event Flyers and Posters, Renting Sound Equipment, Purchasing a Projector

 

SHOWCASE

THIS PROJECT CULMINATES IN A WOMEN'S HISTORY MONTH SHOWCASE:

Saturday, March 31st - 7 - 10PM @ BETTI ONO

  • Featuring musical performances by FR333, ASTU and YAJJ
  • Photography and a stunning music video by Zachary Westbrook

 

EVERY BIT COUNTS!

PLEASE SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN!

THANK YOU.

story:
Hello, and welcome to my crowdfunding page! My name is Tom Hyatt, and I'm a singer, songwriter and artist living in London. Recently I've been hard at work on a multi-disciplinary art project, Lost in a Dream, that I'd like to finally tell you about and, hopefully, get some financial support for.

 

The Background

It all started some time ago when Rosie Sherwood from As Yet Untitled approached me to collaborate on an artist's book. My mind immediately went to thoughts I'd been having about the temporary nature of music scenes and the transient artists that embody them. I decided that I wanted to create a photographic record of some of the talented musicians that I'm lucky enough to call my friends, to support their art and give them some healthy exposure (ha!)

It's increasingly hard to be a musician in London. The cost of living grows higher as CD sales get lower and the industry changes. It's not just the artists either – many small venues are finding it increasingly more difficult to stay open, and unless we safeguard and support grassroots live music it can all quite easily and simply disappear.

 

The Exhibition

The Harrison in Kings Cross has been incredibly supportive to musicians over the years, facilitating countless friendships, and it is a pleasure and a priviledge to have their support with Lost in a Dream.

From the 25th to the 31st of June, the photos will be on display in the basement venue of the Harrison. By printing in the darkroom, I'll be able to make the photos not light-fast. As a result, from Monday to Sunday they'll fade to black – if you don't come down to see them, they'll be gone!

Each night I'll be curating a mini-festival of gigs featuring the artists from the frames. These include, in alphabetical order:

  • Andrew White (of 40 Elephant Gang)
  • Angie Rance (of Patch and the Giant)
  • Blanche Ellis (from Spain!)
  • Dani Sachar (formerly of Cosmo House)
  • Jack Harris
  • Joe Innes
  • Kirsty Merryn
  • Louis Brennan
  • Maya McCourt
  • Michael Garrett (from France!)
  • Nick Ed Harris
  • Robin Elliott
  • Sam Falle (AKA Winterfalle)
  • Todd Macdonald (AKA Alex Alex)
  • Tom Hyatt (AKA me!)

 

The Book

In collaboration with independent publisher Rosie Sherwood of As Yet Untitled, the photos will be collected in two different artist books:

  • A unique, loose-leaf collection of darkroom printed photos, in a collection box, handmade by myself and Rosie Sherwood. This is the proper arty one!
  • A limited print run of paperbacks.

Both types of book are available to pre-order via the crowdfunder, so get your order in now!

 

Where You Come In

The costs associated with this project include:

  • Photo-related costs – film, chemicals, paper, darkroom sessions etc.
  • Materials for making the unique artist books
  • A print run of paper-back books
  • Paying the performers on the nights
  • Paying someone to do sound
  • Recording and producing a live compilation of the artists
  • The plane fares of our international artists, flying in for their one-night-only performances!

I'm keeping entry to the gigs and the exhibition free, and so hope to recoup the costs in sales of the compilation, books and prints. That's where you come in! For a small contribution you can, after I produce it, get a digital copy of the live compilation in a loss-less audio format. I'd really love to get some pre-orders in for books, so if any of this has at all piqued your interest let me know via the crowdfunder rewards. If you know or like any artist in particular, then you can also request a darkroom print (light-fast, I promise) of any of the portraits.

If you want to own something truly special, then get a pre-order in for one of Rosie's hand-made, darkroom-printed photobooks.

If you live in mainland UK, you can also curate your own house gig! You'll be guaranteed a performance from me, along with a choice of support (subject to availability). If you're outside the M25, travel and accomodation to be agreed.

Finally, if you can't offer monetary support and live close enough to London, your attendance at the Harrison to see the (state of) the photographs and support any of the artists' performances will be much appreciated. Again, the exhibition will run from the 25th to the 31st June, so stick it in your calendars now and the line-up will be revealed soon!

Finally, thanks for reading this far. See you at the exhibition!
story_txt:
Hello, and welcome to my crowdfunding page! My name is Tom Hyatt, and I'm a singer, songwriter and artist living in London. Recently I've been hard at work on a multi-disciplinary art project, Lost in a Dream, that I'd like to finally tell you about and, hopefully, get some financial support for. The BackgroundIt all started some time ago when Rosie Sherwood from As Yet Untitled approached me to collaborate on an artist's book. My mind immediately went to thoughts I'd been having about the temporary nature of music scenes and the transient artists that embody them. I decided that I wanted to create a photographic record of some of the talented musicians that I'm lucky enough to call my friends, to support their art and give them some healthy exposure (ha!)It's increasingly hard to be a musician in London. The cost of living grows higher as CD sales get lower and the industry changes. It's not just the artists either – many small venues are finding it increasingly more difficult to stay open, and unless we safeguard and support grassroots live music it can all quite easily and simply disappear. The ExhibitionThe Harrison in Kings Cross has been incredibly supportive to musicians over the years, facilitating countless friendships, and it is a pleasure and a priviledge to have their support with Lost in a Dream.From the 25th to the 31st of June, the photos will be on display in the basement venue of the Harrison. By printing in the darkroom, I'll be able to make the photos not light-fast. As a result, from Monday to Sunday they'll fade to black – if you don't come down to see them, they'll be gone!Each night I'll be curating a mini-festival of gigs featuring the artists from the frames. These include, in alphabetical order:
Andrew White (of 40 Elephant Gang)
Angie Rance (of Patch and the Giant)
Blanche Ellis (from Spain!)
Dani Sachar (formerly of Cosmo House)
Jack Harris
Joe Innes
Kirsty Merryn
Louis Brennan
Maya McCourt
Michael Garrett (from France!)
Nick Ed Harris
Robin Elliott
Sam Falle (AKA Winterfalle)
Todd Macdonald (AKA Alex Alex)
Tom Hyatt (AKA me!)
 The BookIn collaboration with independent publisher Rosie Sherwood of As Yet Untitled, the photos will be collected in two different artist books:
A unique, loose-leaf collection of darkroom printed photos, in a collection box, handmade by myself and Rosie Sherwood. This is the proper arty one!
A limited print run of paperbacks.
Both types of book are available to pre-order via the crowdfunder, so get your order in now! Where You Come InThe costs associated with this project include:
Photo-related costs – film, chemicals, paper, darkroom sessions etc.
Materials for making the unique artist books
A print run of paper-back books
Paying the performers on the nights
Paying someone to do sound
Recording and producing a live compilation of the artists
The plane fares of our international artists, flying in for their one-night-only performances!
I'm keeping entry to the gigs and the exhibition free, and so hope to recoup the costs in sales of the compilation, books and prints. That's where you come in! For a small contribution you can, after I produce it, get a digital copy of the live compilation in a loss-less audio format. I'd really love to get some pre-orders in for books, so if any of this has at all piqued your interest let me know via the crowdfunder rewards. If you know or like any artist in particular, then you can also request a darkroom print (light-fast, I promise) of any of the portraits.If you want to own something truly special, then get a pre-order in for one of Rosie's hand-made, darkroom-printed photobooks.If you live in mainland UK, you can also curate your own house gig! You'll be guaranteed a performance from me, along with a choice of support (subject to availability). If you're outside the M25, travel and accomodation to be agreed.Finally, if you can't offer monetary support and live close enough to London, your attendance at the Harrison to see the (state of) the photographs and support any of the artists' performances will be much appreciated. Again, the exhibition will run from the 25th to the 31st June, so stick it in your calendars now and the line-up will be revealed soon!Finally, thanks for reading this far. See you at the exhibition!

story:
TufTitties

  • We believe in self-exporation and admiration through exposure and display.
  • Jessy Goodman and Jason Baldwin wanted to share their incredibly sexy friends with the world while showing off some of the best parts of Southeast, Alaska.
  • TufTitties is the beginning of an ever expanding search for cultural significance in Southeast, Alaska.

Tit for Tat

  • This campaign is aiming to raise $4500 to further explore the islands of the Alexander Archipelago looking for the most self-expressive people Alaska has to offer.
  • From supple to sultry our skintastic calendar shows you a sampling of the best of what Ketchikan, AK has to offer!
  • If the project does not reach our goal, the funds will be used to create what merch we can and create a celebretory gift for everyone involved in the project.

The Impact

  • Jessy and Jason believe in the power of unbridled self-expression. 
  • This project is purpose built to make it fun and easy for contributors to find show themselves in a light they may have never seen themselves in before.
  • Alaska can bring out all sorts of wonderful attributes in a person. We captured all that we could of the participants and now we want to find more people that believe in the power of Alaska.

Risks & Challenges

  • We understand that this form of expression doesn't represent everyone's way of thinking.
  • We welcome open discussion on how this type of publication affects the global discussion of equality across all lines.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
