story:
My name is Ty, and about 6 months ago, I discovered a slight talent for drawing which I never knew I had! It all started when my wife bought me a box of Derwent Pastel Pencils and some drawing paper as a wedding gift (as I have always been a creative person, but never tried fine art before). The first ever drawing I did was the cheetah eyes you can see above. I was blown away by the outcome and fell in love with it. Since that first drawing, I have done three others and all have been donated as gifts and to various wildlife conservation fundraisers that the zoo I work for has thrown; including the Goodfellows Tree Kangaroo that you can also see above. This was actually the first of my works to be sold in a silent auction that raised money for various Tree Kangaroo conservation programs.

Unfortunately, art supplies are not cheap, and in my amateur state, I did not have the foresight to sell a drawing to make money to pay for these new supplies. I have essentially almost used up all of my pencils doing drawings that I have donated to raise money for wildlife charities. So this campaign is to raise a little money so I can buy some supplies that will be able to pay for themselves thereafter. 

The very first art piece that will be made, however, will be a drawing that I am donating to a Sun Bear fundraiser my work is throwing in November. While the planning is still in the early stages and exact charities have not be finalised, the money raised will go to various Sun Bear conservation programs such as Free the Bears.

Finally, I will then attempt to sell some of my drawings that will allow me to keep purchasing more supplies, and continue the cycle.

 

What I Need

  • Pan Pastels - the basic set of 7 colours I am looking at from softpastels.com.au is $89.95AUD (with $10 delivery fee) and will allow me to complete larger blocks of colour without wasting so much of my pencils.

Getting these Pan Pastels is the main goal for my campaign, so I really only need $100, however, Indiegogo's 'minimum goal' has to be $500. So if there are many generous people out there and the funds go above $100, these are the items I would purchase with that money:

  • Pastel Pencils - my current set are getting very short, so getting a new set would allow me to keep drawing and increase the chance of my drawings being able to fund future art supplies. The cheapest set of 60 Stabilo CarbOthello Pastel Pencils I have found is from theartshop.com.au and is $279.95AUD.

  • Pastelmat Paper - this paper is known in the industry as one of the best for pastel pencils and I have never had enough money to buy some! Pads range anywhere from $39.95-$89.95AUD depending on the size of the paper

  • Extra Pan Pastels - the set I have outlined above is great to start off with and will allow me to mix to create a large number of colours, but there are many other sets with many specific shades that would be amazing to be able to use and experiment with.

If I am not able to reach my personal goal of $100, the money will be going into a specific art account to which I will add whenever I have a few dollars spare, and hopfully will eventually reach the $100 goal on my own in the future.

 

The Impact

Drawing is fun for me. Wildlife conservation is important to me. So I will always be drawing with the intention to raise money and awarness for various conservation efforts around the world. Your contributions are going to allow me to keep doing this.

100% of the money from the few artworks I do personally sell will go back into funding future art supplies (I wish I thought about this from the beginning haha), and if I make more money than is needed for the supplies, the rest will be donated to particular wildlife charities. I see my art as a way to help and contribute, rather than a way for me to make money for myself.

So thank you in advance. While the contribution you may make today is going to the purchase of art supplies, those art supplies are contributing to good things for endangered species around the world.

story:
About the Project

I have always been fascinated with mythology and folk tales.  When I was a little girl living in Germany, I would go to the library for the high school and read Grimm's Fairy Tales and books on the Greek Myths.  Part of the fun of teaching History for a living is that I've gotten the opportunity to explore and learn more of the myths from many different cultures.  A few years ago, I was brainstorming ideas for a new project and I saw a piece of art of the Virginia State Flag with the goddess Virtue. I had the idea of doing a series of portraits of people as various gods and goddesses.  I started out shooting a self portrait of myself as the Eumenides, or Furies.  And for the past few years, I've been shooting portraits of my friends and other people who have volunteered for the project as well as an additional self portrait as the goddess Nemesis. The word Pantheon means all gods.  I didn't want to limit myself to any particular mythos, but to be open to shooting people as a god or goddess relation to their ethnic heritage or to whom they felt a particular connection. 

 

What I'm Hoping For

I have been working on this project for a couple of years now and I want to finish my collection of portraits and mount a show of the images.  In addition to the show, I would like to self-publish a book of all of the portraits taken, as there were many taken in addition to the final ones that will be collected. 

I'm hoping to raise at least $2000 to pay for high quality prints and display of the images in a fairly large format.  I feel these portraits would best portray their subjects in a larger size.  This would also help to pay for buying prints of the book. 

I would also use some of the money to help fund costumes and travel expenses for the portraits themselves. 

Impact

As a full-time teacher, I don't have a lot of spare time to dedicate to my art and I do not have a lot of income coming in from my art.  I have so many ideas and photos that get shared on my social media that never get an opportunity to be seen by a greater audience. This would give me the opportunity to submit this show to some venues outside of the area to try to gain greater exposure for my art. 

Risks & Challenges

I started this project a couple of years ago.  The original idea was to work with a partner and to share the cost of the project.  But I am now pursuing this project solo and could use assistance.  I also want to work on adding portraits from more diverse backgrounds to the collection. 

How can you help? 

If you're unable to contribute financially, please help by sharing the link for this project and help promote it. 

If you have any ideas for myths beyond the European Pantheons, please let me know.  I'm hoping to expand the reach of the project to multiple cultures.

story:
What is SkyLabyrinth?

SkyLabyrinth is the design and building of possibly the world’s first 3D labyrinth where the path to the centre is on a constant incline. The design is such that it will give the labyrinth walker a far more meaningful and enhanced experience, providing enlightenment and generating more creative thought, opening one up to deeper insight and real solutions.

Not only will SkyLabyrinth do this, but it will be a visually appealing art piece installation that will be fitting of the open, fun, mindful space that AfrikaBurn offers.

 

Who are we?

A team of family and friends lead by SkyLabyrinth's creator, Carl Pretorius.

 

The importance and impact of SkyLabyrinth

SkyLabyrinth is the next generation in Labyrinth design. Our commitment, after AfrikaBurn 2019, is to make the design and thinking open to the world with the sincere wish that more SkyLabyrinths will be built. You can help us to achieve this by either making a contribution here on Indiegogo and by telling your family and friends about SkyLabyrinth.

 

What is needed?

AfrikaBurn have already contributed USD10,000 and we have collectively contributed USD10,000. An additional US50,000 needs to be raised to purchase all the materials needed to build SkyLabyrinth at AfrikaBurn 2019. Over and above this, funds are needed for transporting materials to AfrikaBurn, the contractors' fees and the stipend we will be paying the volunteers who help out to build SkyLabyrinth.

Any contribution will be appreciated. 

The materials include the following:

160 Treated wooden poles

3500 Treated pine pathway planks

450 Treated pine joists

320 Galvanised steel brackets

35,000 Decking screws

2000 Coach screws

story:
I’m delighted to acquire a position on this unique expedition. The prospect of experiencing the Arctic first hand with a handpicked group of contemporary artists and scientists selected from hundreds of applicants worldwide is exhilarating!

This once in a lifetime opportunity provides the chance to enrich my art and research. My passion for vintage photography and history is deeply entwined with the first voyages that pioneering explorers took just over a century ago.  Just like them we’ll collaborate whilst keeping central issues of our time at heart, so that our shared awareness may bring some form of change to the world. 

Bringing back new footage and plenty of inspiration, I’ll be creating a new body of work, doing shows and artists talks as soon as my sea legs have eased! Not everybody gets to experience an adventure like this and for those that are interested I will be documenting my daily experiences during the expedition, which I can’t wait to share.  I’d love my journey to inspire you in some way.

 


What is The Arctic Circle Expedition?

For three weeks I and the other residents will brainstorm and collaborate as the tall ship Antigua sails the remote territories of the high Arctic this October. The Svalbard Archipelago is just ten degrees from the North Pole! 

The Arctic Circle’s Mission is to create a unique platform where art intersects science. “An incubator for thought and experimentation for artists and innovators who seek out and foster areas of collaboration to engage in the central issues of our time”. The Arctic Circle also supports the artist’s professional development through public speaking, publication and exhibit opportunities.  And they engage with the community through outreach programming which has a focus on an inter-disciplinary exchange of ideas in the arts and sciences. 

Some affiliations include: 
Alliance of Artist Communities; New York Academy of Sciences; Art & Science Collaborations, Inc. (ASCI); American Association of Museums (AAM); Res Artis; Artist Residency Association ARCUS, Arctic Research Consortium, Norwegian Polar Institute; and UNIS, The University Center in Svalbard.

 

 

Who am I?

I’m a visual artist currently living in Scotland. I was born in beautiful Vancouver, Canada, and have also lived in England and the Netherlands.

For decades I’ve been a professional fine art photographer, and am lucky enough to have won awards and been published, I moved to Scotland in 2015 to explore my other life long loves; Art, as I was accepted at one of the top schools of art in Europe, Duncan of Jordanstone in Dundee.

I loved this learning experience and gave it my all, it brought out the very best in me and am very proud to say I not only went on to achieve a Masters in Art and Humanities with distinction but also an academic achievement and a citizens award!  But most flatteringly I was awarded a two-year residency at the Duncan of Jordanstone Art school.




 

What is my art form?

Most of my art is photography and philosophy inspired and I love pioneering new forms of photographic imagery, working in sculpture, installation and film.
My artwork is about our transient, fleeting nature as human beings, and the ephemeral nature of our beautiful earth. My work is inspired by the magic and meaning of a photograph, and I’m captivated by early, vintage photography and archival materials.

 

The Art Studio on the RRS Discovery, as during the first voyage
 

What art will I work on in the Arctic?

Being process-oriented, I am always inspired in the moment and my practice takes off from there. I will most certainly be in ‘observation mode’; recording and documenting as much as humanly possible through means of photography and video, aiming to give you a great account of what it is like to be on an expedition. I’ll be keeping a daily logbook that I will process into a digital book once returned. I will also be working on a new body of work during the expedition and anticipate having enough material to inspire me to more creations once back on land. If you are curious, check my links to more of my artwork (see bottom of page).

 

 

My personal mission

Having a love for art, photography and for living in awareness, I’m eager to make a difference on this beautiful planet we live on. I’m curious to collaborate and excited about the inter-disciplinary exchange we are being offered through this residency, it’s a unique opportunity to share ideas with the scientists and artists on the ship.

Furthermore I am passionate about the whole idea of going on an expedition, a true adventure! Currently I’m greatly under the spell of the first explorers to the Polar regions. I live just ten minutes away from the RRS Discovery, the glorious tall ship that sailed both the Arctic and Antarctic with heroes such as Captain Scott and Shackleton on board. There’s a rich archive of vintage photographs, films, logbooks, diaries, books and original polar. I’m engrossed in research and connecting with some of our very own modern day explorers.

 


How does the crowdfunding work?

If you feel you would like to help and support my participation on this Arctic experience, I would be grateful for any small or larger donation, any gift is gracefully accepted. As a token of appreciation I would love to offer you a memento of my expedition, in the form of a digital photograph, a Giclée art print (postcard, A5 or A4), a digital copy of my daily logbook, original one of a kind burned photographic artwork (to be handpicked after the expedition). And a few bespoke items like;  a ‘souvenir’ artwork from the Arctic,  a glass plate- or fine art photo session (at an exceptional price).  See Perks! 

If you choose not to donate but would like to support, please share this crowdfunding page in your circles, I’m grateful for any additional exposure.

 

Original Darkroom door on the RRS Discovery   


What do I need funding for?

£ 4.500,-  expedition costs
£ 1.340,-  travel and accommodation expenses 
£ 2.450,-  extreme weather clothing, photography gear, and art supplies 
£    500,-  additional research costs, use of archival material. 
Minimum needed £8.790,-   

£ 1.375,-   additional personal costs, including household and an extra tour in Svalbard
Target full expedition costs (minus already received funding)  £9.415,- 

 

Stretch-goals
With extra funding I will be able to set new goals as follows:
I would love to support the RRS Discovery Tall Ship in Dundee. An addition to the ship would be to help build an original darkroom on board, as it was during the first Scott voyage to the Antarctic in 1901. This expedition carried out scientific research and geographical exploration. It launched the careers of many of the leading figures in the heroic age of Polar exploration.

 

 

Already part funded!

As part of the residency The Arctic Circle partners have already invested half of the costs of the voyage to help me.  I have also received sponsorship from Creative Scotland, Fife council, Fife Cultural Trust, Fife Contemporary, thanks to the Visual Artist And Craftmaker Award 2018. This has been deducted from the total needed. 

 

 

Why fund this project?

What is exciting about The Arctic Circle Expedition is the unique collaboration between artists and scientists. This annual expedition has been garnering international attention since 2008 and widespread support from arts and science institutions worldwide.

The expedition provides a rich environment serving the creative exploration of our world and raising awareness. It also offers a platform that encourages the participants to contribute through presentations, publications and art exhibits. With an extensive network I’m looking forward to these public engagement opportunities and new exhibitions that will reach a new audience worldwide.

 

Risks and challenges

Okay, so I’ll be flying up to the tippy-top of the world, the last bit of land in sight.  Then sailing on a Barquentine tall ship through frozen lands and icy waters. There will be possibility of bad weather and minus 20-degree temperatures. We’ll enjoy daytrips to and from the ship on smaller vessels and may have encounters with polar bears and other wildlife. All in all, the voyage is not without danger.
Of course we will be well prepared with adequate cold weather clothing, warm cabins and will be in the good hands of a capable captain and crew taking care of our safe passage at all times.  

 

Other ways you can support and stay in the loop

Please do share this campaign if you can with the Indigogo link. 
Follow my journey as I prepare for my upcoming trip to the Arctic via my Facebook link at the top of the page!

 

Thank you for reading and for your support!

The Svalbard Archipelago is just ten degrees from the North Pole! The Arctic Circle’s Mission is to create a unique platform where art intersects science. “An incubator for thought and experimentation for artists and innovators who seek out and foster areas of collaboration to engage in the central issues of our time”. The Arctic Circle also supports the artist’s professional development through public speaking, publication and exhibit opportunities.  And they engage with the community through outreach programming which has a focus on an inter-disciplinary exchange of ideas in the arts and sciences. Some affiliations include: Alliance of Artist Communities; New York Academy of Sciences; Art & Science Collaborations, Inc. (ASCI); American Association of Museums (AAM); Res Artis; Artist Residency Association ARCUS, Arctic Research Consortium, Norwegian Polar Institute; and UNIS, The University Center in Svalbard.  Who am I?I’m a visual artist currently living in Scotland. I was born in beautiful Vancouver, Canada, and have also lived in England and the Netherlands.For decades I’ve been a professional fine art photographer, and am lucky enough to have won awards and been published, I moved to Scotland in 2015 to explore my other life long loves; Art, as I was accepted at one of the top schools of art in Europe, Duncan of Jordanstone in Dundee.I loved this learning experience and gave it my all, it brought out the very best in me and am very proud to say I not only went on to achieve a Masters in Art and Humanities with distinction but also an academic achievement and a citizens award!  But most flatteringly I was awarded a two-year residency at the Duncan of Jordanstone Art school. What is my art form?Most of my art is photography and philosophy inspired and I love pioneering new forms of photographic imagery, working in sculpture, installation and film.My artwork is about our transient, fleeting nature as human beings, and the ephemeral nature of our beautiful earth. My work is inspired by the magic and meaning of a photograph, and I’m captivated by early, vintage photography and archival materials. The Art Studio on the RRS Discovery, as during the first voyage What art will I work on in the Arctic?Being process-oriented, I am always inspired in the moment and my practice takes off from there. I will most certainly be in ‘observation mode’; recording and documenting as much as humanly possible through means of photography and video, aiming to give you a great account of what it is like to be on an expedition. I’ll be keeping a daily logbook that I will process into a digital book once returned. I will also be working on a new body of work during the expedition and anticipate having enough material to inspire me to more creations once back on land. If you are curious, check my links to more of my artwork (see bottom of page).  My personal missionHaving a love for art, photography and for living in awareness, I’m eager to make a difference on this beautiful planet we live on. I’m curious to collaborate and excited about the inter-disciplinary exchange we are being offered through this residency, it’s a unique opportunity to share ideas with the scientists and artists on the ship.Furthermore I am passionate about the whole idea of going on an expedition, a true adventure! Currently I’m greatly under the spell of the first explorers to the Polar regions. I live just ten minutes away from the RRS Discovery, the glorious tall ship that sailed both the Arctic and Antarctic with heroes such as Captain Scott and Shackleton on board. There’s a rich archive of vintage photographs, films, logbooks, diaries, books and original polar. I’m engrossed in research and connecting with some of our very own modern day explorers. How does the crowdfunding work?If you feel you would like to help and support my participation on this Arctic experience, I would be grateful for any small or larger donation, any gift is gracefully accepted. As a token of appreciation I would love to offer you a memento of my expedition, in the form of a digital photograph, a Giclée art print (postcard, A5 or A4), a digital copy of my daily logbook, original one of a kind burned photographic artwork (to be handpicked after the expedition). And a few bespoke items like;  a ‘souvenir’ artwork from the Arctic,  a glass plate- or fine art photo session (at an exceptional price).  See Perks! If you choose not to donate but would like to support, please share this crowdfunding page in your circles, I’m grateful for any additional exposure. Original Darkroom door on the RRS Discovery   What do I need funding for?£ 4.500,-  expedition costs£ 1.340,-  travel and accommodation expenses £ 2.450,-  extreme weather clothing, photography gear, and art supplies £    500,-  additional research costs, use of archival material. Minimum needed £8.790,-   £ 1.375,-   additional personal costs, including household and an extra tour in SvalbardTarget full expedition costs (minus already received funding)  £9.415,-  Stretch-goalsWith extra funding I will be able to set new goals as follows:I would love to support the RRS Discovery Tall Ship in Dundee. An addition to the ship would be to help build an original darkroom on board, as it was during the first Scott voyage to the Antarctic in 1901. This expedition carried out scientific research and geographical exploration. It launched the careers of many of the leading figures in the heroic age of Polar exploration.  Already part funded!As part of the residency The Arctic Circle partners have already invested half of the costs of the voyage to help me.  I have also received sponsorship from Creative Scotland, Fife council, Fife Cultural Trust, Fife Contemporary, thanks to the Visual Artist And Craftmaker Award 2018. This has been deducted from the total needed.   Why fund this project?What is exciting about The Arctic Circle Expedition is the unique collaboration between artists and scientists. This annual expedition has been garnering international attention since 2008 and widespread support from arts and science institutions worldwide.The expedition provides a rich environment serving the creative exploration of our world and raising awareness. It also offers a platform that encourages the participants to contribute through presentations, publications and art exhibits. With an extensive network I’m looking forward to these public engagement opportunities and new exhibitions that will reach a new audience worldwide. Risks and challengesOkay, so I’ll be flying up to the tippy-top of the world, the last bit of land in sight.  Then sailing on a Barquentine tall ship through frozen lands and icy waters. There will be possibility of bad weather and minus 20-degree temperatures. We’ll enjoy daytrips to and from the ship on smaller vessels and may have encounters with polar bears and other wildlife. All in all, the voyage is not without danger.Of course we will be well prepared with adequate cold weather clothing, warm cabins and will be in the good hands of a capable captain and crew taking care of our safe passage at all times.   Other ways you can support and stay in the loopPlease do share this campaign if you can with the Indigogo link. Follow my journey as I prepare for my upcoming trip to the Arctic via my Facebook link at the top of the page! Thank you for reading and for your support!

story:
Speed Dating Round 1…! (An Introduction to the Project)

The Sable Dragonfly is a multimedia production that emphasizes the black female body and her experiences lived through her skin. Expressed through Sakile Odimo’s artistic voice from her own personal experiences as a black woman, this project will highlight the mystery, majesty, beauty, vulnerability, and tribulations it takes to maneuver this society as a black female. In a time where society is beginning to see the repercussions of turning a blind eye to those who are marginalized and underrepresented, this project’s purpose is to not only give the black woman a voice, but to create awareness for others to see why it is so important to break down stereotypes, oppression, and sexism surrounding a people and to create a culture that truly protects and values black women.

Our writer and director, Sakile Odimo has been writing poetry since the age of 6 and is twice published. In 2017 she wrote, produced, and directed #MelaninRich, during her summer CCCP program at UCLA. Her and the poem were both featured in the art gallery and show “We Real Cool” at Los Angeles’ art gallery Junior High.  “The Sable Dragonfly: An Ode To My Black Female Body” is a larger more advantages project similar to #MelaninRich as it is a visual chapbook that focuses on the black female body & how it's regarded within space. Told in four parts, “From My Eyes” “From Their Eyes” “From My Mouth” “From Their Mouth” the film and art installation will be a visual representation, told through one black woman’s experiences to give a tangible feeling as to what it means to be a black woman. The goal of both the film and the art instillation is to provide a safe space for the black female body and soul to move and interact with space and herself freely in an authentic way.

There’s No Such Thing As a Free Lunch! (Production Costs and Perks, Why We Need Your Money!)

We need to raise 3500 dollars to cover production costs, film equipment, printing and manufacturing costs for both the chapbooks (the collection of all the poems and testimonials in The Sable Dragonfly), and for the photo stills that will hang in the art gallery on the night of the premiere and art instillation. These funds will also go towards paying the cast and crew. Every penny helps in making this project a reality and everyone apart of the project appreciates anything you can donate!

 

Perks for every donation include-

5 Donation: An emailed thank you from the cast and crew!

20 Donation: A personal thank you shout-out at the end of that week’s bts video.  

25 Donation: A personalized singing gram from the cast and crew.

30 Donation: A personalized animated caricature made by our esteemed Assistant Director Brandon Swofford!

50 Donation: All of the above, including a coffee date with wonderful director and our head captain Sakile, to further discuss the film, art installation and of course, have a good cup of joe.

100 Donation: Choice of the 50 or 30 dollar donation perk plus a signed copy of the complete Sable Dragonfly Chapbook that will be hand delivered on the night of the art instillation.  

150 Donation:  Choice of 50 or 100 dollar donation perk, plus an executive producer credit in the film…(Yes you’ll get IMDB credits...because this is Hollywood baby!)

500 Donation:  150 Donation perk AND you get to be Sakile’s personal date to the premiere at Art Share LA. You will also receive a copy of your favorite print from the art instillation to immortalize our wonderful night together.  ​

story:
The Project:

    Six to eight individuals with mental illness will have a part of their body, that has been affected by a specific mental illness, molded and reproduced in hyper-realistic sculpture

The sculptures will represent the stories and struggles of these brave men and women and how mental illness has affected them, not just mentally, but physically as well. Each sculpture will have a written component by the participant on how theirs lives have been changed by mental illness. It will all be shown during an immersive gallery exhibit during mental health awareness month, May 2021.

Through my battle with depression, I have always been an artist, with a topic that resonates so deeply within myself, I hope to bring to life a memorable and informative depiction of the effects mental illness can have on the body.

Currently seeking models with mental illness!

Interested in being a model? Click here.

My Story:

     I will never forget one night after work; I cried, screamed, balled my eyes out while driving to get home in one piece only to stop and say I had enough, finally deciding to go through with my plan to end my life. I pulled over on the backroad, grabbed the glass bottle I had, opened the door, smashed it on the pavement, shined a light to find the sharpest piece, and you could imagine what happened next, but to my surprise headlights shined and on went the flashing lights. 

Panicking, I got back into my car, eyes red, nose runny, and heart-pounding only to tell the cop who appeared out of thin air to "fuck off and leave me alone." He argued with me while I tried to deny what was going on and the action I was planning to take. Taking the usual documents, he cleared them, handed them back, I closed my window and left. Still extremely upset and angry, I parked closer to home to try again, only this time unable to follow through. 

In the following weeks, I had finally decided it was time to change the miserable life I had been living for the past six years. My life had come with its wonderful moments and grateful artistic accomplishments, but I had drowned in my mind far more times than I can count. Within the last two years, I focused on improving my mental health, with the help of therapy, medication, and healthy eating, and am extremely grateful for how far I've come; to finally have a positive outlook on life.

But in all honesty, this brief description does not begin to the describe the pain and suffering brought forth from the years I battled with Depression, Anxiety and Obsessive Compulsion Disorder; the ups and the downs, the being emotionally drained day after day, the hoping that each and every day you wake would be your last, it was never fun, it was torture.

I'm sure it has been the same for many others, but I believe with open, honest, and lasting conversation, we can change the stigma around mental illness.

The Impact:

With what will be a jarring and eye opening event, I hope to bring together a community who will help continue the conversation; helping to educate others and lowering the stigma. To everyone who sees the exhibit, I hope for you to leave with a deeper understanding of the impact mental health and illness can have on a person.

With help from you and the power of awareness, the stigma associated with mental health can be eliminated. Awareness and education can cause a flood of positive effects with in our community and our world; it is key to helping the uniformed understand what mental health and mental illness is. 

Understanding the signs of mental illness can be a first step in finding the support thats needed. Knowing that stigma and discrimination are fueled by ignorance and misinformation you have the ability to educate yourself and others. You can create change.

 

The Facts:

Suicide is the 2nd leading cause of death among people aged 10-34.

47.6 million adults and 7.7 million youth ages 6-17, within the United States, experience mental illness, but there continues to be a stigma around it. 

Mental illnesses can affect people of any age, race, religion, or income. A mental illness is a medical condition that disrupts a person’s thinking, feeling, mood, and ability to relate to others and daily functioning.

Common signs of mental health issues include: extreme mood swings, changes in eating habits, excessive worrying or fear, problems concentrating, and avoiding friends or social activities.

Many people do not seek treatment for mental illness due to the associated stigma. Only 44% of adults with diagnosable mental illnesses receive treatment.

70-90% of people who seek proper treatment for mental health disorders witness a significant reduction in symptoms.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get:

  • Funding for 
    • Materials and supplies
    • Flyers and posters to promote the project and event.

Choose the perks you want:

  • Sticker Pack of 3:
    • Mental health Matters sticker designed by Jill Wagner 
    • Sun beam sticker designed by Martino Lasalandra 
    • Under the Skin sticker 
    • Stickers are approximately 4" x 4"
  • T-Shirt:
    • Unisex black t-shirt with the under the skin logo printed on the front.
  • Digital Photo Book:
    • Contains high quality images of the the sculptures and the stories associated with each.
    • Please be sure to fill out shipping information to receive download link.
  • Printed Photo Book:
    • This physical photo book contains high quality images of each sculpture along with the associated story. It also includes other behind the scenes content not included in the digital version.
  • MBSR- Meditation Workshop:
    • ​​A 25 minute guided meditation taught by Sarah White, a Licensed Mental Health Counselor and Certified Yoga Instructor. She specialize in Trauma Recovery utilizing psychotherapy and MBSR- Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction, a type of meditation.
    • Utilizing sound and aromatherapy to guide you through meditation helping  you get to know the brilliance that lies within our emotions.
    • During this guided meditation, Sarah will teach you how to listen and befriend the nervous system. Moving out of a locked in pattern of fight flight or freeze and into ease.
    • For more details on Sarah's workshop please visit: daniel-mcquade.com/sarahwhite
    • *DATE  & LOCATION TBA
    • *Please be sure to fill out shipping information so you can be contacted about the workshop.
  • Hand Casting Kit by Luna Bean:
    • Using similar techniques used in creating each sculpture this unique rubbery mold captures every detail for a perfect one-of-a-kind gift. The Luna Bean casting kit makes a fun and memorable gift activity for families, couples holding hands, and friends to create a priceless memory.
    • Everything you need to create your one-of-a-kind hand casting statue is included in the kit.
  • Full head life-cast:
    • Life casting is a process widely used in the special effects makeup world of the Film & TV industry to create realistic effects of other peoples body's and also a technique used in Under the Skin to create the sculptures. 
    • Skin-safe silicone is applied to the entire head leaving the nostrils open for breathing; it is then cured and removed, this process generally take less than 45 minutes.  Once removed the negative mold ( the imprinted copy of your face in silicone) will be filled with stone. Once the stone has cured we will de-mold the stone and your copy will be complete!! This is generally not recommended for people who are claustrophobic. 
    • Limited quantity of 4!
    • Please be sure to fill out shipping information so you can be contacted about setting up a date and time for your life-cast.

daniel-mcquade.com/perks 

 

 

This project is funded in part by the Orange County Arts Council’s Community Arts Grants!

 

 

Stages:

 

  1. Life-Casting:
    • a process that involves taking a mold of a body part with a skin safe silicone.
  2. Clay pour:
    • a process that involves pouring molten clay into the life-cast to create a rough copy of the sculpture
  3. Refining the sculpture:
    • adding/fixing details in clay with sculpture tools.
  4. Fiberglass Molding:
    • a process that involves take the final sculpture and creating a mold with fiberglass to later cast in silicone.
  5. Silicone Casting:
    •  a process that involves taking the fiberglass mold and casting in it with skin colored silicone.
  6. Painting realistic skin tones and adding final details. 
  7. Set up for the gallery exhibit!!! May 2021.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Share your story. Have you personally struggled or currently struggle with mental illness? Don’t hesitate to tell friends and family about it. Your story can encourage others to ask for help.

  • Learn the signs and symptoms of depression. Know what to watch for in yourself and those around you. Symptoms can be different in men and women.

  • Learn what to do when someone threatens suicide. Visit StopASuicide.org to be prepared. If someone is in a dangerous situation, just call 9-1-1.

  • Share mental health screening sites on your social media channels

    • https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/tests/health/mental-health-assessment

    • https://www.psycom.net/quizzes

    • https://screening.mhanational.org/screening-tools

story:
Animal Spirits of the Apocalypse Oracle Deck

Hello, my name is Leiana, also known as Loveday. I am a Louisiana based artist and I make weird art for weird people. 

I am also a fortune teller. I've been reading the cards for over thirty years. I come from a long line of women that dabbled in the spiritual.

Since the beginning of this pandemic, all the markets and festivals that I would ordinarily sell my art work at have been cancelled, leaving me unemployed and with nothing definitive to do.

So what does an artist do in the quiet at the end of the world? She combines all her skills and creates an Oracle Deck.

What does it all mean

One of the most exciting aspects of creating an Oracle deck is that it's a complete blank slate. I am starting fresh but also tapping into the long tradition of spirit animals and shamanism that have their roots in most ancient tribal societies, including the Celtic history that I find myself most drawn to.

I approached the Animal Spirits of the Apocalypse from a playful point of view.

38 cards. 19 x 2 is 38 (Covid 19).

I've been in quarantine for over 30 days.

Four Suits: The Spiky, the Dead, the Visionary, and the Tentacled

Nine cards in each suit PLUS two joker cards: The Sanitizer and The TP.

As I said, playful point of view, but even in play we can tap into a deeper truth.

The Cards designs are all finished

The deck is ready to go to the printer as soon as I have the funds together to order them. Production time should be no more than two to three months (with a little leeway for the ongoing pandemic)

Anything you can give would be appreciated. Perks start at $5 with a downloadable PDF that tells you all about the Animal Spirits of the Apocalypse.

Even if you could just spread the word. Please tell all your friends: the ones that like weird things, who like weird art, the ones who like crystals, the ones who like Tarot decks, the ones who like anything pagan or New Age.

Please use the Indigogo share tools and help spread the word about my Oracle deck.
story_txt:
Animal Spirits of the Apocalypse Oracle Deck
Hello, my name is Leiana, also known as Loveday. I am a Louisiana based artist and I make weird art for weird people. 
I am also a fortune teller. I've been reading the cards for over thirty years. I come from a long line of women that dabbled in the spiritual.
Since the beginning of this pandemic, all the markets and festivals that I would ordinarily sell my art work at have been cancelled, leaving me unemployed and with nothing definitive to do.
So what does an artist do in the quiet at the end of the world? She combines all her skills and creates an Oracle Deck.

What does it all mean
One of the most exciting aspects of creating an Oracle deck is that it's a complete blank slate. I am starting fresh but also tapping into the long tradition of spirit animals and shamanism that have their roots in most ancient tribal societies, including the Celtic history that I find myself most drawn to.
I approached the Animal Spirits of the Apocalypse from a playful point of view.
38 cards. 19 x 2 is 38 (Covid 19).
I've been in quarantine for over 30 days.
Four Suits: The Spiky, the Dead, the Visionary, and the Tentacled
Nine cards in each suit PLUS two joker cards: The Sanitizer and The TP.
As I said, playful point of view, but even in play we can tap into a deeper truth.

The Cards designs are all finished

The deck is ready to go to the printer as soon as I have the funds together to order them. Production time should be no more than two to three months (with a little leeway for the ongoing pandemic)
Anything you can give would be appreciated. Perks start at $5 with a downloadable PDF that tells you all about the Animal Spirits of the Apocalypse.
Even if you could just spread the word. Please tell all your friends: the ones that like weird things, who like weird art, the ones who like crystals, the ones who like Tarot decks, the ones who like anything pagan or New Age.
Please use the Indigogo share tools and help spread the word about my Oracle deck.

story:
Kort Om Bogen

Velkommen til min crowdfunding kampagne for bogen ‘Nuttede Dyr’. Planen med denne bog er at lave en farvelagt børnebog med hjælp fra dig. Denne bog indeholder 80 sider ialt. 40 farverige sider med de ‘Nuttede Dyr’ og 40 sider med sort/hvide tegninger og sjove tilhørende historier, som du som læser kan farvelægge og være medforfatter på. Bogen bliver skabt sammen med dig der støtter via instagram profilen emiloscar_cph. Håber i vil lege med. De bedste hilsner Emil Oscar. 

 

Om Projektet

Hej jeg hedder Emil Oscar jeg er en designer og børnebogsforfatter bosiddende i København.

  • Denne kampagne omhandler udgivelsen af min børnebog der bærer titlen ‘Nuttede Dyr’.
  • Jeg vil invitere bidragsydere med på rejsen hele vejen og tilbyde unikt indhold til de som støtter.

  • Bogen 'Nuttede Dyr', indeholder en farverig børnebog, med en dertilhørende malebog. Deluxe versionen indeholder et add on på adskillige sider med eksklusivt content.

Det der skal til

  • Drømmescenariet for denne kampagne er at skaffe nok midler til to bøger, disse skal trykkes i et yderst begrænset oplag
  • De bøger er i som læsere med til at sætte jeres præg på, jeg vil vende idéer og koncepter med jer løbende
  • Ved at støtte kampagnen kan du erhverve dig unikt indhold: Unikke kopper, plakater, t-shirts, bøgerne samt andet lækkert merch.

Målet

  • Drømmen med denne kampagne er at beslutningsprocesserne også kommer i hænderne på de der støtter kampagnen og i er med som medskabere på bogen via facebook
  • Såfremt jeg når målet med kampagnen, kan de der støtter ende med at stå med en unik børnebog i hånden
  • Bøgerne bliver kun trykt i et yderst begrænset oplag

Alle i som kunne tænke jer at støtte op, kan også støtte med symbolske beløber her på siden.

Jeg håber i har lyst til, at deltage i kampagnen og støtte min næste udgivelse.

De bedste hilsner 

Emil Oscar

story:
Laser Cut Art- Fund Raising !

Hi. I'm Jeewaka.. passionate artist form Beautiful Island call . SRI LANKA !

Making art is my passion. I'm obsessed with digital art. And once i found out the laser cutting technology it gave me new dimension to think  

 

I'm making digital artworks for over 2 years now. I used to cut them from a shop in Colombo

But it was too expensive to cut them and make experiments with different designs .

So i decided to buy a laser cutter. 2 months back i bought CO2 laser machine. it was a awesome experience to have a laser cutter in hand while making the designs. 

Problems with machine !

After cutting about 2 weeks I realize that the machine bed size is too small 12 inch by 24 inch.  And Laser power ( 50W ) is too low cut differed wood materials.

I had to divide my designs in to 2,3 or even more to fit the design to laser machine bed.

 

Why crowd funding!

I decided to get support form the art lovers all over the world. 

So all my designs will be give as a reward for backers of my project.

 

After successfully raising fund i will buy Big laser machine from Laser Machine Supplier In Colombo and Start to cut reward perks As soon as funding is complete

 

I have calculated all the material cost, shipping and handling  and add to each perk.

I ship WORLD WIDE for FREE !!!! 

 

Art Works

Each art work is Cut in separate layers and glued by hand. All the art works are varnished frames and ready to hang on arrival

 

 

Contact Me

 

https://www.facebook.com/Monarchlaser

 

How it is Made!

story:
Join us NOW in this opportunity to become part of our Next Great Maker family!

(Ermmmm, what’s in it for me?)

In addition to getting in at the onset of an exciting journey, there is the immediate yahooey of prizes and rewards!

Create, reinvent, repurpose in a magical VR experience where your limitless imagination and participation are table stakes to flourish in a world of zero waste.

The story of the Next Great Makers circles on two unlikely heroes, Shalla and Zeke. Zeke lives with his family in Future City, a place where junk and creativity are outlawed. And Shalla who inhabits the forbidden Badlands beyond the walls of Future City. The Badlands, however, is a multifaceted and amazing world where all of Future City’s discarded “junk” is alive!

Our quest is to bring the magic of the Next Great Makers to all audiences with streaming content,  incredible augmented reality adventures and fully immersive virtual reality experiences.

And this where YOU come in! YOU and all the incredible makers like YOU can make this vision a reality. How? By contributing to our Indiegogo campaign! YOU can help us add interactive characters to our world as we develop a 2min animated featuring more characters, more imagination, and if we are lucky, some of your creations! Not to mention the prizes if you contribute now!

Please contribute to our campaign and become part of the Next Great Maker family! Here’s the work left to do: help us secure the full funding necessary to bring the Next Great Maker to the market for the joy of millions.

To get a sneak peek, check out the campaign video.

Big thanks and LET’S GO!

story:
Overview:

What better way to experience the ten principals of Burning Man than to climb upon a glorious 12-foot tall trophy and celebrate your incredible accomplishments, whatever the they may be.

 

Moop-picker uppers… climb up on top.

You helped a neighbor camp build their monkey hut?… step up that ladder!

You walked all the way out to the trash fence and back?!?! Holy shit, make your way up there!

 

By raising $17,000, we’ll reconstruct a trophy fifteen times larger than the one that likely stood on a mantel, way back in your childhood.

 

If each of us 70,000 Burning Man attendees simply donate 25¢ a piece, we’ll fund this grand project and get started. Seeing as that’ll probably be a challenge, we’re asking all friends and passionate Playa dwellers to donate as much as they’d like. We even have a series of gifts, typical for these types of crowdfunding projects.

 

Please check out the video, click to donate and also spread it to your friends. Much love to you all.

 

 

Why We Want To Build This:

We’ve been going to Burning Man for years and love abiding by the ten principles. We also enjoy the art projects that are incomplete without someone interacting with them. For example, like the Playa Barbie box and the DaVinci wings you climb upon. This will be the first large scale project we’ve brought but we’ve been a part of several Playa projects and also have experience building large scale projects in the default world.

 

 

If This Is Successful:

If this is successful, we’ll continue to add to the collection of trophies year after year and eventually have our own massive trophy shelf on the Playa. Seeing as this year’s theme is Metamorphosis, this trophy’s theme is ‘MOST IMPROVED’. And the following trophies for each year will also tie into that year’s theme.

story:
The Tarot of the Grand Pas

I created The Tarot of the Grand Pas because I wanted to find a deck that completely resonated with my soul and what I'm passionate about. Ballet has been a part of my life since I was 2 years old and it means the world to me, so I decided to combine a few of my passions together in order to create something that feels personal to me but that could also exist for the benefit of others.

I am so excited to finally be launching this campaign to bring this concept to life! Thank you so much for your interest and your contributions.

What You Can Get

78 2.75"x 4.75" Cardstock, Linen Finished Tarot Cards - 22 Major Arcanas and 56 Minor Arcanas
Hand made specialty cotton drawstring bag
Booklet including each card's description and meaning
6.8"x 12" Photographic Print of a major arcana of your choice
3"x 4" Matte vinyl sticker of a major arcana of your choice

How You Can Help 

Contributions go toward creating the full deck, hand made bags, other printed products, and a booklet. Potentially, a box could be an addition to the deck. I have a flexible goal because any amount helps!

If you cannot contribute monetarily, please consider sharing my campaign on your social media platforms! I would appreciate it so much.

story:
⊹✦ Introduction ✦⊹

Hey there, my name is Samuel, and I am a young artist from Portugal! I'm so happy and grateful you are taking the time to check my Pokémon pin campaign! I've always loved art and video games, so I decided to combine them both and create enamel pins. This is my first time creating pins and doing a campaign on Indiegogo! After the campaign, I'll create an Etsy shop, but currently, you can follow me on my Instagram account to receive news about future projects and also see some of my art: @ratui.art

⊹✦ How it works ✦⊹

This will be a flexible funding campaign, meaning if I don't reach the 500€ goal ill still produce and ship the pins. The best plan is to reach the main goal, or at least 400€ so that I have minimum funding for the pins. After the campaign, I'll open an Etsy shop, but in the meanwhile, you can follow me on Instagram to get updates and news about future projects: @ratui.art

⊹✦ The Pins ✦⊹

**the pin is only the pokemon, as shown on the top, the rest is the backing card**

⊹✦ Each pin will ✦⊹

~ Be made of hard enamel

~ Have a gold plated finish

~ Be 5 cm

~ Be secure with two rubber clutch attachments

~ Include a costume backing card

~ Be back stamped with my signature

⊹✦ Risks and challenges ✦⊹

There might be a slight variation in the colour (due to screen colour calibration) and size of the mould, however, these will be minor. I will also check each pin for small errors, so no need to worry! The shipping may also delay due to the current world situation. I will keep in contact with the backers via updates in case of any questions or problems surge. The shipping is already included in the pledge. Customs fees may apply when sending your package, I am not responsible for these costs, which remain at your charge. Thank you for understanding.

story:
What am I doing?

I am a midwestern photographer living and working in Kansas City. I am a senior in photography at the Kansas City Art Institute. This exhibition is a culmination of my four years at this school. With this money, I am hoping to meet my goals of creating the best exhibition I could ever have. My thesis exhibition, which is called Visual Mind, will be my first show featuring the photography I have done this past two years. This thesis exhibition will need a lot of funding. As a graduating student, this show will help push me into the art community as an artist and an individual.

What is the money for?

I am asking for $3000. This money will go towards catering and drinks for the opening reception, hanging materials, framing, mounting, and promotional materials. I would really love your help and have a couple of donation gifts, as well. 

$5 - Three Visual Mind stickers

$15 - A mini book containing images from Visual Mind

$25 - All of the above + the Visual Mind book 

$50 - All of the above + a signed, limited edition print from Visual Mind

$100 - Stickers, mini book, a signed print + a signed, limited edition Visual Mind book

$250 - Stickers, mini book, a signed print + a signed hardcover Visual Mind book

This donation would help so much. If you can not donate, then I would love it if you shared this video on Facebook. Any amount helps!

Exhibition Show:

Visual Mind

April 24th - 25th

Opening Reception

Friday, April 24th: 6 - 10PM

&

Saturday, April 25th: 7 - 10PM

The Gustin Bacon Building

1417 W 11th St. 

Kansas City, MO 64101


Check Out:

paulalokshinphotography.tumblr.com for the progress of the show

cargocollective.com/PaulaLokshin

story:
Donations can still be made directly on our site: http://counterarchives.org/6-contribute-to-the-project/


Counter-archives to the Narco-city

This is a curatorial project on art+human rights that seeks to make visible the underlying structures and experiences of everyday life in cities beholden to narco-economies along the Latin American-U.S. industrial and migration corridor. Our goal with Counter-archives to the Narco City / Contra-archivos de la ciudad del narco is to offer alternative views to the dominant discourse and spectacularization of narco-violence and human rights abuses in the Americas.


Opening this Fall, from August 16 to December 18, at the University of Notre Dame’s Snite Museum of Art and the Notre Dame Center for Art & Culture, the first edition of Counter-archives will feature the work of Adriana Corral and Alma Leiva on Ciudad Juárez in Mexico and San Pedro Sula in Honduras.

We have partnered with Copilot Press to design and publish a limited run of 1000 catalogues with full color reproductions. Contributors to the catalogue include essays by Sociology professor Gilberto Cardenas, UN's Human Rights defender and Law professor Ariel Dulitzky, and Latino literature professor Marisel Moreno, as well as two curatorial essays on the art historical narratives behind the exhibit's artistic projects. Catalogues will be donated to libraries, museums, and cultural centers in the U.S., Latin America, and Europe.

But we need your help to make this important art+human rights project possible. Your support will help us with fulfilling two crucial aspects of the project:

  • Publishing a bilingual exhibition catalogue
  • Raising additional funds for the exhibit's second iteration at Balzer Art Projects in Basel, Switzerland.

A small donation is just as important to our goal as a larger amount.

  • For your $10 contribution your name will be included in our acknowledgment list on our website.
  • A $25 donation will also get you a digital copy of the catalogue.
  • For a $50 donation, you will receive a print copy of the catalogue by mail.
  • At the $100 level, you will receive a special limited art edition by Adriana Corral and Alma Leiva.
  • For $500 you will receive a special limited art edition and sponsorship credit in the catalogue.

For more information please visit our website, http://counterarchives.org/. On this site, we also host short articles, interviews, artwork, creative writing, and audiovisual materials by fellow artists, journalists, writers, and scholars committed to art+human rights.

Thank you for your interest! We feel honored to have your support and look forward to seeing this exhibition’s contribution to further developing a transnational dialogue between art and human rights.

-Tatiana Reinoza and Luis Vargas-Santiago, co-curators

the University of Notre Dame’s Snite Museum of Art and the Notre Dame Center
for Art & Culture, the first edition of Counter-archives will feature the
work of Adriana Corral and Alma Leiva on Ciudad Juárez in Mexico and San Pedro
Sula in Honduras. We have partnered with Copilot Press to design and publish a limited run of 1000 catalogues with full color reproductions. Contributors to the catalogue include essays by Sociology professor Gilberto Cardenas, UN's Human Rights defender and Law professor Ariel Dulitzky, and Latino literature professor Marisel Moreno, as well as two curatorial essays on the art historical narratives behind the exhibit's artistic projects. Catalogues will be donated to libraries, museums, and cultural centers in the U.S., Latin America, and Europe.
But we need your help to make this important art+human rights project possible. Your support will help us with fulfilling two crucial aspects of the project:

 Publishing a
bilingual exhibition catalogue 


Raising additional funds for the exhibit's second iteration
at Balzer Art Projects in Basel, Switzerland.

A small donation is just as important to our goal as a larger amount. 

For your $10 contribution your name will be included in our acknowledgment list on our website.
A $25 donation will also get you a digital copy of the catalogue.
For a $50 donation, you will receive a print copy of the catalogue by mail. 

At the $100 level, you will receive a special limited art edition by Adriana Corral and Alma Leiva. 

For $500 you will receive a special limited art edition and sponsorship credit in the catalogue.

For more information please visit our website, http://counterarchives.org/. On this site, we also host short articles, interviews, artwork, creative writing, and audiovisual materials by fellow artists, journalists, writers, and scholars committed to art+human rights.
Thank you for your interest! We feel honored to have your support and look forward to seeing this exhibition’s contribution to further developing a transnational dialogue between art and human rights.
-Tatiana Reinoza and Luis Vargas-Santiago, co-curators

story:
We are raising money to Incorporate Ardor Creative Media as a Non-Profit in the State of Washington.

We have been running a weekly event Seattle Free Art Fridays with love, fumes and our own personal pocket change. We would like to create more events that welcome artists of all levels, all mediums (Films, Paintings, Gaming, etc.!) and ages to showcase their works. To be filled in on events happening please join our Bi-Weekly Newsletter.

We currently do not have the funds to incorporate as a non-profit so we may apply for grants in the state of Washington. Here is a breakdown of where the funds will be going:

$1,030 To Legal Zoom.

This is so we can incorporate as a non profit and have access to business lawyers that can make sure that we are going about things legally.

$120 To Gmail

This is so we can have our email services available for 1 year.

$550 Promotional Materials.

Stickers, Posters, business cards. Etc. All which will be available at events for free. Also for paid social media adverts through Twitter and Facebook.

story:
Short Summary

We are Nick Skrdla and Jack Vandergriff. We met in college and ever since we have been throwing business ideas at each other. After a long time of "what if's" we came up with an idea that we want to turn into a reality. The New Dimension Glass Art Museum & Medical Dispensary.

The New Dimension Glass Art Museum & Medical Dispensary will be the first of it's kind. The world of glass art is sadly an underground culture that needs to be noticed. So we want to open a dispensary where we showcase, not sell, these pieces of art in the waiting area. Most show  boring paid programming and blank walls. Though we will concentrate on mainly glass, there will be other forms of art showcased as well. On top the stimulating atmosphere we will provide our patients with the best scientific and medical information regarding the many benefits of medical marijuana. 

With your help, we can obtain the best medical resources to provide patients with the best medication in the best environment. Every time we go into a medical dispensary we see new patients. These people are not "stoners" or "hippies". They are every day people. Unfortunately due to the stigma, people are scared or discriminate against medical marijuana. The negative stereo type is slowly fading as medical studies continue to reveal positive effects.  

What We Need & What You Get

We have been in contact with lawyers and business advisers. The application for Arizona Department of Health Services (AZDHS) registration requires us to meet certain qualifications in order to operate. The application requires:

$150,000 -(our lawyer can get us approved with >$100,000)

Property owner approval signature. 

City official signature. 

Once registration is approved the funds raised can be used. We will proceed to purchase art work, medication, hire employees, lab testing of medications, and dispensing supplies. When we are ready to serve patients the health dept. will do another inspection and award our certificate of operation.

The Impact

The goal of New Dimension is to provide the best patient care a medical dispensary can. We are going to have a doctor give seminars twice a month open to the public. All batches of medications will be lab tested to ensure there are no pesticides, fungus, and the level of cbd's are to standard. CBD is the cancer fighting agent in the marijuana. The more donations we receive the better testing facilities we can use.

Since no artwork will be for sale it allows us to work with other local small business. We are also gathering artist interested in donating. The artist will have their name and what store their artwork can be purchased next to their donations. We have spread our reach throughout Phoenix. So far there are 5 local small businesses and 8 artists on board. For every piece of art we buy they will donate 1 of equal value.  

Risks & Challenges

Marijuana is still illegal on a federal level. Federal agencies, however, have released statements to let dispensaries operate as long as they abide by state regulations. We have hired a lawyer specializing in medical dispensary rights to ensure compliance. The AZDHS won't be accepting applications till later in 2015. The Community Health Area Assessment (CHAA) are re-writing zoning laws to allow more dispensaries. We have a list of locations that will be fall under the new zoning, and our goal is to complete our application with time for review before the acceptance date. We want our application to be the first application submitted. The next step of approval is the state selection board. Our lawyer will be present to help secure our success. Once we pass the board we will have our certificate of registration and New Dimension will be established. If for any reason we are denied, all funds raised will be split between the American Cancer Society, American Association of Cancer Research, and the Make A Wish foundation. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with funds but still would like to help us with this movement, please tells your friends, family and neighbors about us and what we are trying to achieve. Also we are very open to new artists, if you or anyone you know are a glass blower and would like some free exposure. Feel free to contact us. We would be glad to meet with them.
